Sentence 3: I was at work when it started, and we all left to try to get home. Sentence 4: I did not get far before I had to turn around and go back.
target: I had to spend three days at the office by myself.

input: Title: Travis. Sentence 1: My cousin Travis came into my life 30 years ago. Sentence 2: He was adopted by a relative from a drug addicted mother. Sentence 3: He was told from that first day that he was adopted. Sentence 4: His new parents loved him dearly, and I considered him family.
target: He grew very quickly, and became a police officer.

input: Title: no electricity. Sentence 1: It rained hard and now John's apartment has no electricity. Sentence 2: John an avid tv watcher was bored. Sentence 3: His friend's were at work so he couldn't go out with them. Sentence 4: John remembered his mom gave him a book.
target: John read the book all day and was no longer bored.

input: Title: Crazy Cat. Sentence 1: We found a kitten sitting beside the dumpster. Sentence 2: It was pouring rain, cold, and the kitten looked miserable. Sentence 3: We took the kitten home and dried and fed it. Sentence 4: We could not decide what to name the cat, but it soon became apparent.
target: It's actions were comical, and we called it Crazy Cat.

input: Title: Rainy Halloween. Sentence 1: Emma was super excited for the Halloween pet parade. Sentence 2: When she woke up on Halloween it was pouring! Sentence 3: Her mom said she couldn't go to the parade. Sentence 4: She made her own parade with her stuffed animals!
target: It was still the best Halloween ever.

input: Title: help from everyone. Sentence 1: Pedro worked in a small diner. Sentence 2: When the diner had to close it was a tragedy in town. Sentence 3: Most locals had eaten there for the last twenty years. Sentence 4: To avoid its closure, they all pitched in.
target: And thanks to everyone, Pedro kept the diner open.

input: Title: bath time. Sentence 1: Dustin loved to play in the dirt. Sentence 2: He filled his dumptrucks up with dirt. Sentence 3: Then he would dump them on his head. Sentence 4: Dustin's mom was always yelling at him for making such a mess.
target: When Dustin was down he went straight to the tub to get clean.

input: Title: The Test. Sentence 1: Ron was writing as fast as he could. Sentence 2: The test was a lot longer than he expected. Sentence 3: He had studied all term and wanted to get as much in as he could. Sentence 4: Later that week he received the highest results in his class.
target: His parents took him out to dinner to celebrate.

input: Title: Imaginary sickness. Sentence 1: Finn was late for his doctor's appointment. Sentence 2: He sat in the waiting room and waited for his turn. Sentence 3: He spent all afternoon reading old magazines. Sentence 4: When the doctor finally called him, he was the last patient.
target: The doctor examined him but told him he wasn't sick at all.

input: Title: Public Humiliation. Sentence 1: Sam was out with friends. Sentence 2: He got thirsty and got water at a fountain. Sentence 3: The fountain was broken and sprayed his pants. Sentence 4: It looked like Sam peed himself.
target: Everyone made fun of him.

input: Title: Wine Grape. Sentence 1: Jodi was the owner of a very large vineyard. Sentence 2: She hired lots of people to help during harvest season. Sentence 3: Her latest batch of wine was special. Sentence 4: The wine she was making used a rare kind of grape.
target: Jodi wound up winning medals for her interesting wine.

input: Title: I broke a nail. Sentence 1: Kelly got her nails done. Sentence 2: She went to the local salon. Sentence 3: She got them painted red. Sentence 4: The only bad thing was that one broke.
target: Kelly was so upset.

input: Title: Story Telling. Sentence 1: Maurice was writing a novel. Sentence 2: But he was stuck on the first page. Sentence 3: He didn't know if he should start with In or Once. Sentence 4: In the beginning, or Once Upon a Time.
target: He decided to write In the beginning once upon a time.

input: Title: Hairy Black Lab Bath Clog. Sentence 1: Joe decided that his dog needed a bath. Sentence 2: Joe's dog was a big hairy black lab. Sentence 3: The dog had so much hair that he clogged the drain. Sentence 4: Joe had no way to fish out the stuck hair in the drain.
target: He ended up having to call a plumber to fix the clog.

input: Title: Lady's Choice. Sentence 1: A father told his daughter that he would like to read her a book. Sentence 2: He told her to pick whatever book she wanted to hear. Sentence 3: The girl went to the bookshelf and picked one at random. Sentence 4: She returned to her dad with a large cookbook.
target: The father read her many recipes to her delight.

input: Title: The Seal. Sentence 1: The class was looking at animals at the zoo. Sentence 2: The seal was laying on a rock. Sentence 3: He dove into the water and swam laps. Sentence 4: THe kids all cheered as he passed.
target: He was their favorite animal yet!

input: Title: The Rain Slip. Sentence 1: Jerry was playing in the yard with his friends. Sentence 2: It began to rain but they didn't mind. Sentence 3: They were running across the yard playing tag. Sentence 4: Suddenly Jerry slipped on the wet grass.
target: He wasn't hurt bad but he didn't feel like playing anymore.

input: Title: Jenny's Trip. Sentence 1: Jenny hadn't seen her friend in ages. Sentence 2: She had two weeks vacation saved up and decided to go visit him. Sentence 3: Jenny didn't think her car would make the long trip. Sentence 4: When she told her friend this he offered to come and get her.
target: Everything worked out and the two had a great vacation together.

input: Title: Fun in Chemistry. Sentence 1: The professor explained today's experiment. Sentence 2: Everyone put on their safety equipment before beginning. Sentence 3: I ignited the Bunsen burner to heat a substance. Sentence 4: Since i didn't release that the gas was running, a flame sparked.
target: It burned off a part of my eye-brow.

input: Title: First Day of School. Sentence 1: Today was Sam's first day of school. Sentence 2: Sam was afraid to start school and spend the day away from home. target: Sam went home with a smile on his face and couldn't wait to come back.

input: Title: The Poster. Sentence 1: Wendell loved basketball. Sentence 2: He had a poster of his favorite NBA team on his wall. Sentence 3: He would look at it and feel inspired. Sentence 4: He dreamed of playing in the NBA.
target: He planned on working hard until he was on a poster, too.

input: Title: For Victory. Sentence 1: Dan was in 2nd place in the final lap of a car race. Sentence 2: He noticed the man in 1st had a wobbly back left wheel. Sentence 3: On the next turn, Dan slammed on the gas and got closer. Sentence 4: He gently rammed the rear of the other racer's car.
target: The wobbly tire flew out and the man in 1st spun out.

input: Title: Skinny girl. Sentence 1: Maria was too skinny for her own good. Sentence 2: She tried to eat but she never gained weight. Sentence 3: She started running to gain more muscular mass. Sentence 4: It worked enough to give her body a different shape.
target: And she was satisfied to not be skinny anymore.

input: Title: Things Work Out. Sentence 1: Holly was laid off of her job of twenty years. Sentence 2: She was anxious about finding a new job. Sentence 3: She was able to line up an interview within a week. Sentence 4: They loved her!
target: She had a new job with more money two weeks later.

input: Title: Friends at a Restaurant. Sentence 1: Jena's friends were eating at a restaurant. Sentence 2: Jena walked into the restaurant to eat alone. Sentence 3: She saw her friends waving her over. Sentence 4: Jena joined their table.
target: Jena hung out with her friends the rest of the night.

input: Title: Ice. Sentence 1: Luckily there was a path for me. Sentence 2: I navigated between the lanes of ice. Sentence 3: Cars had caused the ice strips to be that way. Sentence 4: I was on my motorcycle.
target: There had been an ice storm.

input: Title: The Blown Shingles. Sentence 1: There was a storm near Kathy's home. Sentence 2: Many shingles got blown off of her roof. Sentence 3: Kathy got an estimate to fix her roof. Sentence 4: The estimates were more than Kathy could afford.
target: Kathy's brother offered to fix the roof.

input: Title: Milk. Sentence 1: Beverly woke up and decided to make cereal for breakfast. Sentence 2: She went to the fridge to see there was no milk. Sentence 3: Beverly walked to the store and returned with a whole gallon. Sentence 4: She carefully poured the milk into the bowl.
target: Beverly happily ate her breakfast.

input: Title: Snake. Sentence 1: George had a pet snake at school. Sentence 2: He would feed the snake every day, except on weekends. Sentence 3: One weekend, George went to school to do some work. Sentence 4: He saw that the snake was not in its cage.
target: He searched for hours, but never found the snake.

input: Title: Gone Fishing. Sentence 1: Gary loaded up his truck on Saturday morning. Sentence 2: He took his kids to the fishing hole. Sentence 3: They fished for an hour and caught ten fish. Sentence 4: They took them home and fried them that night.
target: It was a great fishing trip!

input: Title: Adult Coloring Book. Sentence 1: Lisa was coloring in her adult coloring book. Sentence 2: Her daughter asked if she could color with her. Sentence 3: Lisa said sure why not. Sentence 4: The child started to color outside the lines.
target: Lisa freaked out and told her this was her therapy.

input: Title: Need to express oneself. Sentence 1: Miranda found it hard to express her opinions in public. Sentence 2: When there was a controversy at work, she always kept quiet. Sentence 3: Only when she went home did she feel more confident. Sentence 4: She wrote on her blog and there said all she wanted.
target: It was a good balance as no one knew her online.

input: Title: Annoying Fan. Sentence 1: Sam was trying to sleep. Sentence 2: He turned his fan on but it was too loud. Sentence 3: It was too hot without it. Sentence 4: Sam decided to fix it.
target: After doing so the fan was much quieter.

input: Title: The Palm Trees. Sentence 1: Liam loved going to the beach. Sentence 2: Palm trees were his favorite. Sentence 3: He loved to sit under one and stare at the ocean. Sentence 4: The way the leaves blew in the breeze was so relaxing!
target: Nothing was more peaceful than a day under a palm tree.

input: Title: Towel. Sentence 1: Cole had just woken up and wanted to take a bath. Sentence 2: He went into his room to get his towel. Sentence 3: Much to his dismay, the towel was gone. Sentence 4: He searched everywhere and could not find it.
target: Finally, Cole found his towel in the dryer.

input: Title: Kevin's Flip Phone. Sentence 1: Kevin refused to upgrade to a smartphone. Sentence 2: He said that his flip phone from 2005 worked just fine. Sentence 3: One day, he broke his phone by dropping it in the toilet. Sentence 4: He and his friends held a funeral for the old, reliable phone.
target: Kevin had no choice to upgrade to a smartphone.

input: Title: Back Door. Sentence 1: Fred forgot to check the back door when he went to bed. Sentence 2: He noticed the curtain on it was open in the morning. Sentence 3: He checked the handle and realized he'd left it unlocked. Sentence 4: Fred had forgotten to close the curtain as well.
target: He searched his house just to ease his mind.

input: Title: Pizza. Sentence 1: My wife works for a property management firm. Sentence 2: One of their customers owns a pizza shop. Sentence 3: He came in for business and gave the staff three pizza pies. Sentence 4: My wife brought home some leftovers.
target: We had a nice dinner that day.

input: Title: Timid. Sentence 1: Fran was a very chubby young woman. Sentence 2: She got invited to the beach by her friends one day. Sentence 3: Fran showed up in jeans but her friends were in bathing suits. Sentence 4: Her friends started asking her questions about her weight.
target: Fran was embarrassed and decided to walk home.

input: Title: Tyrod loses his leg. Sentence 1: Tyrod is serving in the army. Sentence 2: Tyrod is battling in war. Sentence 3: Tyrod gets shot in the leg. Sentence 4: The doctors have to amputate his leg.
target: Tyrod loses his leg in war.

input: Title: Engagement. Sentence 1: Allie was in a courtship. Sentence 2: She was excited about it. Sentence 3: Her boyfriend Fred invited her to the park. Sentence 4: When she saw him he got down on one knee.
target: He proposed to her.

input: Title: Bad Dog. Sentence 1: Tim got a new dog. Sentence 2: It behaved really terribly. Sentence 3: Tim tried everything to train it. Sentence 4: Nothing seemed to ever work.
target: Tim kept the dog because he was attached to it, though.

input: Title: Tila And The Berries. Sentence 1: Tila needed something to do. Sentence 2: Tila decided to go pick berries. Sentence 3: Tila spotted a blackberry bush. Sentence 4: Tila picked plenty of berries.
target: Tila made a blackberry pie when she returned home.

input: Title: Baseball game. Sentence 1: I went to a very important baseball game the other day. Sentence 2: The home team was fighting for a playoff spot. Sentence 3: The game was close up until the end. Sentence 4: At the end of the game the home team pulled away and won.
target: What an exciting game, I'm glad I went.

input: Title: Shopping Day. Sentence 1: Abby only did an extensive grocery shopping once per month. Sentence 2: Abby made sure she had her list, and her reusable bags for the trip. Sentence 3: As Abby got to the store, she realized she forgot her coupons. Sentence 4: In addition, Abby forgot her bag with her wallet at the house as well.
target: Abby was mad that she had to turn around and get the forgotten items.

input: Title: Survey. Sentence 1: Amanda decided to take a scientific survey. Sentence 2: At the beginning there was a warning about disturbing content. Sentence 3: However, Amanda did not see any disturbing content in the survey. Sentence 4: She felt confused about this.
target: She submitted the survey anyway, though.

input: Title: Rude Customer. Sentence 1: Tim was working at the mall. Sentence 2: An irate customer walked into his store. Sentence 3: They were demanding a refund. Sentence 4: Tim didn't care enough to argue.
target: He did the refund quickly and got the customer out.

input: Title: Broken heel. Sentence 1: Dakota broke the heel of her shoe in a manhole. Sentence 2: She looked around and there was no one. Sentence 3: She removed her shoes and put it in her purse. Sentence 4: She hopped to the closest shoe store.
target: When she got out, she resumed her walk as if nothing had happened.

input: Title: Ebay Scam. Sentence 1: John was looking for a new phone. Sentence 2: He decided to buy one from Ebay for cheap. Sentence 3: When he got the package from Ebay it only had a toy phone in it. Sentence 4: He was angry and tried to messaged the seller.
target: The seller's account was already suspended.

input: Title: Conflict. Sentence 1: Jocelyn was a new psychologist. Sentence 2: She didn't know what to do when Jason entered her office. Sentence 3: They both were strongly attracted to each other. Sentence 4: And she couldn't help him under those conditions.
target: She had to let him go as a client but accepted a date instead.

input: Title: Baby name. Sentence 1: Megan was trying to come up with baby names. Sentence 2: She could not think of anything. Sentence 3: Her husband hated everything she thought of. Sentence 4: They finally agreed on one.
target: They were happy to have names they both liked.

input: Title: 25th Wedding Anniversary. Sentence 1: For our 25th wedding anniversary I took my wife on a 2nd honeymoon. Sentence 2: We went back to Niagara Falls by train. Sentence 3: We stayed on the Canadian side. Sentence 4: This is what we did when we first got married.
target: We had a great time.

input: Title: Grade. Sentence 1: I was doing badly on my tests in my class. Sentence 2: My classmate was doing well in the class, so I borrowed her tests. Sentence 3: I erased her name and wrote my name on the tests. Sentence 4: I went to the teacher and asked to check my scores.
target: Thus, I tricked my teacher into changing my test scores.

input: Title: First Day in the Kitchen. Sentence 1: Henry received his meal prep from the delivery man. Sentence 2: He quickly opened the box. Sentence 3: His sister helped him prepare hamburgers using the ingredients. Sentence 4: He was a little hesitant to make anything.
target: However, he successfully made it.

input: Title: Paid to stand in line. Sentence 1: Pruitt saw an ad in his local paper about making a quick grand. Sentence 2: Being down on his luck, he thought why not. Sentence 3: The job was to hold a spot in line for 12 hrs. Sentence 4: Pruitt accepted and waited patiently in line for the next day.
target: Pruitt was surprised when the man came, paid him and took the spot.

input: Title: Dessert. Sentence 1: Katy loved to cook. Sentence 2: She just finished dinner one night and decided to make a dessert. Sentence 3: She picked out a recipe, but did not have all the ingredients. Sentence 4: She made some substitutions that she thought would work.
target: When she removed the dessert from the oven, it was not edible.

input: Title: The Triathlon. Sentence 1: Hoda was training for the triathlon. Sentence 2: She was a bad swimmer, so it was a lot of work. Sentence 3: After many months of training, she was finally able to finish. Sentence 4: Her time wasn't very good, but it didn't matter.

input: Title: Adoption. Sentence 1: Jane was pregnant. Sentence 2: At first she wanted an abortion. Sentence 3: She couldn't go through it, though. Sentence 4: Instead she decided on adoption.
target: She was confident with her decision.

input: Title: International Trip. Sentence 1: A few weeks ago all my friends went on a trip. Sentence 2: They went to a different country together to have fun. Sentence 3: While they were there they took a lot of pictures. Sentence 4: When they got back, they showed me all the pictures they took.
target: My friends really had a fun time abroad!

input: Title: Wallet. Sentence 1: Alice lost her wallet on the way to work. Sentence 2: She decided to work a half-day to look for it. Sentence 3: She backtracked her steps and thinks she lost it at a coffee shop. Sentence 4: She went inside the coffee shop and asked if anyone found a wallet.
target: Luckily one of the baristas returned her wallet to her.

input: Title: Space. Sentence 1: Garrett was interested in space and space travel. Sentence 2: His class was planning a field trip to a planetarium. Sentence 3: The prospect of the trip greatly excited Garrett. Sentence 4: Garrett got sick on the day of the trip and could not attend.
target: His family brought him to the planetarium instead.

input: Title: Dance Class. Sentence 1: Natalie was going to her first dance class. Sentence 2: She had dreamed about this day for years! Sentence 3: Her teacher invited her to put on her ballet shoes. Sentence 4: Natalie couldn't wait to learn how to dance!
target: She was going to work hard to do a great job in the recital.

input: Title: Being Social. Sentence 1: Kyle wanted his daughter to socialize more with other children. Sentence 2: He decided to register her in a soccer league. Sentence 3: His daughter was nervous for her first practice. Sentence 4: She slowly began to make new friends.
target: Kyle watched his daughter become a more social child.

input: Title: The Rent Deposit. Sentence 1: Jim was moving out of his house. Sentence 2: While moving his furniture out, he broke a window on accident. Sentence 3: Jim's landlord came to inspect the house. Sentence 4: The landlord took note of the broken window.
target: Jim didn't get his deposit back.

input: Title: The Saxophonist. Sentence 1: Bill was about to again step on stage at the underground club. Sentence 2: He always plays the saxophone here, but today is father is here. Sentence 3: Bill's father is a very talented but retired and judging saxophonist. Sentence 4: Bill nervously steps up and plays his first song.
target: Bill's father nods his approval and Bill plays many more songs.

input: Title: Jan's new pet. Sentence 1: Jan bothered her parents for a pet. Sentence 2: They took her to the pet shop. Sentence 3: She picked out a new pet. Sentence 4: She chose to get a snake.
target: Jan loved her snake very much.

input: Title: Missing Headset. Sentence 1: Tom bought a new bluetooth headset. Sentence 2: It was small and portable. Sentence 3: Tom lost it within a week. Sentence 4: It was too small to find easily.
target: Tom would keep losing it.

input: Title: Pecans. Sentence 1: Josephine went on a date to an Italian restaurant. Sentence 2: She ordered a pasta dish. Sentence 3: Josephine's lips started swelling up. Sentence 4: Josephine realized there were nuts in the pasta sauce.
target: Her date took her to the ER because of her allergic reaction.

input: Title: Learning how to type. Sentence 1: When I was in fourth grade, we had to learn to type. Sentence 2: We started by learning where to place our hands. Sentence 3: Then, we learned how to type with eight keys. Sentence 4: Gradually we worked our way up to typing every letter.
target: Now, I can type anything without errors.

input: Title: Puffy Eyes. Sentence 1: Tom always had puffy eyes. Sentence 2: It made it seem like he didn't get enough sleep. Sentence 3: People at work kept mentioning it. Sentence 4: He tried a new cream he read about online.
target: It helped him a lot.

input: Title: Jack's Test. Sentence 1: Jack took his SAT test. Sentence 2: His score was lower than he would have wanted. Sentence 3: Jack rescheduled another taking of the test. Sentence 4: He studied hard for the SAT.
target: Jack made a much better score the second time he took the test.

input: Title: Studying to get Out. Sentence 1: Annette worked at a restaurant. Sentence 2: She went to college during the day. Sentence 3: Annette studied hard. Sentence 4: She didn't want to work at the diner all her life.
target: When Annette graduated, she got a better job.

input: Title: Newly engaged. Sentence 1: Tim took Laura out to the park. Sentence 2: She had no clue what was happening. Sentence 3: To her surprise, he got down on one knee. Sentence 4: Tim proposed to her.
target: Laura was shocked.

input: Title: Dubby. Sentence 1: I developed a huge crush on Dubby. Sentence 2: He was a rocker with long blonde hair and a motorcycle jacket. Sentence 3: I thought I was in love with him. Sentence 4: He was interested in me, but I was too scared.
target: Now my husband is almost exactly like him.

input: Title: Going Streaking. Sentence 1: Tom was hanging out with friends. Sentence 2: They had been drinking a bit. Sentence 3: They decided to go crazy and streak. Sentence 4: Tom was into the idea.
target: They all did it and had fun.

input: Title: Dirty Pets. Sentence 1: John worked at a pet store. Sentence 2: And he was happy because it was his last day there. Sentence 3: But someone brought in a filthy pet. Sentence 4: But John could only stay so far away from it.
target: John was too sick to celebrate his last day at work.

input: Title: Dinner. Sentence 1: Tonight our son came over to do his laundry. Sentence 2: He also cooked dinner for us. Sentence 3: He made tacos for us. Sentence 4: We haven't had tacos in ages.
target: It was a satisfying night.

input: Title: Sheila's Late Night. Sentence 1: Sheila was up late talking on the phone with her boyfriend. Sentence 2: She didn't hear her alarm go off. Sentence 3: Sheila woke up late. Sentence 4: She had to rush to get to school.
target: Sheila was late to school.

input: Title: Insurance Payments. Sentence 1: Bill had gotten his hours cut. Sentence 2: He couldn't afford to pay his insurance. Sentence 3: He got behind a couple of months. Sentence 4: They threatened to cut him off entirely.
target: He was finally able to pay what he owed, though.

input: Title: Roland Cuts His Hair. Sentence 1: Roland noticed that his hair had gotten very long. Sentence 2: While he normally liked long hair, it had become too messy for him. Sentence 3: He decided to get a haircut. Sentence 4: The barber gave Roland a neat and trim haircut.
target: Roland was glad that his hair wasn't very long any more.

input: Title: The Leaves. Sentence 1: The weather was changing. Sentence 2: The leaves turned orange and red. Sentence 3: They fell from the trees and landed on the grass. Sentence 4: The family raked them up carefully.
target: They made a big pile and then jumped in them.

input: Title: Van the Cat. Sentence 1: Van the cat meowed loudly in the morning. Sentence 2: He woke his owner up. Sentence 3: His owner fed Van. Sentence 4: Van ate the food.
target: Van planned to wake his owner up the next day too.

input: Title: Negative. Sentence 1: Jeff was trying to start an art project. Sentence 2: But he didn't like any of his ideas. Sentence 3: He complained about his work every time he tried to start. Sentence 4: And several days passed without any progress.
target: Jeff realized that he was being too negative.

input: Title: Death. Sentence 1: The next morning, my phone started ringing. Sentence 2: I looked at the ID and saw it was Michelle, Adam's sister. Sentence 3: I couldn't answer it because I knew in my gut what she would say. Sentence 4: I finally called her back and asked why he died.
target: It felt like a part of me had died with him.

input: Title: College. Sentence 1: The son got accepted to his first college choice. Sentence 2: That was his dad's old school. Sentence 3: His dad was very proud. Sentence 4: He bought his son a car to celebrate.
target: His son drove that car for years.

input: Title: In Ground Pool. Sentence 1: Jim owned a house in the desert. Sentence 2: He always dreamed of having a pool. Sentence 3: For two years he saved up money to have one put in. Sentence 4: Jim was finally able to afford contractors and building supplies.
target: Once his pool was built he used it all the time.

input: Title: Wanted: Puppy. Sentence 1: Carmen wanted a puppy. Sentence 2: She didn't have any particular kind in mind. Sentence 3: She just wanted a puppy that was kind. Sentence 4: She went to the pound to rescue one.
target: There she found the perfect puppy named Max.

input: Title: Home Depot. Sentence 1: Wyatt bellowed an old bluegrass song while sitting on his porch. Sentence 2: A neighbor came by and told him to quiet down. Sentence 3: Wyatt spit at him and told him this was his property. Sentence 4: The neighbor looked bewildered, and pointed at his badge.
target: It was a Home Depot manager, and Wyatt was outside by the tool shed.

input: Title: Poker Game. Sentence 1: Stan was playing poker with his friends. Sentence 2: He wasn't having any luck. Sentence 3: Stan lost forty dollars. Sentence 4: Stan's wife found out he lost all the money.
target: Stan's wife fussed at him.

input: Title: Kite Flying. Sentence 1: I went to the park to fly my kite. Sentence 2: It was very windy at the park so i took out my kite. Sentence 3: I ran with the kite behind me and it began to fly. Sentence 4: The kite flew higher and higher until it was above the treetops.
target: I was able to land the kite safely after flying it for an hour.

input: Title: Fall. Sentence 1: I am one of the people who can't get up if they fall. Sentence 2: I had a stroke in the fall of 2011. Sentence 3: Last night I went to the bathroom and the cane slipped on the tile. Sentence 4: I fell and could not get up.
target: Luckily my wife was able to help me up.

input: Title: Hearing. Sentence 1: Tom was a naturalist. Sentence 2: Tom went into nature often. Sentence 3: He felt it improved his hearing. Sentence 4: He could hear everything for miles out there in the silence of nature.
target: He would regularly go into nature and simply listen to the forest.

input: Title: Greta. Sentence 1: I met Greta last year on the bench in front of our building. Sentence 2: She was 75, twice widowed. Sentence 3: Greta talked a lot about her family. Sentence 4: This year, Greta just says hi but does not sit and talk.
target: She seems to be depressed.

input: Title: Chicken Whisperer. Sentence 1: Jamie noticed her only hen hadn't laid an egg in over a week. Sentence 2: She didn't know much about chickens and thought this was normal. Sentence 3: One day her friend came over and looked at the hen. Sentence 4: Her friend realized the hen was stressed by a move to a bigger house.
target: Jamie's friend told her when the hen is settled in she'll lay again.

input: Title: Hot and cold. Sentence 1: It was really hot when Cameron came out of his house. Sentence 2: As he had put on too many layers, he removed his sweater. Sentence 3: He walked for two minutes toward the lake. Sentence 4: But by the water, he felt a cold breeze despite the sun.
target: He put his sweater back on feeling hot and cold at the same time.

input: Title: Fall. Sentence 1: Summer was coming to an end and Fall was coming. Sentence 2: Anna was devastated at the thought. Sentence 3: Then she got her first whiff of autumn breeze. Sentence 4: She remembered pumpkins, hoodies, and leaves changing color!
target: Suddenly, Anna couldn't wait for fall!

input: Title: Wildflowers. Sentence 1: Jason had a crush on Jennifer. Sentence 2: Everyone seemed to know about it but her. Sentence 3: One day he came up with a plan. Sentence 4: He went out into the meadow and picked a bunch of wildflowers.
target: He walked up to Jennifer, asked her out, and she said yes.

input: Title: Bloody Nose. Sentence 1: Eli and his brother were playing video games. Sentence 2: They were competing against each other. Sentence 3: Eli was winning and his brother was angry. Sentence 4: His brother took the controller and threw it at Eli's face.
target: The controller hit Eli's nose and he has blood pouring everywhere.

input: Title: Art Dance. Sentence 1: She started to dance, but there was work to do and so she stopped. Sentence 2: She picked up the pen and paper instead. Sentence 3: Since her body couldn't dance, she made the pen dance on the paper. Sentence 4: Her body, refusing to hold still, started to sway in time with the pen.
