input: Title: Improv Team. Sentence 1: Blake took an improv class at the college. Sentence 2: He was partnered with a beautiful woman. Sentence 3: Blake felt very nervous around the woman. Sentence 4: It was funny for the class to watch.
target: Blake and his partner became the classes favorite improv team.

input: Title: Clubbing. Sentence 1: Joyce looked at the time. Sentence 2: It was 3 AM. Sentence 3: Her friends were still busy dancing. Sentence 4: Joyce got an Uber and took herself home.
target: She vowed never to go clubbing with her friends again.

input: Title: Loose Doggy. Sentence 1: Ricky was walking his dog at the park. Sentence 2: His dog suddenly got loose from the leash. Sentence 3: His dog sprinted towards a squirrel running up a tree. Sentence 4: Ricky was luckily able to catch his dog before he ran away.
target: Ricky and his dog went for a run in the park afterwards.

input: Title: Pray. Sentence 1: Anna was depressed. Sentence 2: She had no family or friends. Sentence 3: Then a neighbor took her to church. Sentence 4: There, Anna found Christ.
target: Knowing Jesus made Anna's life much better.

input: Title: The Mouse. Sentence 1: Tim was at home sitting in his chair when he heard rustling. Sentence 2: As he looked over he seen a mouse running into a hole. Sentence 3: Since mice scared him he became frantic. Sentence 4: He called his brother who helped him trap the mouse.
target: They released the mouse in the woods and they were all happy again.

input: Title: Angry Squirrel. Sentence 1: Martin was walking his dog. Sentence 2: He ran into a squirrel. Sentence 3: The squirrel was angry. Sentence 4: It was just protecting it's nest.
target: His dog was a coward and tried to run away.

input: Title: Car Crash. Sentence 1: Dan liked to drive fast cars. Sentence 2: Dan would sometimes speed when he was driving. Sentence 3: One day, Dan drove too fast and got into an accident. Sentence 4: His car slammed into a tree and was totaled.
target: Dan had to learn to like biking because he lost his car.

input: Title: Policy. Sentence 1: Tim was a CEO for his company. Sentence 2: Tim discovered there was gross inefficiency at this company. Sentence 3: Tim created a new company policy to address the inefficiency. Sentence 4: Tim ordered his employees to follow the new policy immediately.
target: The policy change eradicated the efficiency in Tim's company.

input: Title: Butterfinger. Sentence 1: For a special treat, my mom said I could have candy! Sentence 2: She took me to the store and told me I could pick whatever I wanted. Sentence 3: I chose a Butterfinger. Sentence 4: Then we went to the pool.
target: I threw the Butterfinger up right into the pool.

input: Title: shout-out.. Sentence 1: Les was watching old movies in his living room. Sentence 2: He decided to try watching an old cowboy movie. Sentence 3: He was particularly impressed with a scene that involved a shout-out. Sentence 4: He imagined what he would do in that kind of situation.
target: The answer that came to him was quite surprising.

input: Title: Sewer Adventures. Sentence 1: Dylan was bored and wanted to explore somewhere. Sentence 2: He found a very large manhole cover in the street. Sentence 3: He lifted it up and climbed down into the sewer. Sentence 4: The sewer smelled very bad and was damp.
target: Dylan decided to leave and never went back.

input: Title: Volunteer. Sentence 1: Kate took a gap year after high school. Sentence 2: But while she was finding herself, she wanted to be useful. Sentence 3: She signed up as a volunteer firefighter in her town. Sentence 4: That year, Kate fought six fires, and saved lives and homes.
target: Looking back, she was very proud of her gap year!

input: Title: Contractually Bound. Sentence 1: Stan hated his new job. Sentence 2: He joined the company for the money but couldn't stand the people. Sentence 3: His contract said if he quit within a year he'd lose his hiring bonus. Sentence 4: Stan started misbehaving to get the company to fire him.
target: He got to keep his bonus and find a job that better suited him.

input: Title: Hot Chocolate. Sentence 1: Katie's teacher made the students hot chocolate. Sentence 2: She warned them that is was very hot. Sentence 3: They were all excited about the treat. Sentence 4: Instead of waiting for it to cool off, they drank it anyway.
target: Many of the students burned their tongue as a result.

input: Title: Snooze. Sentence 1: Kate needed to get up to go to work. Sentence 2: But she was very sleepy. Sentence 3: She wanted to get more sleep. Sentence 4: But the alarm clock was blaring loudly in her ear.
target: She decided to hit the snooze button and get 5 more minutes of sleep.

input: Title: Shoes Smell Strange. Sentence 1: Bruno's older brother was serving in Vietnam. Sentence 2: He was the captain of an A team with 12 soldiers on his team. Sentence 3: They led some mountain dwellers to fight the Viet Cong. Sentence 4: The brother came home and brought Bruno a gift.
target: The shoes he received smelled strange because they were elephant hide.

input: Title: Broken Phone Screen. Sentence 1: Ed wasn't paying attention to where he was walking. Sentence 2: He was too busy looking at a game on his phone. Sentence 3: He bumped into a pole and his phone went flying. Sentence 4: The screen cracked as it hit the sidewalk.
target: He had to pay $50 to get the screen fixed.

input: Title: My eyeshadow was eaten. Sentence 1: I once had an eyeshadow palette that was my favorite. Sentence 2: I also had a 3 year old son at the time who was also my favorite. Sentence 3: When I was cooking dinner my son went into my makeup bag. Sentence 4: He liked the colors of the eyeshadow and thought it was candy.
target: When I went to check on him,I caught him eating my eyeshadow palette!

input: Title: Prom. Sentence 1: Lola wanted to go to prom. Sentence 2: She asked her friend Steven to go. Sentence 3: He said he did not want to go. Sentence 4: Lola was very sad.
target: She did not go to prom.

input: Title: Thinking to myself.. Sentence 1: I was in my room by myself. Sentence 2: There wasn't much to do. Sentence 3: I was thinking to myself what can I do to better myself. Sentence 4: Then I started talking to myself.
target: My parents could hear me and told me to be quiet.

input: Title: Short. Sentence 1: Before we met, he told me he was short. Sentence 2: I am a very tall girl, but I didn't care. Sentence 3: We talked about it at length. Sentence 4: We decided it should not matter.
target: We ended up meeting anyway.

input: Title: Apartment. Sentence 1: Jane was moving to a new town. Sentence 2: She needed to find an apartment. Sentence 3: She had been looking for weeks. Sentence 4: She finally found one with a vacancy.
target: She was excited to move to her new place.

input: Title: The Stuffed Animal. Sentence 1: James was sleeping at his cousin's house. Sentence 2: James had forgotten his favorite stuffed animal. Sentence 3: His cousin let James borrow one of his animals. Sentence 4: James was able to sleep well.
target: He was excited to know he could sleep without his toy.

input: Title: Lost Money. Sentence 1: One day Greg was driving home from work. Sentence 2: He needed to drop by the cleaners to pick up his clothes. Sentence 3: As he got out of his car he saw something green on the ground. Sentence 4: As he stepped closer he saw that it was money.
target: There were 10 100 dollar bills laying on the ground!

input: Title: Where was the smell coming for?. Sentence 1: Ross noticed a putrid smell from his house. Sentence 2: He asked his daughter what it could be. Sentence 3: She shook her head. Sentence 4: But then they found it.
target: It was a rotten egg under the sofa.

input: Title: Homemade costume. Sentence 1: Conner wanted to be a robot for Halloween. Sentence 2: He and his mom went to the store to look for one. Sentence 3: The stores didn't have a robot costume he liked. Sentence 4: So his mom decided that they could make one together.
target: They bought the supplies and making the robot costume was a success!

input: Title: Getting that A. Sentence 1: Suzy studied so hard for her upcoming test. Sentence 2: But she was so nervous. Sentence 3: She didn't know if she would do well. Sentence 4: She came to class scared.
target: But luckily she got that A.

input: Title: Shark Danger. Sentence 1: Blair was surfing in the ocean. Sentence 2: He spotted a large fin in the water. Sentence 3: He got very scared. Sentence 4: He paddled to the shore.
target: The shark swam away from the beach.

input: Title: Family. Sentence 1: Walking home from school, Pirya saw a small kitten. Sentence 2: She sat down in the shade to pet her. Sentence 3: After a while Priya realized the kitten didn't have a mom. Sentence 4: Since Pirya didn't either, she decided to take the kitten home.
target: Now the Pirya and the kitten have each other.

input: Title: Scalped Ticket. Sentence 1: Tim wanted to go to a concert. Sentence 2: Tickets sold out right away. Sentence 3: He decided to get some online. Sentence 4: They were may more expensive and the seller seemed shady.
target: Security at the concert informed him that they were counterfeit.

input: Title: Scoliosis. Sentence 1: Allana was experiencing a lot of back pain. Sentence 2: So she thought getting massages would help. Sentence 3: When she realized the massages weren't helping she went to the Doctor. Sentence 4: The Doctor ordered numerous tests.
target: The results revealed that scoliosis was the source of the back pain.

input: Title: Tragedy strikes. Sentence 1: One day Keith was playing with his son Bryson. Sentence 2: He heard a loud noise bang from inside the house. Sentence 3: He went to check on his wife lyndie. Sentence 4: It was too late.
target: Lyndie had been crushed by the family dresser.

input: Title: Flashcards. Sentence 1: Ellie was a fourth grader having a hard time with math. Sentence 2: Ellie started using flashcards. Sentence 3: Her mom would do the math flashcards with her every single day. Sentence 4: Soon, Ellie's confidence with math increased.
target: Ellie scored in the 85th percentile in math that year!

input: Title: Box. Sentence 1: There was a box in the garage. Sentence 2: I didn't know what was inside. Sentence 3: I asked my father to open it. Sentence 4: He opened the box for me.
target: There was blank paper in the box.

input: Title: Practice. Sentence 1: Everyone was impressed by Kate's figure drawings. Sentence 2: And they all agreed she was very talented. Sentence 3: So Kate decided to cut her practice hours in half. Sentence 4: And her drawings became worse and worse.
target: And Kate realized her skill only came from hard work.

input: Title: Sick at Work. Sentence 1: Nate woke up feeling slightly off one morning. Sentence 2: He went into work anyways and got to his regular tasks. Sentence 3: As the day progressed he grew sicker and sicker. Sentence 4: Soon he was struggling to keep upright at his desk.
target: Luckily his boss noticed and sent him home to rest.

input: Title: Duck, Duck, Cop. Sentence 1: A duck and her ducklings caused a traffic jam in an intersection. Sentence 2: The mother duck was trying to cross at an inconvenient spot. Sentence 3: A nice cop stopped traffic to escort the ducklings. Sentence 4: After a few minutes, the mother and her ducklings made it across.
target: Everyone cheered for the cop from their cars.

input: Title: Broken Down Apartment. Sentence 1: I finally moved into my new apartment. Sentence 2: However, there was lots of mold in the bathroom. Sentence 3: The sink did not work. Sentence 4: None of these problems occurred when I first saw the place.
target: The next day I proudly abandoned my lease so I could move elsewhere.

input: Title: The Ferris Wheel. Sentence 1: The kids were riding rides at the fair. Sentence 2: They went to the very top of the Ferris Wheel and it stopped. Sentence 3: They were stuck! Sentence 4: The kids screamed and cried.
target: Finally, the ride started working again.

input: Title: Pain Pills. Sentence 1: The man doubled his dosage. Sentence 2: He felt ill. Sentence 3: He began to panic. Sentence 4: He called his doctor.
target: He admitted that he took too many pills.

input: Title: Moment of Truth. Sentence 1: Driving home late one night, Doug was blasting his music. Sentence 2: He felt a bit tired, but wanted to get home quick to sleep. Sentence 3: All of a sudden, a deer darted out in front of his car. Sentence 4: Stepping on the brakes, he came to a stop very quickly.
target: The deer stared at him, but then trotted off of the road.

input: Title: Baking Mix Up. Sentence 1: Tom was trying to bake some cookies. Sentence 2: He wanted to surprise his girlfriend. Sentence 3: He didn't have the right ingredients. Sentence 4: He tried to replace them with similar ones.
target: It wound up ruining his cookies and angering his girl.

input: Title: The Missing Tests. Sentence 1: Kyra was a teacher. Sentence 2: She was grading test papers. Sentence 3: The test papers somehow disappeared. Sentence 4: Kyra had to make the students retake the test.
target: The students weren't happy.

input: Title: Bungalow In the Jungle. Sentence 1: Ulrich was interested in buying a house in Nebraska. Sentence 2: He found a very cute bungalow in the town of Orleans. Sentence 3: Ulrich decided to drive out to see the property. Sentence 4: He got lost on the way and ended up in Kansas.
target: A highway serial killer ended poor Ulrich before he could leave.

input: Title: Parent-Teacher Conference. Sentence 1: Dean's teacher began grading him on behavior weekly. Sentence 2: Dean promptly dropped the behavioral grading slips in the garbage. Sentence 3: Dean's parents never saw them. Sentence 4: Dean's parents were asked about them at a parent-teacher conference.
target: When Dean's parents got home, they were livid with Dean.

input: Title: Skating away. Sentence 1: Lucy wanted to skate. Sentence 2: She hadn't done it before. Sentence 3: She decided to take lessons. Sentence 4: On her first lesson she fell.
target: It would be away until she got good.

input: Title: Broken Drums. Sentence 1: The church choir was performing on a sunday morning. Sentence 2: The band sounded good. Sentence 3: The drummer was hitting his drumsticks with force. Sentence 4: He ended up breaking the snare drum.
target: The congregation stared at him.

input: Title: Soaked. Sentence 1: After Fran had lost at ring toss, she and Burt tried another game. Sentence 2: They had fill a balloon with water from a squirt gun. Sentence 3: Fran and Burt began filling their balloons. Sentence 4: Fran's balloon burst and soaked them both.
target: Although Burt won, he gave his prize to Fran.

input: Title: Guinea Pigs. Sentence 1: My niece bought as guinea pig for her ten year old daughter. Sentence 2: She bought another one for company. Sentence 3: She thought they were both females. Sentence 4: She was mistaken, and a litter was born.
target: She was able to sell the babies to a pet store.

input: Title: Series. Sentence 1: We rooted for our team to win the pennant. Sentence 2: They hadn't won since the early 1900's. Sentence 3: We screamed with joy when they won. Sentence 4: The players rushed onto the field.
target: They were exhilarated, as were the fans.

input: Title: Discrimination Exists Everywhere. Sentence 1: Harris and Angelo were the team leaders for basketball. Sentence 2: They picked the best players first. Sentence 3: I waited with 3 other people to be picked. Sentence 4: When it came down to one person and myself, Angelo picked the guy.
target: Although I was picked last, I scored the game winning shot.

input: Title: Armchair. Sentence 1: Teddy curled his arm hair. Sentence 2: Some girls told him it was gross. Sentence 3: He didn't listen to them. Sentence 4: He shaved it off to make a statement.
target: All the girls were impressed.

input: Title: Shoe laces. Sentence 1: Trent found it hard to learn how to lace his shoes. Sentence 2: His mother showed him over and over but he didn't grasp it. Sentence 3: He had to practice on his own to eventually understand it. Sentence 4: When he did, he was so happy, he went for a run.
target: And when his shoelaces were undone, he did them again.

input: Title: Scary House. Sentence 1: Abby was recently looking at houses to purchase. Sentence 2: The current house she was touring had a very eerie feeling to Abby. Sentence 3: It was then Abby heard a noise coming from the bathroom. Sentence 4: Abby immediately ran out of the house and to her car.
target: Abby knew she was not going to purchasing the scary house.

input: Title: Antidepressants. Sentence 1: I wasn't feeling too well. Sentence 2: My mind was constantly having negative thoughts. Sentence 3: I decided to go to a doctor. Sentence 4: The doctor prescribe me anti depressants.
target: My negative.

input: Title: Owner. Sentence 1: Leo always wanted to be a chef when he grew up. Sentence 2: He went to school and got his education. Sentence 3: He got out of college and got a great cooking job. Sentence 4: He decided he wanted more.
target: Leo built his own restaurant.

input: Title: Ocean Kayak. Sentence 1: Alyssa went to the beach. Sentence 2: At the beach, she rented an ocean kayak. Sentence 3: She tried to paddle the kayak out to an oil rig. Sentence 4: The oil rig was further away than Alyssa imagined.
target: Alyssa had to stop and turn back when her arms got tired.

input: Title: Snowing. Sentence 1: Kate was restless on a very snowy day. Sentence 2: Her mother wouldn't allow her to play outside. Sentence 3: She went downstairs to the basement. Sentence 4: She walked in circles and imagined the beach.
target: An hour later she figured she had enough exercise and went upstairs.

input: Title: Feeling Hot. Sentence 1: The temperature outside was rising. Sentence 2: It was time for a fruit pop. Sentence 3: I opened my freezer. Sentence 4: I shuffled through the assorted flavors.
target: I ended up choosing lemon blueberry.

input: Title: On Sale. Sentence 1: Rick was searching for a bicycle helmet. Sentence 2: But he didn't want to settle for something cheap. Sentence 3: He saw an expensive helmet on sale. Sentence 4: And he bought it right away.
target: Rick was happy about how much money he saved.

input: Title: Tracked. Sentence 1: Someone stole Kia's new car. Sentence 2: But luckily, she had GPS tracking installed! Sentence 3: She alerted the GPS trackers of the theft. Sentence 4: Soon police had found Kia's car.
target: They returned it to her and arrested the thief!

input: Title: Pink Shirt. Sentence 1: Tim was doing laundry. Sentence 2: He forgot to separate the colors and whites. Sentence 3: All of his whites turned pink. Sentence 4: Tim didn't care much.
target: He wore pink shirts with pride.

input: Title: Plate. Sentence 1: The man broke the plate. Sentence 2: He picked up the pieces. Sentence 3: He glued the plate back together. Sentence 4: His wife saw the glued plate.
target: She threw it away.

input: Title: Vegan Child. Sentence 1: My friend Sally became a vegan at age twenty. Sentence 2: She stopped using artificial contraceptives. Sentence 3: She had a boy and raised him as a vegan. Sentence 4: She stopped being a vegan a few years later, and had two more kids.
target: Both kids ate meat and grew to be taller than their big brother.

input: Title: Near dead battery. Sentence 1: Allie took her phone out. Sentence 2: She used it all day. Sentence 3: Then the battery was drained. Sentence 4: She was close to losing it.
target: Then thankfully she found a charger.

input: Title: Two Honest, One Dishonest. Sentence 1: Steve took his granddaughter to an outdoor mall to go shopping. Sentence 2: As they were coming up the escalator, she saw a paper at the top. Sentence 3: When she picked it up, they both saw that it was a $100 dollar bill. Sentence 4: They wanted to do the right thing and brought it to a mall employee.
target: As they walked away, Steve saw the employee put it in their pocket.

input: Title: The Ring. Sentence 1: Pete loved his wedding ring. Sentence 2: He had never worn jewelry before but he was enjoying it. Sentence 3: The ring was gold with a hammered finish. Sentence 4: He looked at it proudly when he put it on.
target: Pete was happy to be married.

input: Title: Tune Up. Sentence 1: Kate and Liz were going to drive Kate's car to Las Vegas. Sentence 2: But Kate wanted to make sure the car would make it. Sentence 3: Her brother thought she should get a tune up. Sentence 4: She took it to the local car place to have it done.
target: She was very happy her brother had made the suggestion.

input: Title: Broken Record. Sentence 1: Sam got a new record player. Sentence 2: He was excited to try it out. Sentence 3: When he first played a record it sounded terrible. Sentence 4: He was afraid that the player was broken.
target: Same tried other records and realized the player wasn't the problem.

input: Title: Going to the Movies. Sentence 1: Ciara and Quade loved going to the movies. Sentence 2: But they always hated buying the expensive snacks. Sentence 3: So they shared and rotated the payments so they weren't as expensive. Sentence 4: This made the next movie going experience even better.
target: The movie was great and so were their snacks.

input: Title: Bad Day. Sentence 1: On his way to school, Jacob's backpack ripped open. Sentence 2: All of his stuff went flying around. Sentence 3: Jacob's book with his homework landed in a puddle. Sentence 4: He was devastated.
target: Jacob went to school in a bad mood.

input: Title: Sunny Day. Sentence 1: It was a beautiful day in Chicago. Sentence 2: A couple is touring the city for their anniversary. Sentence 3: They've seen all the sites and taken lots of photos. Sentence 4: The day is nearly over and they are going for pizza.
target: Every year the couple returns to Chicago for the awesome experience.

input: Title: The Bear Cub. Sentence 1: James woke up to a loud noise. Sentence 2: He went outside to investigate and found a baby bear! Sentence 3: It had knocked over his trash can. Sentence 4: James ran inside, afraid that the mother bear was nearby.
target: He locked the doors and closed the blinds.

input: Title: volleyball. Sentence 1: Mary joined a volleyball team. Sentence 2: The team would qualify for a tournament. Sentence 3: Mary had a feud with one of her friends in the team. Sentence 4: Mary had sprained her ankle.
target: Mary quit the team.

input: Title: The Big Race. Sentence 1: Tim entered a marathon in his city. Sentence 2: He had been training for years. Sentence 3: The day of the race he was really sick. Sentence 4: Tim tried to run anyway.
target: He didn't get anywhere near first place.

input: Title: Potty Training. Sentence 1: Reese was a toddler. Sentence 2: He was not potty trained. Sentence 3: His parents offered him candy went he used the toilet. Sentence 4: Reese was excited to use the bathroom.
target: His parents were excited about the results.

input: Title: radio. Sentence 1: The man turned on a radio. Sentence 2: He disagreed with what he heard. Sentence 3: He called the radio station. Sentence 4: The radio station hung up the phone.
target: The man found another radio station to play.

input: Title: Good Budgeting. Sentence 1: Christy has never set up a budget before in her life. Sentence 2: She was introduced to the concept of envelope budgeting by her friend. Sentence 3: Her friend was in massive debt for most of her life. Sentence 4: Once her friend explained the concept, Christy started using it.
target: Now she no longer has any credit card debt.

input: Title: Home Run. Sentence 1: Travis was playing baseball at school. Sentence 2: But he kept on missing. Sentence 3: He decided to practice swinging everyday. Sentence 4: And the next the next time he played baseball, he hit a homerun.
target: Travis was glad his practice paid off.

input: Title: Wine. Sentence 1: My brother and I often share wine with each other. Sentence 2: He usually recommends white wine. Sentence 3: However, one time he recommended red. Sentence 4: It was a very poor choice.
target: Now I don't listen to any of my brother's recommendations.

input: Title: New Style. Sentence 1: Tom was going to high-school for the first time. Sentence 2: He decided to reinvent himself. Sentence 3: He created a whole new style for himself. Sentence 4: All the other students thought he looked goofy.
target: Tom was picked on alot after that.

input: Title: Boring Camp Visit. Sentence 1: Jason was at summer camp. Sentence 2: He wasn't having any fun at all. Sentence 3: His counselor noticed and offered to find him an activity. Sentence 4: They tried a few things before he settled on archery.
target: Finally Jason was having a bit of fun.

input: Title: Bustin. Sentence 1: May Larker was a paranormal investigator. Sentence 2: She once claimed to have seen a ghost. Sentence 3: People didn't believe her. Sentence 4: May spent her life trying to prove that ghosts were real.
target: When May finally passed, she didn't left nothing but a corpse.

input: Title: Too many commercials. Sentence 1: Gabriel was sitting at home sick from school. Sentence 2: He was lying on the couch watching television. Sentence 3: He found a good movie. Sentence 4: The movie kept going to commercials and upset Gabriel.
target: Gabriel turned off the tv because there were too many commercials.

input: Title: Teacher. Sentence 1: I thought I wanted to be a teacher. Sentence 2: I talked with a counselor about it. Sentence 3: I interviewed people who were teachers. Sentence 4: I took classes and did student teaching at a familiar school.
target: I learned I do not want to be a teacher because it's not worth it.

input: Title: Sadness. Sentence 1: After it was over, I felt sad and contrite. Sentence 2: I tried to apologize, but it wasn't accepted. Sentence 3: He was very angry with me. Sentence 4: I didn't know what else I could do.
target: I remained quiet for the rest of the day.

input: Title: A Walk. Sentence 1: Mason had gotten into an argument with his parents. Sentence 2: He was very upset. Sentence 3: Mason needed some time to think. Sentence 4: He went for a walk.
target: When he came back, he had cooled off.

input: Title: The Model. Sentence 1: The model worked very hard to get ready for the fashion show. Sentence 2: She only ate healthy food. Sentence 3: She spent hours at the gym. Sentence 4: When it was time, she walked down the runway proudly.
target: All of the designers wanted her in their show.

input: Title: Health Inspector. Sentence 1: Tom owns a deli downtown. Sentence 2: He got a call that the health inspector was walking into his deli. Sentence 3: He was nervous because he didn't have any warning. Sentence 4: The last thing he wanted was for his deli to be shut down.
target: The health inspector found two violations but the deli remained open.

input: Title: Celine. Sentence 1: Celine was a horrible person. Sentence 2: She yelled at her little girl when she started to cry. Sentence 3: She was only a baby. Sentence 4: Celine screamed at her to shut up.
target: She called her a bad name.

input: Title: Uh-Oh. Sentence 1: A woman went to the post office. Sentence 2: She stood in line for a while. Sentence 3: She began to pass out. Sentence 4: Another woman caught her.
target: They called the ambulance.

input: Title: Worry. Sentence 1: Sarah worried about eating healthy food. Sentence 2: So she analyzed nutrition labels on everything she bought. Sentence 3: But her eating habits were erratic and unplanned. Sentence 4: So the nutritional value of the foods she ate weren't meaningful.
target: In the end, Sarah's health was terrible.

input: Title: The Date. Sentence 1: Ron was lonely and started using Internet dating sites. Sentence 2: He started talking to a pretty girl and really liked her. Sentence 3: They made plans to have dinner on Saturday at a fancy restaurant. Sentence 4: Ron's paycheck was typed incorrectly and didn't clear so he was broke!
target: He took the girl to a park for a picnic instead and she loved it.

input: Title: Denny loses his ring. Sentence 1: Denny is playing poker. Sentence 2: He is eating chips. Sentence 3: He takes his wedding ring off to avoid getting it dirty. Sentence 4: After the game he cannot find the ring.
target: Denny lost his wedding ring.

input: Title: Violet. Sentence 1: I decided I wanted to be different. Sentence 2: I went to see the eye doctor. Sentence 3: I asked him for purple prescription contacts. Sentence 4: He showed me the colors he had in stock.
target: I chose a beautiful violet shade.

input: Title: Lawyer. Sentence 1: The man consulted his lawyer. Sentence 2: The lawyer gave him advice. Sentence 3: The man followed the advice. Sentence 4: Later there was a lawsuit.
target: The lawyer's advice protected the man.

input: Title: The Zebra. Sentence 1: Natalie saw a zebra at the zoo. Sentence 2: She thought its stripes were so amazing! Sentence 3: She stared at it for a long time. Sentence 4: She took a few pictures to remember it by.
target: Zebras were soon her favorite animal.

input: Title: Mowing The Lawn. Sentence 1: Terry works seventy hours a week. Sentence 2: He came home one day and was exhausted from working so hard. Sentence 3: Terry looked outside and saw his lawn was very long. Sentence 4: He groaned and went outside to get the lawnmower.
target: As he was mowing Terry decided to move to an apartment.

input: Title: Cancer. Sentence 1: CJ went for a routine mammogram. Sentence 2: The next morning her doctor called to say they saw something odd. Sentence 3: The doctor asked CJ to come back into the office for a biopsy. Sentence 4: Three days later CJ got the news she had breast cancer.
target: CJ was terrified but agreed to do whatever necessary to save her life.

input: Title: Stinky Armpits. Sentence 1: Mandy was worried everyone would smell her stinky armpits. Sentence 2: She hadn't been able to shower on account of the power being out. Sentence 3: She'd used some water and a paper towel to attempt some basic hygiene. Sentence 4: Mandy didn't think it was enough.
target: She knew she'd be humiliated if anyone thought she was classless.

input: Title: Art. Sentence 1: Pam has been working on a mural at her office. Sentence 2: Today, she was hoping to finish it. Sentence 3: When she got there she was shocked. Sentence 4: It had been vandalized.
target: Pam was very upset.

input: Title: The Last Cigarette. Sentence 1: Larry was trying to quit smoking. Sentence 2: He was at a bar and temptation was everywhere. Sentence 3: He tried to avoid it. Sentence 4: Eventually he broke down and asked someone for a cigarette.
target: Larry smoked it as he promised himself it was the last one.

input: Title: Love Works. Sentence 1: Wally was a Golden Retriever born without eyes. Sentence 2: Thinking he was useless, the breeder wanted to euthanize him. Sentence 3: Fortunately, a rescue group saved Wally and found him a home. Sentence 4: Wally's family helped him become a therapy dog for a nursing home.
target: Far from useless, he proved that where there is love, there is value.

input: Title: The Basketball. Sentence 1: Omer was excited for his birthday party. Sentence 2: At the party, his friend Sam gave him a birthday present. Sentence 3: Omer was very excited. Sentence 4: He opened the package and found a basketball.
target: Omer hated basketball so he gave it away.

input: Title: New Boss. Sentence 1: The man went to work. Sentence 2: He heard he had a new boss. Sentence 3: The new boss avoided him. Sentence 4: The man wondered why.
target: The new boss fired him at the end of the day.

input: Title: The Skating Rink. Sentence 1: Winter had arrived in Minnesota. Sentence 2: The local kids spent a lot of time at the skating rink. Sentence 3: They would skate in circles every day for hours. Sentence 4: Sometimes they would play hockey.
target: The skating rink was a fun place to play in the winter!

input: Title: Bad sale. Sentence 1: I went to the mall yesterday. Sentence 2: I thought there was a sale. Sentence 3: So I showed up at the store. Sentence 4: There was no sale.
target: I was so upset.

input: Title: The Stuck Jeep. Sentence 1: Sam went to the beach. Sentence 2: He parked his jeep on the sand. Sentence 3: The jeep got stuck in the sand. Sentence 4: Sam had to call his friends to help him out.
target: Sam and his friends managed to get the jeep out of the sand.

input: Title: New shoes. Sentence 1: Jane wanted new shoes. Sentence 2: She decided to shop around. Sentence 3: She finally found the best deal. Sentence 4: She was able to buy them.
target: She was able to.

input: Title: Stitches. Sentence 1: Kia had stepped on broken glass. Sentence 2: She had cut her foot badly. Sentence 3: She went to the emergency room. Sentence 4: There, the doctor examined the jagged wound.
target: He told Kia that she needed several stitches!

input: Title: The Grass. Sentence 1: I had never mowed grass before a day in my life. Sentence 2: I walked outside, worried if I could manage it. Sentence 3: I tried starting the mower, and began to push it around the yard. Sentence 4: It turned out to be a lot easier than I thought it would be.
target: The only issue I encountered was simply that it was very hot that day.

input: Title: Jazmin wrecks. Sentence 1: Jazmin is driving her blue car home. Sentence 2: While driving she sees a deer in the road. Sentence 3: She hits the deer. Sentence 4: She gets out of her car to check on it.
target: The deer is dead and her car is totaled.

input: Title: Surprise Dish. Sentence 1: Hannah rushed to the fridge. Sentence 2: She reached out for a plate with food. Sentence 3: Her face shriveled up after taking one bite. Sentence 4: Ben took the plate away.
target: He told Hannah not to eat his rice pudding.

input: Title: Cheese. Sentence 1: My husband said he was craving cheese. Sentence 2: I went to buy groceries the next day. Sentence 3: I noticed a cheese assortment in a tray. Sentence 4: I purchased it and took it home to him.
target: He smiled when he saw it,and said thank you.

input: Title: Starfish. Sentence 1: The other day I was at the beach. Sentence 2: I was walking on the shore when I saw a starfish. Sentence 3: I had never seen one up close before, so I picked it up. Sentence 4: It was still alive when I picked it up.
target: I threw the starfish back into the ocean.

input: Title: First Date. Sentence 1: Bobby went to school with a beautiful girl named Cindy. Sentence 2: Bobby had a huge crush on her. Sentence 3: One day Bobby asked Cindy out for a cup of coffee. Sentence 4: Cindy agreed and the two went off to the coffee shop.
target: Bobby made a great first impression and even got a kiss.

input: Title: Rich or poor. Sentence 1: Gina wanted to marry a rich man. Sentence 2: So she frequented a rich neighborhood to attract one. Sentence 3: While on the subway to get there, she met Matt. Sentence 4: He was poor, but her heart started to beat faster.
target: She gave up her dream to marry a rich man to marry love instead.

input: Title: The Train. Sentence 1: The train pulled into the station. Sentence 2: Peter and his brother hopped on board. Sentence 3: They were heading back home. Sentence 4: They packed their bags and took their seats.
target: The train started to move, they were on the way back.

input: Title: Pregnancy. Sentence 1: Kate is pregnant. Sentence 2: She feels very sick for the first few months. Sentence 3: Her stomach becomes big very quickly. Sentence 4: She makes an appointment with her doctor.
target: Kate finds out at the doctor that she is pregnant with twins.

input: Title: Self Employed. Sentence 1: I am self-employed via online freelancing platforms. Sentence 2: My own work ethic guides my rate of pay. Sentence 3: If I slow down then my rate of pay declines. Sentence 4: It is motivational but also stressful.
target: I find that it makes me need to rush through some tasks.

input: Title: The Competition. Sentence 1: Randy was studying art and his professor told him he was talented. Sentence 2: The professor suggested Randy enter a statewide drawing competition. Sentence 3: Randy felt confident he'd win and eagerly anticipated the day. Sentence 4: The night before, Randy fell and broke his drawing hand!
target: Randy tried using his other hand and won second place.

input: Title: Fresh flower. Sentence 1: Kara went flower picking. Sentence 2: She always loved flower picking. Sentence 3: She loved getting her hands on fresh flowers. Sentence 4: She found the perfect one.
target: She immediately put it in a vase.

input: Title: Firegroup. Sentence 1: Group A felt the company cars should be red. Sentence 2: Group B hyper actively campaigned to make them yellow. Sentence 3: Things were coming to a head as disagreement turned to rage. Sentence 4: A newcomer suggested a compromise between the groups.
target: Fiery red company sedans were soon all the rage in town!

input: Title: Slow Elevator. Sentence 1: Tom's apartment building had an old elevator. Sentence 2: It was very slow. Sentence 3: Tom decided to take the stairs instead. Sentence 4: Over time Tom noticed he was getting in better shape.
target: Eventually he could get upstairs faster than the elevator.

input: Title: Scare. Sentence 1: Brit was sixteen and feared she was pregnant. Sentence 2: Her period was late and she had had unsafe sex once. Sentence 3: Finally she bought a test and took it. Sentence 4: Thankfully, it was negative, but Brit had learned her lesson.
target: She vowed to never again have unprotected sex with anyone!

input: Title: Bill's Bad Wrist. Sentence 1: Bill fell off his bike and twisted his arm. Sentence 2: He had lingering pain in his wrist, and had trouble working. Sentence 3: Bill purchased a wrist brace from a local store. Sentence 4: Bill put the brace on as instructed.
target: The brace helped a lot, and Bill was able to work.

input: Title: Papaya. Sentence 1: Angie bought a variety of fruits for her guests. Sentence 2: As she wanted to impress them, they were all exotic. Sentence 3: One of the guest tried a papaya and choked. Sentence 4: Angie run to their rescue.
target: But it turned out that the guest had only choked on their own saliva.

input: Title: Russ. Sentence 1: Russ worked at a shipping company. Sentence 2: The company laid him off. Sentence 3: He went back to work for them. Sentence 4: The same company laid him off again.
target: He thought it was time to find a new job.

input: Title: Billy's Sad Tale. Sentence 1: Little Billy had a crush on a cute girl in his class. Sentence 2: Billy decided to ask the girl out on a date. Sentence 3: The girl told Billy that she wouldn't date him because he had cooties. Sentence 4: The next day Billy sat on his front porch thinking about relationships.
target: Billy decided that he would never ask a girl out ever again.

input: Title: William loses his phone. Sentence 1: William was out one day at dinner. Sentence 2: He was with a bunch of friends. Sentence 3: They were eating at Pizza Hut. Sentence 4: When it was time to leave William couldn't find his phone.
target: William was so sad he lost his phone.

input: Title: Home Early. Sentence 1: Kia came home well before her Friday curfew. Sentence 2: Her parents asked her why she was home so early. Sentence 3: Kia said the party she'd been at had people drinking. Sentence 4: She hadn't wanted to be a part of it.
target: Kia's parents were very proud of her.

input: Title: Religious views. Sentence 1: Lars was an atheist. Sentence 2: He had a lot of friends who were religious despite this. Sentence 3: Once, he got into a deep discussion about religion with friends. Sentence 4: After several hours of discussion, Lars had lost a few friends.
target: He learned to never discuss religion with friends again.

input: Title: Stolen Balls. Sentence 1: I sell things on eBay. Sentence 2: Recently a friend gave me box of old golfballs. Sentence 3: I left them in the hallway of my building for five minutes. Sentence 4: When I got back, I found the balls had been taken.
target: Now I never leave anything in the hallway.

input: Title: Clothes. Sentence 1: I had lost my job and was unable to afford new clothes. Sentence 2: I put on a shirt that had holes in it and went to a thrift store. Sentence 3: I asked them if they had any old clothes to spare. Sentence 4: The thrift store manager gave me a bag of clothes.
target: I was very grateful for the gift.

input: Title: The Vlog Fail. Sentence 1: Annie wanted to have a successful Youtube channel. Sentence 2: She uploaded a bunch of her vlogs and tried to share them. Sentence 3: To her sadness her videos were getting no views. Sentence 4: At first, she considered cheating and buying views.
target: Then she realized that it was time to give up.

input: Title: The Pot. Sentence 1: Heather liked decorating her kitchen. Sentence 2: She found an antique pot that was really cool. Sentence 3: She hung it on the wall for decoration. Sentence 4: Her guests always commented on how interesting it was.
target: Heather had an interesting style.

input: Title: Would Have Gone Sooner. Sentence 1: Hal was led to a room in the back of the clinic. Sentence 2: A beautiful nurse asked him to open his mouth wide. Sentence 3: She shoved in a hard wooden board so he wouldn't bite his tongue. Sentence 4: Hal became a bit concerned when she brought out a large plastic tube.
target: The nurse reassured him and took x-rays of his mouth.

input: Title: Country Preacher. Sentence 1: Tom moved to a small town. Sentence 2: He looked for a church he liked. Sentence 3: Tom went to several. Sentence 4: Most of the preachers he ran into were crazy.
target: Tom decided not to go to church anymore.

input: Title: Christmas Still. Sentence 1: Little Danny was worried about Christmas last year. Sentence 2: He knew his daddy had lost his job. Sentence 3: Danny hoped and hoped his family could still have a Christmas. Sentence 4: On Christmas Eve, Danny heard interesting noises from downstairs.
target: On Christmas morning, Danny awoke to presents and hot chocolate!

input: Title: Guinea Pigs. Sentence 1: I had some guinea pigs growing up. Sentence 2: My stepdad took one of them. Sentence 3: He had it by the neck. Sentence 4: It was squealing.
target: He said its mother picked it up like that.

input: Title: New Basketball Shoes. Sentence 1: John was a basketball player. Sentence 2: He had blown out his shoes and needed a pair. Sentence 3: However, he could not afford a new pair. Sentence 4: He finally saved up enough to get what he wanted.
target: John was excited to buy his new shoes.

input: Title: Intolerant. Sentence 1: Anna grew up vegan. Sentence 2: On her eighteenth birthday she went for a treat. Sentence 3: She bought an ice cream cone! Sentence 4: But it gave her a terrible stomachache.
target: After 18 years, Anna had become lactose intolerant!

input: Title: Karaoke. Sentence 1: Mildred went to a karaoke night at a pub. Sentence 2: She was nervous about singing in front of strangers. Sentence 3: Mildred's friends encouraged her to go for it. Sentence 4: She selected a song and joined the queue.
target: When she sang, the mic cut out and no one heard her.

input: Title: Bob. Sentence 1: The couple had a baby. Sentence 2: They didn't have a name. Sentence 3: They asked the doctor for a name. Sentence 4: The doctor suggested a name.
target: They took the doctor's suggestion.

input: Title: The Wrong Decision. Sentence 1: Tom was a rookie politician. Sentence 2: He made a small vote. Sentence 3: Tom didn't realize the bill had far reaching consequences. Sentence 4: It turned out to be a bad choice.
target: The vote came back to haunt Tom often.

input: Title: Sea Turtles. Sentence 1: My husband and I set baby sea turtles free. Sentence 2: They were protected by an animal welfare group before they hatched. Sentence 3: My husband and I got to help release them safely. Sentence 4: They crawled from the sand and made it into the ocean.
target: We felt like we were helping the world by saving turtles.

input: Title: Homework Help. Sentence 1: Darrel was helping his brother with his homework. Sentence 2: His brother didn't understand what Darrel was showing him. Sentence 3: They decided to take a break. Sentence 4: Darrel tried to explain the problem again.
target: His brother understood much better after he had rested.

input: Title: Blackout. Sentence 1: As the family was eating dinner one winter day, the lights went out. Sentence 2: It was so dark no one could see. Sentence 3: The dad fumbled in the dark and found a lantern and matches. Sentence 4: The lantern filled the kitchen with a warm glow.
target: Pretending they lived long ago was fun as they ate dinner.

input: Title: Fast Ride.. Sentence 1: Corey road up the hill on his bike. Sentence 2: He ran out of energy halfway up the hill. Sentence 3: Corey's friend passed Corey on his bike. Sentence 4: Corey was inspired to ride harder.
target: Corey passed his friend after fifteen minutes.

input: Title: Planes. Sentence 1: The planes flying overhead woke me up. Sentence 2: I was grumpy, and tried to block out the noise. Sentence 3: Eventually I started to worry about it. Sentence 4: I got up and checked the news.
target: The military was just conducting practice runs.

input: Title: Tryouts. Sentence 1: Anna wanted to play for her school tennis team. Sentence 2: She went to the tryouts. Sentence 3: She thought she did poorly, and was despondent. Sentence 4: But the next day, the captain gave her great news.
target: Anna had made the school tennis team!

input: Title: The Roll Recipe. Sentence 1: Tabitha wanted to make rolls. Sentence 2: She had limited ingredients so she needed a particular recipe. Sentence 3: It took a lot of searching to find a good fit. Sentence 4: Finally she found a recipe that she could reasonably follow.
target: Luckily the rolls turned out really well.

input: Title: Through the Window. Sentence 1: Vince competed against Vinny in a soccer match. Sentence 2: They exchanged kicks for several minutes. Sentence 3: Vince tried to perform a power kick. Sentence 4: However, the soccer ball landed in the neighbor's window.
target: Vince tried to run but the neighbor caught him.

input: Title: Milkshake. Sentence 1: Brandon loved to drink milkshakes. Sentence 2: He loved the cherry on the top as well. Sentence 3: One day, he went to the store to buy a milk shake. Sentence 4: He was able to buy his favorite flavor as well.
target: Then, Brandon was able to enjoy a milkshake while watching TV.

input: Title: The Run. Sentence 1: Josh loved to run. Sentence 2: He would run everywhere he had to go. Sentence 3: Josh entered into a marathon in his city. Sentence 4: Josh was excited and nervous at the same time.
target: Josh did very well and finished the marathon tired but proud.

input: Title: Fake Boyfriend. Sentence 1: Tammy was single throughout high-school. Sentence 2: Her senior year all her friends had boyfriends. Sentence 3: Tammy created a fake boyfriend. Sentence 4: She claimed he went to another school.
target: Nobody really believed him.

input: Title: Broken Ac. Sentence 1: Gary recently purchased a new house. Sentence 2: However, Gary quickly realized one issue, no air conditioning. Sentence 3: Gary immediately went out to Home Depot to purchase a new one. Sentence 4: After installing, Gary turned on the unit, and began to feel relief.
target: Gary was glad he installed a new air conditioning unit.

input: Title: Still Looking. Sentence 1: My son-in-law got his PhD in philosophy in 2011. Sentence 2: He has been looking for a tenure track job since. Sentence 3: He applied for a job in Connecticut. Sentence 4: We were hopeful as we are in Boston, not too far away.
target: He just found out he did not get the job.

input: Title: The Evidence. Sentence 1: Sam's business partner was stealing from him. Sentence 2: The partner denied and this made Sam mad. Sentence 3: In a fit of rage he threw a thick book at the partner's head. Sentence 4: The partner fell to the ground and was dead.
target: Sam collected the book and the body and threw them in a dumpster.

input: Title: Health. Sentence 1: Karen was always overweight. Sentence 2: One day she went to see the doctor. Sentence 3: The doctor gave her advice on how to lose weight. Sentence 4: Karen worked very hard to follow the doctor's advice.
target: Karen became much healthier and happier.

input: Title: Delicious glass of wine. Sentence 1: I bought a bottle of wine yesterday. Sentence 2: I was curious to try some. Sentence 3: So I poured myself a glass. Sentence 4: To my delight it tasted very good.
target: I poured myself another glass.

input: Title: A Trip in the Woods. Sentence 1: Darrell wasn't exactly what you'd call a nature lover. Sentence 2: Sure he'd go on walks every once in awhile, but nothing like this. Sentence 3: He was in the middle of a week long hiking trip. Sentence 4: Darrell signed up for it on a whim.
target: He couldn't believe how much he enjoyed it.

input: Title: Christmas. Sentence 1: Edward took the electronic money and bought his daughter a doll. Sentence 2: The thought was nice. Sentence 3: But his family needed that money to keep the lights on. Sentence 4: His wife made him return it.
target: His daughter understood.

input: Title: Youth Soccer. Sentence 1: A coach wanted to start a soccer club. Sentence 2: He went to the city. Sentence 3: He paid a fee. Sentence 4: He started a youth soccer team.
target: They played their first game.

input: Title: Michael Jordan's ReSeller. Sentence 1: I wanted to resell Michael Jordan sneakers. Sentence 2: However I did not know where to begin. Sentence 3: I ordered a book about selling stuff online. Sentence 4: I read the book from cover to cover.
target: I made the decision not to resell Michael Jordans sneakers.

input: Title: The Sweater. Sentence 1: Jill was knitting her boyfriend Sam a sweater for his birthday. Sentence 2: She went into his closet to get another sweater to size it to. Sentence 3: But when she gave it to him it was way too small. Sentence 4: She realized she had accidentally used his little brother's sweater.
target: So his little brother got the one she had knitted since it fit him.

input: Title: Michael goes to prom. Sentence 1: Michael was worried he wouldn't have a date for the prom. Sentence 2: It was only weeks away and nobody had said yes to him. Sentence 3: As prom came closer he was even more worried. Sentence 4: Then one day his best friend Jill asked him to go to prom with him.
target: Michael didn't know what to say he was so happy and excited to go!

input: Title: Gift Card. Sentence 1: For Christmas I was given a gift card to my favorite restaurant. Sentence 2: I did not use it for a few months. Sentence 3: In March, I decided to use it for my anniversary. Sentence 4: When we went to pay, the card did not work.
target: Apparently the gift giver never activated the card for me.

input: Title: Salad. Sentence 1: Ian was at the mall. Sentence 2: And he was going to buy a burger at the food court, like usual. Sentence 3: But a new salad bar opened up. Sentence 4: And he decided to try it out.
target: It was so good that he didn't buy burgers anymore.

input: Title: Milk Cow. Sentence 1: Richard and Mary raised dairy cows. Sentence 2: One day one of their cows was very sick. Sentence 3: Mary examined the cow. Sentence 4: She asked Richard to call the doctor.
target: The doctor came and helped the cow get better.

input: Title: Jerry retires. Sentence 1: Jerry has been working all his life. Sentence 2: Jerry is tired of work. Sentence 3: One evening while working. Sentence 4: He tells everyone is he retiring.
target: He spends his final days at work before retiring.

input: Title: The Plane. Sentence 1: The family had been at the airport for hours. Sentence 2: Their plane was having mechanical issues. Sentence 3: Finally, it was time to board. Sentence 4: The mom was too nervous after the issues.
target: She refused to get on.

input: Title: Ice Skating. Sentence 1: David and Katie were on a date. Sentence 2: They decided ice skating sounded fun. Sentence 3: They held hands and skated around. Sentence 4: It was very romantic and sweet!
target: They were happy they'd experienced skating together.

input: Title: First Born. Sentence 1: Jenny was a princess in a European country. Sentence 2: She was the first born child but she had a younger brother. Sentence 3: She wanted to push for a law that would abolish the male preference. Sentence 4: She passed a law through parliament despite her brother's complaints.
target: She felt accomplished but quickly fell ill and died shortly after.

input: Title: Playing Pokemon. Sentence 1: Jake loved card games. Sentence 2: His favorite was Pokemon. Sentence 3: Unfortunately nobody else wanted to play with him. Sentence 4: He was forced to play the game alone.
target: Eventually jake gave it up and moved on.

input: Title: French Press. Sentence 1: We went to a nice romantic getaway for our anniversary. Sentence 2: We got couples massages and just relaxed all weekend. Sentence 3: The place came with a free breakfast so we checked it out. Sentence 4: We ordered some french press coffee for breakfast.
target: Oh my it was some of the best coffee I have ever had in my whole life.

input: Title: Farewell. Sentence 1: The New York Yankees have forced Alex Rodriguez out. Sentence 2: They announced earlier this week that A-Rod would be retiring. Sentence 3: His last game will be this Friday August 12th. Sentence 4: The Yanks have not played him much these final few games.
target: It appears that A-Rod has been forced out of baseball.

input: Title: Soda. Sentence 1: I drank a soda too late. Sentence 2: It kept me up for several hours. Sentence 3: I thought about drinking another. Sentence 4: I pulled it out from the fridge.
target: I decided to put it back.

input: Title: Stubborn Bull. Sentence 1: Scott had a bull on his ranch named Hobbes. Sentence 2: Hobbes was a stubborn bull. Sentence 3: It would buck and charge at anyone who came near it. Sentence 4: Scott wouldn't give up on Hobbes and trained him everyday.
target: After six months, Hobbes was one of Scott's most loyal animals.

input: Title: Movie Photo. Sentence 1: I collect old photos. Sentence 2: I saw an ebay listing for a movie photo from 1962. Sentence 3: The merchant wanted only $6. Sentence 4: I bought the photo right away.
target: I am eager to get it.

input: Title: The Lost Dog. Sentence 1: Tom lost his dog. Sentence 2: He put up flyers everywhere. Sentence 3: He posted about it online. Sentence 4: Finally he got a call about it.
target: Someone had run him over recently.

input: Title: New Painting. Sentence 1: Jane bought a new painting for the apartment. Sentence 2: Her boyfriend didn't know about it. Sentence 3: He hated the way it looked. Sentence 4: They got into an argument over it.
target: Jane eventually convinced him to keep it up.

input: Title: Skates. Sentence 1: Tom and Jack were best friends on the hockey team. Sentence 2: They were very competitive and gambled on their next scrimmage. Sentence 3: Tom was poor and Jack came from a rich family. Sentence 4: Tom had low quality skates.
target: Tom's skates broke during the scrimmage and Tom lost money.

input: Title: Wrong Seat. Sentence 1: Gina's baby was quietly sitting on the couch. Sentence 2: Gina was on her way to sit after grabbing a bowl of food. Sentence 3: While she was about to rest herself, she stared at the bowl. Sentence 4: She didn't notice the baby and ended up sitting on her.
target: The baby had to cry in order for Gina to notice.

input: Title: Commission. Sentence 1: Kyle worked at an electronics store. Sentence 2: He got commissions off of sales he made in his department. Sentence 3: His parents were looking to buy a new flat screen TV. Sentence 4: They bought their TV from Kyle.
target: Kyle got a large commission off of the sale.

input: Title: Bipolar. Sentence 1: My friend Bob's daughter T came up to visit him last week. Sentence 2: She lives in TN but used to live in Boston. Sentence 3: Bob rented a car for T to get around. Sentence 4: One day Bob was in the car when T cut off three people.
target: Bob argued with T as he found she was not taking her bipolar meds.

input: Title: Pinball wizard. Sentence 1: Caroline walked to the store. Sentence 2: She saw a new pinball game. Sentence 3: She got two dollars worth of quarters. Sentence 4: She played the pinball game for an hour.
target: She got her name on the machine for highest score.

input: Title: Dog Walks. Sentence 1: Terry was walking several dogs to make money. Sentence 2: She didn't mind it and even liked the dogs. Sentence 3: Suddenly one dog broke free and ran off. Sentence 4: Terry chased him along with the other dogs.
target: Luckily they caught the runaway and sent him home.

input: Title: Mice Are Creepy. Sentence 1: Jana hated mice with a passion. Sentence 2: Their beady little eyes creeped her out. Sentence 3: If she saw a mouse anywhere, she couldn't relax for the next hour. Sentence 4: One day she came upon a rat that lived in the storage shed.
target: After that, she wasn't that afraid of little mice any more.

input: Title: Liam & Owen's Afternoon. Sentence 1: Liam and Owen came home from school full of energy on a rainy day. Sentence 2: Because of the rain, Liam and Owen had to stay inside until bedtime. Sentence 3: To exert some energy, Liam and Owen rode scooters around the house. Sentence 4: Once they were bored with scooters, they watched some television.
target: After dinner and bathing, Liam and Owen went to sleep.

input: Title: The Suit. Sentence 1: Sal was attending a wedding. Sentence 2: He wore a suit to the wedding. Sentence 3: He spilled a bit of food on his suit. Sentence 4: Sal couldn't get the food off of his suit.
target: He brought the suit to the cleaners the next day.

input: Title: My Tarantula. Sentence 1: When I was ten years old, I got a tarantula. Sentence 2: I named her Medusa, because she was a little bit scary. Sentence 3: All of my friends were terrified of Medusa. Sentence 4: Sometimes she got out of her aquarium, and I had to look for her.
target: My friends always refused to go into my room until she was caught.

input: Title: Peace and Quiet?. Sentence 1: The house was quieter than usual. Sentence 2: With 3 young children that is not a common occurrence. Sentence 3: Looking in the tv room I saw the 2 oldest playing a video game. Sentence 4: I went into the kitchen and found my guilty looking 2 year old.
target: She had redecorated the walls and herself in bright blue marker.

input: Title: Birthday party. Sentence 1: John's birthday party was yesterday. Sentence 2: His parents threw a big party for him. Sentence 3: They invited all his friends. Sentence 4: They had all kinds of food.
target: It was a really fun party.

input: Title: Preacher 2. Sentence 1: Preacher the parrot inched down the bar. Sentence 2: He was eyeing me from the side of his head. Sentence 3: I was sitting on the couch beside him. Sentence 4: He suddenly yelled hello.
target: I jumped very hard, and everyone laughed.

input: Title: Horseback riding. Sentence 1: Suzy went for her first horseback riding lesson. Sentence 2: She was having fun. Sentence 3: But then all the sudden she fell off the horse. Sentence 4: She hurt her leg.
target: It was painful and she had to go to the hospital.

input: Title: Long Essay. Sentence 1: Tom was writing his first college essay. Sentence 2: He took a lot of time on it. Sentence 3: He made sure to cover as much as possible. Sentence 4: Tom's grade was very disappointing, though.
target: His professor told him that substance was more important than length.

input: Title: The Funeral. Sentence 1: Sally was sad when her fish died. Sentence 2: Her brother wanted to flush the fish down the toilet. Sentence 3: Sally insisted that there be a proper burial for her goldfish. Sentence 4: She wrote a eulogy and invited her family to the backyard.
target: It took the family nearly ten minutes to say goodbye to Sally's fish.

input: Title: Fever. Sentence 1: Jani was stuck in bed with a fever for a few days. Sentence 2: Since feeling better, she's been anxious to exercise again. Sentence 3: She cannot stay still for that long. Sentence 4: Jani eased into some pilates.
target: She could tell she wasn't one hundred percent yet.

input: Title: The Wet Patio. Sentence 1: Erica was walking on the patio near the pool. Sentence 2: The patio was wet. Sentence 3: Erica slipped in the water. Sentence 4: She fell into the pool.
target: Everyone laughed at Erica.

input: Title: Zaddyfrack and the Rain. Sentence 1: Zaddyfracks is a black cat. Sentence 2: Zaddyfracks loves to go outside. Sentence 3: When he went to the door it was raining. Sentence 4: Zaddyfrack stood at the open door for hours.
target: Finally the rain stopped and Zaddyfracks went outside.

input: Title: The Missing Kitten. Sentence 1: Becky's parents gave her a kitten for her birthday. Sentence 2: The next morning the kitten was gone. Sentence 3: Becky called for it but couldn't find it. Sentence 4: Becky was distraught.
target: She found the kitten sleeping under her bed.

input: Title: Internet. Sentence 1: A couple's internet went out. Sentence 2: They called the cable company. Sentence 3: They sent someone to fix it. Sentence 4: It took the repairman forever.

input: Title: Anita The Elder. Sentence 1: Anita was very old. Sentence 2: Anita  became sick. Sentence 3: Anita's family put her in a nursing home. Sentence 4: The doctor told Anita that she couldn't return home.
target: Anita was very sad about not being able to return home to her house.

input: Title: Long hike. Sentence 1: I went hiking yesterday. Sentence 2: It was horrible. Sentence 3: By the end of the hike it started to rain. Sentence 4: Not to mention the exhausting six miles.
target: I passed out at the end.

input: Title: fishing. Sentence 1: Bryan wanted to learn how to fish. Sentence 2: He had begged his dad to take him out on a boat. Sentence 3: His dad decided to take him to a local lake to learn to fish. Sentence 4: He borrowed a boat from his friend.
target: They went out and had a great time on the water.

input: Title: Little league. Sentence 1: Tom's son was on a little league team. Sentence 2: The team had a big game coming up. Sentence 3: Tom told his son he would come to the game. Sentence 4: At the last minute, a work meeting was scheduled.
target: Tom was sad that he would have to let his son down.

target: Luckily, it healed into a faint pink line.

input: Title: Sweet apple pie. Sentence 1: Tommy was a very good chef. Sentence 2: He specialised in making desserts. Sentence 3: Despite it's simplicity, his favourite dessert to make was apple pie. Sentence 4: He entered his apple pie into a local bakery competition.
target: He couldn't believe it when he won unanimously.

input: Title: The To-Do List. Sentence 1: Erin was stressed out. Sentence 2: She had so many things to do and so little time! Sentence 3: She made a list and started checking them off. Sentence 4: She was determined to get organized!
target: She had a plan and was feeling more relaxed.

target: They finally felt at home.

target: He wrote up several infractions before he even entered the house.

input: Title: hubris. Sentence 1: Jil needed a new fan for the living room. Sentence 2: Her husband Ben said he could install it. Sentence 3: Jil was skeptical but had to give in to Ben's ego. Sentence 4: Ben spent about an hour before he said it was all done.
target: Later that night, the fan came crashing down on his head.

input: Title: Hot Kitchen. Sentence 1: Rob needed to bake a cake for someone's birthday. Sentence 2: But it was too hot to turn on his oven. Sentence 3: So he planned to bake the cake late at night. Sentence 4: But he had trouble staying awake.
target: When he woke up, he realized he never baked the cake.

input: Title: Short Stuff. Sentence 1: Billy wanted to marry Sally. Sentence 2: He got down on one knee to propose. Sentence 3: She looked apprehensive. Sentence 4: She told him she couldn't marry someone so short.
target: He went home and cried.

input: Title: Summer Trip. Sentence 1: Allie promised her cousin she would visit him this summer. Sentence 2: She had packed her favorite toys and games to play with her cousin. Sentence 3: When she finished packing her dad drove Allie to the airport. Sentence 4: This would be her first airplane ride alone to visit her cousin.
target: When her airplane landed her cousin and aunt was there to greet her.

input: Title: The Pearl Necklace. Sentence 1: Emma love wearing pearls. Sentence 2: Her favorite piece was a long pearl necklace. Sentence 3: She wore them with a great, classic dress. Sentence 4: Whenever she wore them together, she felt classy and pretty.
target: Emma's accessories always made her feel put together.

input: Title: No Snacks. Sentence 1: Melissa was trying to find something to eat. Sentence 2: She opened the door to the fridge. Sentence 3: She looked steadily at her options. Sentence 4: Nothing sounded good to her.
target: She closed the door as she walked back to her room.

input: Title: The Bookstore. Sentence 1: Dawn and her mother loved going to the bookstore on Tuesday's. Sentence 2: This Tuesday they were trying a new one. Sentence 3: When they walked in that fell in love with the new store. Sentence 4: They each bought three new books.
target: This would be the store they shopped at now for books.

input: Title: Martin loses a shoe. Sentence 1: Martin is walking down the street. Sentence 2: While walking he gets his foot stuck. Sentence 3: He tries to get his foot out of the drain. Sentence 4: He loses his show while trying to remove his foot.
target: He frees his foot but he lost his shoe.

input: Title: Pears. Sentence 1: Tracy planted a tree. Sentence 2: The tree was a pear tree. Sentence 3: She took care of it. Sentence 4: It grew and grew!
target: She then picked fruit from it.

input: Title: Broken Down Car. Sentence 1: Tim's car broke down. Sentence 2: He couldn't get it fixed because he wasn't getting enough work hours. Sentence 3: He wasn't getting enough hours because he didn't have transportation. Sentence 4: Tim had to take the bus to work.
target: It took him months to get enough money to fix his car.

target: He had a small piece of lead permanently imbedded in his arm.

target: It gave Tom the courage he needed to get the job, though.

input: Title: Cass and her Grandma. Sentence 1: Cass is very close to her grandmother. Sentence 2: Cass' grandmother get sick and goes to the hospital. Sentence 3: Cass spends every day with her grandmother in the hospital. Sentence 4: When Cass' grandmother starts to get better.
target: Cass is overjoyed when her grandmother is released from the hospital.

input: Title: Baseball. Sentence 1: Cynthia loved to play baseball a lot. Sentence 2: One day, she realized that she was very good. Sentence 3: She took the sport seriously and practiced every day. Sentence 4: One day, she was approached by a pro team.
target: Now, Cynthia gets payed to play baseball.

input: Title: The Ghost. Sentence 1: Patty was confused. Sentence 2: She was having a Halloween party and she didn't recognize someone. Sentence 3: They were dressed as a ghost. Sentence 4: She went over to ask then who they were.
target: They saw her coming and ran away.

input: Title: Out of Toilet Paper. Sentence 1: Shelly went to the store. Sentence 2: She went especially to get toilet paper. Sentence 3: When she was shopping she got distracted and bought lots of candy. Sentence 4: She completely forgot about the toilet paper.
target: She remembered when she was on the toilet and there was none.

input: Title: The Best. Sentence 1: John thought he was the best checkers player in the world. Sentence 2: At a tournament a young child challenged him. input: Title: Jerry gets buff. Sentence 1: Jerry is a skinny kid. Sentence 2: Jerry begins to work out. Sentence 3: Jerry is seeing results. Sentence 4: Jerry starts drinking protein shakes.
target: In two months Jerry has the body he always wanted.

input: Title: Making choices. Sentence 1: Rebecca hesitated between doing her master's degree or find a job. Sentence 2: She talked to all the people she loved to ask for advice. input: Title: Asparagus. Sentence 1: Helen hated Asparagus a lot. Sentence 2: She hated it so much she never ate it. Sentence 3: One day, she accidentally tasted a little. Sentence 4: She liked it so much she ate more.
target: Now Helen eats Asparagus every single day.

target: Amy had to return all the baby boy clothes.

target: Her favorite part was all of the delicious food.

input: Title: Hiking. Sentence 1: Hiking was one of Sam's favorite activities. Sentence 2: He was greatly looking forward to going that day. target: The grand finale to the day was the beautiful sunset!

input: Title: The Race. Sentence 1: The two teams were ready to compete. Sentence 2: They had to run through the forest and end up at the finish line. Sentence 3: One group got lost immediately. Sentence 4: The other group ran straight to the finish line.
target: It was a hard race and they were happy when it was over.

input: Title: Test. Sentence 1: The woman took a pregnancy test. Sentence 2: It was positive. Sentence 3: She told all of her friends. Sentence 4: She went to the doctor.
target: The doctor said she was not pregnant.

input: Title: Alison is pregnant. Sentence 1: Alison is a young girl in high school. Sentence 2: She meets a boy. Sentence 3: She spends all of her time with him. Sentence 4: She gets surprising news one day.
target: She is pregnant with the boys baby.

target: So the IRS took all of his property.

input: Title: Nose. Sentence 1: The tiny black nose was very shiny. Sentence 2: The hard plastic was placed over the small downturned mouth. Sentence 3: The seamstress looked at the little girl and smiled. Sentence 4: She told her it was a sad puppy who needed love.

input: Title: Basketball Game. Sentence 1: Terry had bought he and his sister these basketball tickets long ago. Sentence 2: It was surprise for his sister's birthday and she knew ad no idea. target: She sleeps through the entire movie.

input: Title: Fundamentals of Golf. Sentence 1: Tom took up the sport of golf in April. Sentence 2: Soon he became frustrated that his golf score was not improving. input: Title: Quitter. Sentence 1: Peter was 16 and wanted to quit school. Sentence 2: He wished he could work all day instead of sitting in class. Sentence 3: But his parents said he had to stay in school. Sentence 4: Later in life, Peter realized they had done the right thing.

input: Title: Hot. Sentence 1: My grandmother turned off the air conditioner. Sentence 2: She thought it was cold. Sentence 3: It was almost 90 degrees. Sentence 4: Everyone else was sweating.
target: They turned on a fan.

input: Title: Sleeping. Sentence 1: Arden knew he needed to get to sleep because he needs to work nights. Sentence 2: The change of hours at work was giving him trouble adjusting. target: The medicine helped him sleep so he could go to work.

target: Liv was so freaked out, she cut off their relationship for good.

target: A surprise shows up there are two babies instead of one.
