input: Title: The Serial Killer. Sentence 1: Marlon had a history assignment. Sentence 2: He was supposed to read a historical book and do a book report. Sentence 3: Marlon was a fan of horror movies and gore. Sentence 4: He decided to read about a famous serial killer from the past.
target: Marlon did his report on the serial killer.

input: Title: Neglect. Sentence 1: I started a pot of pasta. Sentence 2: I started cleaning while it cooked. Sentence 3: After awhile, I felt hungry. Sentence 4: I suddenly remembered the pot on the stove.
target: The pot was ruined.

input: Title: The Cars. Sentence 1: Liz and Kate were going on a road trip. Sentence 2: Kate was unsure about taking her car because it was older. Sentence 3: Liz had a new car but didn't want to put a lot of miles on it. Sentence 4: She refused to reconsider.
target: In the end they decided to take Kate's car.

input: Title: Ill. Sentence 1: Kenji fell very ill. Sentence 2: He was hospitalized for a week. Sentence 3: Kenji missed over two weeks of school. Sentence 4: His teachers were very understanding in catching him up.
target: Kenji is now feeling better and getting good grades.

input: Title: The super bowl.. Sentence 1: Last year I went to an awesome Super Bowl party. Sentence 2: My friends hosted it at their house. Sentence 3: All my friends were there. Sentence 4: We laughed at the commercials and loved the game.
target: Our team won the Super Bowl, it was awesome!

input: Title: The New Car. Sentence 1: The family had been car shopping for weeks. Sentence 2: They got a fancy new car. Sentence 3: It was the nicest one they'd ever owned. Sentence 4: They drove it around town to show it off.
target: It was a great new ride!

input: Title: Breakfast Pancakes. Sentence 1: Craig had a party one night. Sentence 2: The next morning he woke up to a pleasant aroma. Sentence 3: Someone he didn't know made pancakes for everyone. Sentence 4: Craig was thankful but thought it was weird.
target: They became friends.

input: Title: Pasta. Sentence 1: Kia was making spaghetti for dinner. Sentence 2: She thought it was a fast easy way to feed her family. Sentence 3: But she left the noodles unattended for too long. Sentence 4: They became mushy and disgusting!
target: Kia was disappointed in herself.

input: Title: Infraction. Sentence 1: Bob hit Matthew on the head very hard. Sentence 2: Everyone in the bar froze when it happened. Sentence 3: Only the barmaid thought of calling the cops. Sentence 4: When they arrived, Bob was still standing over Matt.
target: They cuffed him to bring him to their car.

input: Title: Song. Sentence 1: Gertrude had a song stuck in her head. Sentence 2: The song has been stuck in her head all day. Sentence 3: She decided to drown it out by watched some tv. Sentence 4: Unfortunately, a commercial with a catchy tune came on.
target: Now a different song is stuck in Gertrude's head.

input: Title: Bad Quality Juice. Sentence 1: Sierra picked up fruit punch from the grocery store. Sentence 2: She drove home afterwards. Sentence 3: When she opened the fruit punch, she poured some in a glass. Sentence 4: A worm came out of the container.
target: It was alive and it moved through the glass.

input: Title: Snow Day. Sentence 1: My boyfriend and I spent the holidays with my parents in Tennessee. Sentence 2: During our trip, it started to snow. Sentence 3: Being from California, my boyfriend hasn't really seen snow. Sentence 4: We made snow cream together.
target: He was so excited for his snow day.

input: Title: School Food Shock. Sentence 1: Randy told his mom that he wanted to buy lunch at school. Sentence 2: So she no longer made food for him to bring to school. Sentence 3: But Randy found himself gaining weight. Sentence 4: And he was sick more often.
target: When Randy's mom found out what they served, she was shocked.

input: Title: Sunbeam. Sentence 1: It had rained for days and the kids were misbehaving. Sentence 2: Molly cheered up as the sun broke through the clouds. Sentence 3: She took the kids to the park and let them use their pent up energy. Sentence 4: She took in the crisp, after rain air and felt very pleasant.
target: Molly called to the kids to leave as the clouds began to crawl back.

input: Title: Back to School Shopping. Sentence 1: Dan dreaded doing back to school shopping with his kids. Sentence 2: However, Dan had to purchase new backpacks and shoes for the kids. Sentence 3: Dan decided to go to the mall to get the school shopping done. Sentence 4: After looking through several stores, Dan didn't find anything.
target: Dan was disappointed that he did not find anything at the mall.

input: Title: Party. Sentence 1: Anna had thrown parties in high school, but not as an adult. Sentence 2: So her first dinner party as a wife was a nerve-wracking affair! Sentence 3: But her guests were happy with her hors d'oeuvres. Sentence 4: And the dinner itself blew them away!
target: Anna was thrilled that her party had been a success!

input: Title: Superhero. Sentence 1: I was inspired by Superman to become a superhero. Sentence 2: I would fight crime every night. Sentence 3: I bought a cool blue and green spandex costume. Sentence 4: My first night, I walked to an old alley.
target: However, I heard a cat moan and ran back home scared.

input: Title: Zoe's day at the beach.. Sentence 1: Zoe decided to go the beach one day. Sentence 2: When she arrived she found the beach to be very crowded. Sentence 3: She tried her best to relax but the other beach goers were too noisy. Sentence 4: Suddenly it started raining, making the other beach goers leave.
target: Zoe set up her beach umbrella, relaxing quietly under it in the rain.

input: Title: Chocolate gift. Sentence 1: Allie got something in the mail. Sentence 2: She went to go see what it was. Sentence 3: It was a box of chocolate. Sentence 4: When she got it she tried it.
target: It tasted awful.

input: Title: The Painting. Sentence 1: Grace was an artist. Sentence 2: SHe made a fantastic painting of the sunset. Sentence 3: She displayed it on her living room wall. Sentence 4: A friend loved it so much she offered her a lot of money for it.
target: Grace couldn't part with the painting.

input: Title: The Seashore Song. Sentence 1: Once, there lived a brother and sister who lost their family. Sentence 2: They were so sad. Sentence 3: They prayed for a sign that their parents were watching them. Sentence 4: One day, they went to the beach.
target: When they heard the ocean's song, they knew their parents were there.

input: Title: Throwing the Game. Sentence 1: Tom hated playing football. Sentence 2: He was good at it. Sentence 3: They forced him to play. Sentence 4: Tom decided to throw the big game.
target: He was finally kicked out of the team.

input: Title: Chess. Sentence 1: Tonight I played chess against a 1390 opponent. Sentence 2: My rating is 1450. Sentence 3: I was losing. Sentence 4: My opponent ignored a move.
target: I checkmated him.

input: Title: Rory's Unplanned Workout. Sentence 1: Rory began feeling sluggish after his thirtieth birthday. Sentence 2: It had been years since he'd played sports or worked out. Sentence 3: He got a new job across town. Sentence 4: To save money, he usually walked instead of taking the bus.
target: Getting so much exercise, he began to feel better.

input: Title: Valentine's Day. Sentence 1: Tom wanted to give his girlfriend the best Valentine's Day gift ever. Sentence 2: He bought a box of chocolates along with a dozen red roses. Sentence 3: Tom took her out for dinner and presented her with the gifts. Sentence 4: She was very happy, but surprised when Tom got down on one knee.
target: Tom asked her to marry him, and it truly was the best gift ever.

input: Title: Games. Sentence 1: My niece has a summer job with the Town of Greenfield. Sentence 2: She works at their pool. Sentence 3: The crew is winding up their summer. Sentence 4: The town threw a party for them yesterday.
target: They had fun playing in an inflatable gym.

input: Title: Tim gets a new Job. Sentence 1: The old man who greeted people outside CVS quit his job. Sentence 2: Tim was a worker at CVS. Sentence 3: His manager asked him if he wanted the man's job. Sentence 4: It payed better so Tim took it.
target: Tim hated being outside and went back to his old job.

input: Title: Teddy becomes president. Sentence 1: Teddy had a passion. Sentence 2: He had a passion to change his country for better. Sentence 3: So he ran for president. Sentence 4: Teddy told the american people what they wanted to hear.
target: Teddy got elected and become the president.

input: Title: The storm. Sentence 1: Did you hear all that wind last night? Sentence 2: The hurricane just missed us. Sentence 3: We got a lot of its wind and rain though. Sentence 4: I saw a few trees down on my block.
target: Thank goodness no one was harmed.

input: Title: Headrest. Sentence 1: A man wanted to take a flight. Sentence 2: He brought along his neck pillow. Sentence 3: He placed it behind his head. Sentence 4: He thought he made a good decision.
target: It made him fall asleep.

input: Title: Chocolate Covered Raisin. Sentence 1: My grandpa was sitting around a campfire one night. Sentence 2: He was eating chocolate covered raisins. Sentence 3: He dropped one and picked it up and ate it. Sentence 4: The next morning when he came out of his tent.
target: There in the middle of deer poop was the chocolate covered raisin.

input: Title: The Family Fight. Sentence 1: Kasey had found out she was pregnant young. Sentence 2: When she told her family they were all very mad. Sentence 3: Everyone in her family was upset and didn't want to talk to her. Sentence 4: She couldn't believe she was in a fight with her whole family.
target: Luckily when her baby came many of them softened up.

input: Title: Rob made dinner for his family. Sentence 1: Rob wanted to do something nice to treat his family. Sentence 2: He decided that it would be nice to give to make dinner. Sentence 3: He went to the store and bought all the ingredients. Sentence 4: He returned home, and fired up the stove.
target: His wife, and children all loved Rob when he made the meal!

input: Title: Election Fraud. Sentence 1: Jane wanted to be class president. Sentence 2: She knew she didn't have enough popularity to get the votes. Sentence 3: Jane decided to stuff the ballot box. Sentence 4: She was easily found out.
target: She was reprimanded and lectured thoroughly.

input: Title: Accidental Stabbing. Sentence 1: Kate was cooking dinner. Sentence 2: Her husband got home from work. Sentence 3: He tried to sneak up and hug her. Sentence 4: Kate had a knife in her hand and stabbed him by accident.
target: She had to call 911 for help.

input: Title: Bird Watching. Sentence 1: Jenny was going bird watching. Sentence 2: She loved to look at them at watch them fly. Sentence 3: There was a local park that had a lot of birds. Sentence 4: She went there and looked at them all.
target: Jenny had a wonderful time bird watching.

input: Title: New part time job. Sentence 1: Martha needed a part time job. Sentence 2: She wanted some extra money. Sentence 3: So she applied at the restaurant. Sentence 4: Thankfully they gave her the job.
target: Martha was so happy.

input: Title: Pop Tarts. Sentence 1: Ted wanted pop tarts for dinner. Sentence 2: His mom told him no. Sentence 3: He was angry that he couldn't eat what he wanted. Sentence 4: He snuck into the kitchen while his mom was out and ate the whole box.
target: He began to feel sick and wished he had listened.

input: Title: Gary breaks down. Sentence 1: Gary is driving to his grandmother's house. Sentence 2: He is worried about his car. Sentence 3: It starts to make a loud noise. Sentence 4: Gary continues to drive.
target: Gary's car explodes into flames as he dives out at the last minute.

input: Title: In Love. Sentence 1: Charlie met a great guy. Sentence 2: His name was Hank. Sentence 3: Charlie and Hank went on three dates. Sentence 4: Their relationship seemed great.
target: So they ran off and got married!

input: Title: glasses. Sentence 1: The man broke his glasses. Sentence 2: He did not have a spare. Sentence 3: He called his friend for help. Sentence 4: His friend took him to the mall.
target: The man got new glasses.

input: Title: Not Word from Word. Sentence 1: I was eating a steak and cheese sandwich around my family. Sentence 2: My brother asked for a bite. Sentence 3: Since I wasn't extremely hungry, I gave him my sandwich. Sentence 4: He ended up eating a large chunk of the sandwich.
target: I was furious and snatched it away from him.

input: Title: The Penalty Kick. Sentence 1: Juan stepped up to take the kick. Sentence 2: This was for all the marbles. Sentence 3: He ran up and lashed out a shot on goal. Sentence 4: The ball flew off his foot and into the goal.
target: Juan had won the game with his penalty kick!

input: Title: Rats!. Sentence 1: Linda couldn't figure out why the dryer wasn't working. Sentence 2: When she went to empty the filter it had hardly any lint in it. Sentence 3: She resorted to drying clothes twice. Sentence 4: Eventually she heard a noise late one night.
target: She went downstairs to find rats had nested in the dryer hose.

input: Title: First Grandbaby. Sentence 1: The older couple was excited to hear their daughter was pregnant. Sentence 2: They bought a lot of baby clothes. Sentence 3: The baby was born. Sentence 4: They came to see it.
target: They showered it with love.

input: Title: Craig's Cookies. Sentence 1: Craig was a famous cookie maker. Sentence 2: He invented a new cookie today. Sentence 3: The cookie was made of chocolate, peanut butter, and caramel. Sentence 4: He gave the cookies to an orphanage.
target: The orphanage loved them and was grateful for his cookies.

input: Title: Halloween Costume. Sentence 1: Jane worked on her Halloween costume for months. Sentence 2: She wanted to enter different costume contests. Sentence 3: Halloween weekend Jane went to several bars and clubs. Sentence 4: She didn't win a single contest.
target: Jane was distraught and cried about it for months.

input: Title: The dog. Sentence 1: Jessie ran a dog sitting company. Sentence 2: She was always very careful not to let them run off and escape. Sentence 3: One day however a dog ran out the door while it was open. Sentence 4: Jessie ran up and down the street trying to catch it.
target: She eventually caught it and has been extra careful ever since!

input: Title: Soda love. Sentence 1: Greg really loved to drink soda. Sentence 2: He learned about a new store that sells soda. Sentence 3: Greg invited his friend to go with him to the store. Sentence 4: They found many unusual brands of soda.
target: Greg was so happy, he bought 10 kinds of soda.

input: Title: Bungee Jumping. Sentence 1: Eric wanted to go bungee jumping. Sentence 2: But his mom said it was a bad idea. Sentence 3: Eric decided to go anyway. Sentence 4: And he had a great time.
target: So he decided to go bungee jumping every month.

input: Title: Hide and Seek. Sentence 1: Eric and Sheila were having a blast. Sentence 2: It was summer break and they loved playing outside. Sentence 3: Their favorite game was hide and seek. Sentence 4: They were both very good at it.
target: They spent almost every afternoon that summer playing.

input: Title: Airbnb. Sentence 1: My daughter's friend moved into her first apartment last September. Sentence 2: She is not good at managing her money. Sentence 3: She was thinking about moving back home after her lease. Sentence 4: But she was able to make money by posting her apartment on Airbnb.
target: She recently signed another lease.

input: Title: Being too Personal. Sentence 1: My cousin had an all ladies night now. Sentence 2: However, she only invited all of the kids. Sentence 3: Once their parents found out, they were irritated. Sentence 4: They didn't allow their kids to go anywhere.
target: As a result, my cousin had to cancel her plans.

input: Title: The Virus. Sentence 1: Our servers were infected by a virus today. Sentence 2: We had to wipe every drive on it. Sentence 3: Luckily we had backups though. Sentence 4: It took the whole weekend to restore the data.
target: Hopefully it doesn't happen again.

input: Title: Rain. Sentence 1: Laura had to walk to her second job after work. Sentence 2: When she came out of work it was raining out! Sentence 3: She was worried because she had to walk nearly three blocks! Sentence 4: She told me she tried to run but was worried she'd slip.
target: She ended up making it to work but was all wet!

input: Title: hungry. Sentence 1: The man was hungry. Sentence 2: He looked for a restaurant. Sentence 3: He could not find one that sounded good. Sentence 4: He bought two frozen dinners instead.
target: He ate them both.

input: Title: The DVD. Sentence 1: Abby loved watching a movie about the ocean. Sentence 2: Her mom bought her the DVD of it. Sentence 3: She watched it over and over again. Sentence 4: She even watched it in the car!
target: Abby wanted to spend all of her time watching that one dvd.

input: Title: Outage. Sentence 1: The power in Anne's house went out. Sentence 2: Everything was very dark. Sentence 3: Anne fished some candles from her dresser. Sentence 4: She lit them and could finally see.
target: Anne was glad for her preparedness.

input: Title: Ellie's limp. Sentence 1: Ellie started limping while at work. Sentence 2: Ellie decided it was bad enough to see a doctor. Sentence 3: The doctor told Ellie she had spurs in her feet. Sentence 4: The doctor fixed Ellie's feet.
target: Ellie was able to walk again without limping.

input: Title: Sarah's Habit. Sentence 1: Sarah has a bad habit. Sentence 2: All Sarah eats is candy and sweets. Sentence 3: She starts to notice a sharp pain in her teeth. Sentence 4: The dentist tells her she has 6 cavities!
target: Sarah decides she needs to start eating healthier.

input: Title: To do list. Sentence 1: I wrote a huge to do list that I need to complete. Sentence 2: Each item on the list shows what needs to be done. Sentence 3: After accomplishing every task I cross each item off my list. Sentence 4: Looking through what I accomplish made be feel good.
target: I felt like I can achieve anything if I put my mind to it.

input: Title: Spider Scare. Sentence 1: Ray was doing his homework when his littler sister ran into the room. Sentence 2: She screamed that there was a spider in the bathroom sink. Sentence 3: Like his little sister, Ray was also deathly afraid of spiders. Sentence 4: He tiptoed to the bathroom with a rolled up newspaper.
target: Ray laughed in relief when he saw it was just a toy spider prank.

input: Title: Haunted?. Sentence 1: People said the hotel was haunted. Sentence 2: They wanted to stay there, because it sounded interesting! Sentence 3: It was very old and beautiful. Sentence 4: They saw no signs it was haunted, but it was such fun!
target: They completely enjoyed their stay.

input: Title: The Accident. Sentence 1: Melissa rode her bike to school everyday. Sentence 2: One day on her way home she was hit by a white van. Sentence 3: She was carried away on a stretcher to the ambulance. Sentence 4: Fortunately she was okay, just a little bruised.
target: Her parents' were very relieved and happy she was not seriously hurt.

input: Title: No Gift For Jared. Sentence 1: Jared was bemoaning the fact that he hadn't gotten a birthday gift. Sentence 2: His wife told him that their budget was too tight. Sentence 3: Jared was still upset about his lack of a gift. Sentence 4: His wife pointed out all the times he'd splurged on take-out.
target: Jared realized that he was the reason he didn't receive a gift.

input: Title: Lots of Puppies. Sentence 1: My dog Betty recently had puppies. Sentence 2: She had a litter of 12. Sentence 3: They all loved to play. Sentence 4: We gave many away to loving homes.
target: We kept one very happy puppy.

input: Title: Sneaking In. Sentence 1: Caleb and Henry wanted to see a movie. Sentence 2: They snuck into the theater. Sentence 3: The usher saw the boys sneaking in. Sentence 4: He asked to see their tickets.
target: The boys were kicked out of the theater.

input: Title: The Shirt. Sentence 1: Harold hated to shop. Sentence 2: He found one shirt that fit him really well. Sentence 3: He bought it in ten different colors. Sentence 4: He liked not having to worry about what he would wear.
target: Harold threw on one of these shirts every chance he got.

input: Title: Getting a Job. Sentence 1: Jennifer wanted to get a good job. Sentence 2: She applied to a well known college. Sentence 3: She went to school for four years. Sentence 4: When she graduated she applied for a job.
target: She was offered a good position.

input: Title: No Seatbelt. Sentence 1: Freddie was driving home from work. Sentence 2: He wasn't wearing his seatbelt. Sentence 3: Freddie was pulled over by a cop. Sentence 4: He was given a ticket for not wearing his seatbelt.
target: Freddie always wore his seatbelt after that.

input: Title: The Ship. Sentence 1: I play a video game which sells ships and vehicles online. Sentence 2: My newest requirement is for a Scharnhorst class battleship. Sentence 3: The total price is forty two dollars. Sentence 4: I couldn't figure out where to get the money.
target: Then I remembered mturk, and now I'm writing short stories.

input: Title: Milton kicked out of the club. Sentence 1: Milton was dancing the night away with his girl at the club. Sentence 2: A man approached Milton's girl and started to flirt. Sentence 3: Milton got upset and shoved the man. Sentence 4: Milton was asked to leave the club.
target: Milton refused to leave so security kicked him out.

input: Title: Too Many Choices. Sentence 1: Zack was hungry and wanted to order food for delivery. Sentence 2: He didn't know whether to order pizza, Chinese, Mexican, or Thai. Sentence 3: He spent over an hour comparing menus and prices. Sentence 4: Eventually, he decided to make a grilled cheese sandwich instead.
target: Zack enjoyed his sandwich and was glad he hadn't spent extra money.

input: Title: Fishing Buddies. Sentence 1: Tommy likes fishing with his grandpa. Sentence 2: He wants to go fishing everyday with his grandpa. Sentence 3: His grandpa is excited about fishing too. Sentence 4: The grandpa becomes ill weeks before the trip.
target: He makes a speedy recovery and they go fishing as promised.

input: Title: Bitter Beer. Sentence 1: Ken never liked drinking beer. Sentence 2: After a while he decided to try different types. Sentence 3: Finally Ken found one he liked. Sentence 4: After a while Ken started liking different kinds.
target: Now he drinks several that he used to think are bitter.

input: Title: Little League Troubles. Sentence 1: In 1984 my wife's nephew joined Little League. Sentence 2: He became a pitcher. Sentence 3: He gave up eight runs in his first game. Sentence 4: He got depressed after the game.
target: We bought him pizza to cheer him up.

input: Title: French Toast. Sentence 1: Todd wanted to surprise his girlfriend. Sentence 2: He decided to cook her french toast. Sentence 3: As he was cooking, he got distracted. Sentence 4: He started smelling something burning.
target: Todd burned the french and ruined the surprise.

input: Title: Stainless. Sentence 1: Blair was embarrassed of her stained rug. Sentence 2: She wanted the rug to be spotless. Sentence 3: She bought a steam cleaner at the store. Sentence 4: She cleaned her rug spotless.
target: Her rug is now stain free.

input: Title: Money matters. Sentence 1: Alan's mom lived very far. Sentence 2: Every time he wanted to talk to her he had to pay extra. Sentence 3: As he was very close to his money, he didn't call her often. Sentence 4: When his mother died, he paid thousands of dollars to take a plane.
target: And he regretted not having spent a few dollars to talk to her.

input: Title: Movie Justice. Sentence 1: I went to the moves last night. Sentence 2: I saw a man in the theater filming the movie. Sentence 3: After the movie ended I saw two policeman standing in the lobby. Sentence 4: I then saw the bootlegger make a run for it.
target: The police caught him and took him to jail.

input: Title: The cute fox. Sentence 1: Tina was really bored one day. Sentence 2: She saw a little fox. Sentence 3: She decided to play with the fox. Sentence 4: The fox bit her however.
target: She then developed a disease.

input: Title: Free Books. Sentence 1: I work at a theater. Sentence 2: They were recently remodeling some of their offices. Sentence 3: One of them contained a large bookshelf. Sentence 4: They told everyone the books were up for grabs.
target: I took several large boxes of books home with me.

input: Title: Pure Evil. Sentence 1: A girl went into a cafe and approached the counter. Sentence 2: She asked if she could plug her cell phone charger in. Sentence 3: The cashier told her it was okay and plugged it in behind the counter. Sentence 4: When the girl left, the cashier secretly unplugged the charger.
target: He felt very evil for betraying her trust, but he never liked her.

input: Title: Detention. Sentence 1: My friends and I were bored at school one day. Sentence 2: We decided to vandalize the bathroom. Sentence 3: My teacher saw the vandalism and gave us detention. Sentence 4: My parents were very mad at me.
target: Detention went well, but I hope I never have to do it again.

input: Title: Graduating. Sentence 1: Today was the big day for Tony. Sentence 2: He was graduating college. Sentence 3: All of Tony's family was in the audience. Sentence 4: When Tony walked across the stage his family cheered.
target: Tony felt so proud of his great accomplishment.

input: Title: Keine. Sentence 1: Keine thought he was the best at picking the winning horse. Sentence 2: One day he bet his entire mortgage on a horse who was sure to win. Sentence 3: Keine's friend Joe bet against him. Sentence 4: At the third leg of the race, Keine's horse had a heart attack.
target: Now Joe lives in Keine's house, with Keine's ex-wife.

input: Title: Dangerous Conditions. Sentence 1: Martha had been told by her parents not to go out. Sentence 2: It had been snowing all day so the roads were slick with ice. Sentence 3: Martha grew bored of waiting inside. Sentence 4: So she rushed out to meet friends against her parents wishes.
target: Martha crashed the car after hitting a patch of black ice.

input: Title: Rice and Gravy. Sentence 1: Joe was good at cooking. Sentence 2: He decided to make rice and gravy. Sentence 3: While he was cooking his gravy, he forgot to add water. Sentence 4: His gravy started sticking.
target: He burnt his gravy and was so disappointed.

input: Title: The Amusement Park. Sentence 1: The kids were excited for their vacation. Sentence 2: They would be going to an amusement park! Sentence 3: They were determined to ride every ride. Sentence 4: On the morning they were going to leave, they missed their flight.
target: The trip would have to wait for another time.

input: Title: The Murder. Sentence 1: Archie was found murdered in his home. Sentence 2: The police looked for answers for years. Sentence 3: They could never solve the case. Sentence 4: Finally, Archie's friend confessed to the murder.
target: He wanted to clear his conscience before he died.

input: Title: Small Town Life. Sentence 1: Tim moved with his family. Sentence 2: They went from the city to a small town. Sentence 3: Tim thought it was really boring at first. Sentence 4: Over time the feeling never changed.
target: He moved out as soon as he could.

input: Title: The cats bottle.. Sentence 1: The cat walked into the kitchen. Sentence 2: An empty water bottle was on the floor by the trashcan. Sentence 3: The cat swatted it. Sentence 4: The cat liked the crunchy sound it made.
target: The cat played with the bottle.

input: Title: Hierarchy. Sentence 1: Tony was a part of a social group. Sentence 2: She was a newcomer. Sentence 3: She began to be treated differently than the rest. Sentence 4: She worked hard at becoming a better friend to the group.
target: She became the leader of the group.

input: Title: Ready. Sentence 1: Mariah and her husband had never been able to conceive. Sentence 2: They considered adoption for years, until finally they felt ready. Sentence 3: Then they applied to be adoptive parents. Sentence 4: They ended up with an Asian baby named Suki, sweet and cute.
target: They loved her right from the very first day!

input: Title: Jasmin Perseveres. Sentence 1: Jasmin got pregnant during her senior year of high school. Sentence 2: She was very worried that her life would be ruined. Sentence 3: She had her baby after graduation. Sentence 4: She was still able to go to college to pursue her education.
target: As soon as she graduated, she landed her dream job!

input: Title: The Broken Skate. Sentence 1: Veronica was about to perform in a skating competition. Sentence 2: She was warming up when suddenly her blade broke. Sentence 3: She was forced to wear a rented pair of skates for the show. Sentence 4: They didn't fit well and she did a terrible job skating due to it.
target: When she was done, she vowed to never skate without her own skates.

input: Title: Storm Arrives. Sentence 1: The storm clouds were approaching Ben's work building. Sentence 2: He ran to his car to get his umbrella for later. Sentence 3: Ben was able to get the umbrella out and ran back inside the building. Sentence 4: The storm came down as soon as he shut the door.
target: Ben used his umbrella in the rain when he left work in an hour.

input: Title: Flights to texas. Sentence 1: Flying from Las Vegas to Austin or Dallas is unusually cheap. Sentence 2: Rarely do I have to pay over $40 for a one way trip. Sentence 3: My first time doing it, I was shown how to find flights online. Sentence 4: I paid for my first flight on my cell phone in minutes!
target: I was on a plane to another state within a week for $21.

input: Title: Chef's Kitchen. Sentence 1: Patton had a dream of becoming a chef one day. Sentence 2: His goal was to work at a famous restaurant in Paris. Sentence 3: His family and friends told him he was not being realistic. Sentence 4: Patton spent many years perfecting his craft.
target: On his 30th birthday, he achieved his dream.

input: Title: Pete's Popular Pens. Sentence 1: Pete made custom pens in his garage. Sentence 2: His pens became very popular with businesses in his hometown. Sentence 3: He decided to expand his pen business. Sentence 4: Pete opened a shop and hired four employees.
target: Now Pete sells his popular pens nationwide.

input: Title: The Mountains. Sentence 1: The family took a trip. Sentence 2: They drove into the mountains to camp. Sentence 3: The scenery was just beautiful! Sentence 4: They hiked a lot and took lots of pictures.
target: What an amazing vacation it was!

input: Title: Jared's New Car. Sentence 1: Jared really likes the old Nissan hatchback cars. Sentence 2: He decided to buy one from a junkyard. Sentence 3: The car was in bad shape, but he used elbow grease to fix it up. Sentence 4: The car got a new motor and a fresh coat of paint.
target: Now it looks brand new and Jared loves it.

input: Title: The Breakup. Sentence 1: Josh and Caro were neighbors growing up and spend time together. Sentence 2: After high school Josh moved away for a few years. Sentence 3: He ran in to Caro at a party and decided to move back after a date. Sentence 4: They were together for 7 years but things fell apart.
target: Now she lives all alone and he moved away again.

input: Title: Going grey. Sentence 1: Lisa saw herself in the mirror. Sentence 2: She couldn't believe it. Sentence 3: She was going grey. Sentence 4: Lisa thought she was far too young.
target: She immediately shaved it off.

input: Title: Finally voting. Sentence 1: Elijah was happy to be eighteen. Sentence 2: He was able to vote now. Sentence 3: He picked his favorite candidate. Sentence 4: When the election was done he won.
target: Elijah couldn't have been happier.

input: Title: Washing Dishes. Sentence 1: Mary loaded the dishwasher after dinner. Sentence 2: She was unable to close the dishwasher door. Sentence 3: She looked inside and found a coffee cup that was blocking the door. Sentence 4: She removed the cup from the dishwasher.
target: She was then able to close the door easily.

input: Title: Taco Bell. Sentence 1: Denise loved to eat at Taco Bell and ate there once a week. Sentence 2: In 2015 she moved to Ohio where there was no Taco Bell in her town. Sentence 3: In 2016 she craved Taco Bell and did a search to find the nearest one. Sentence 4: She found one that was a 3 hour drive away from her home.
target: She filled her gas tank and made that 3 hour drive to Taco Bell.

input: Title: That's a Lot of Books. Sentence 1: Lynn's birthday is on February 22, so she likes the number 222. Sentence 2: She was glad when she reached 222 books in her electronic reader. Sentence 3: Someone said she can't buy any more or the number will change. Sentence 4: Lynn said she will categorize the books.
target: She can have eventually have 222 categories with 222 books in each.

input: Title: Afraid of bees. Sentence 1: Maya was an apiculturist who was afraid of bees. Sentence 2: She went through her days afraid to be stung by one of them. Sentence 3: She only found solace in eating the honey they were making. Sentence 4: Until one day she sold it all to build a new life.
target: And away from the bees, she finally knew what it meant to feel secure.

input: Title: Back Home. Sentence 1: Kenny has been overseas in the army for a year now. Sentence 2: He is currently on his flight back home for a few months. Sentence 3: He is excited to see his wife. Sentence 4: His plane lands and he gets out of the airport.
target: He sees his wife and gives her the biggest hug!

input: Title: Frustration. Sentence 1: There wasn't much work to do this morning. Sentence 2: We almost got into an argument because of it. Sentence 3: I tried to stay quiet and not start a problem. Sentence 4: I knew what would happen if I did.
target: I kept very still and quiet and it blew over.

input: Title: Runner. Sentence 1: Joey got into shape to get ready for the marathon. Sentence 2: He worked hard and jogged a couple miles every day. Sentence 3: After a few months, he was at his fittest. Sentence 4: Joey ran in the marathon.
target: He didn't win, but he was happy he finished.

input: Title: In Big Trouble. Sentence 1: Charles' daughter Brianna loves bananas. Sentence 2: So Charles brought home from work a bunch of bananas. Sentence 3: Charles went to take a bath. Sentence 4: While in the bathroom he heard his wife fall to the floor.
target: He jumped to look and saw his wife on the floor next to a banana peel.

input: Title: The Mechanic. Sentence 1: Kate's car was making a noise. Sentence 2: She took it to her mechanic. Sentence 3: The mechanic said it needed a new transmission. Sentence 4: Kate said she couldn't afford that.
target: She had to start riding her bike to work.

input: Title: Two Years. Sentence 1: Two years later, they moved to another state. Sentence 2: He greatly missed his best friend. Sentence 3: His mother bought him a communication board ipad. Sentence 4: He used an app on it to speak with his friend back home.
target: She was so happy to hear from him that she cried.

input: Title: Skateboard. Sentence 1: Reese saved up money for two months to buy a skateboard. Sentence 2: When he finally had it in his hands, he went straight to the park. Sentence 3: He showed off his board and his moves to all who would watch. Sentence 4: Unfortunately, during one of his tricks, he landed funny on the board.
target: The board snapped right in half.

input: Title: My Dog Sandy. Sentence 1: My brother and I were playing outside near our neighborhood pond. Sentence 2: All of a sudden, my yellow lab Sandy came running to us barking. Sentence 3: Sandy stood between my brother and I and a water moccasin snake! Sentence 4: All three of us retreated to safety to our house and told our father.
target: My father went and relocated the snake away from where we played.

input: Title: The Field. Sentence 1: Ava was exhausted. Sentence 2: She'd run across the soccer field five times. Sentence 3: She was training to be a better player. Sentence 4: She sat down to rest for a bit.
target: Then she got up and ran again!

input: Title: The Garbage Truck. Sentence 1: Emily watched out her window. Sentence 2: She wanted to see the garbage truck. Sentence 3: She liked watching the arm pick up the can. Sentence 4: She was excited for garbage day each week.
target: When the truck pulled up, she squealed with joy.

input: Title: The Movie. Sentence 1: Jasmine and her friends went to the theater. Sentence 2: The movie they wanted to see was sold out. Sentence 3: They settled on an older movie that got bad reviews. Sentence 4: It was terrible!
target: They walked out halfway through and went out to dinner instead.

input: Title: Forgetful. Sentence 1: Lara bought the latest iphone. Sentence 2: She planned to show her cousin the cell phone. Sentence 3: She left it in her coat jacket at home. Sentence 4: Lara had to run two blocks back home to retrieve it.
target: She was out of breath by the time she arrived at her cousin's home.

input: Title: Deciding on a movie. Sentence 1: Jill and Tom were going to go on a date to the movies. Sentence 2: Jill wanted to see something romantic. Sentence 3: Tom wanted to see something gory. Sentence 4: In the end they compromised on a comedy.
target: They both enjoyed the movie and had a good night.

input: Title: Food. Sentence 1: Harry was starving. Sentence 2: He really wanted food. Sentence 3: He went to a near restaurant. Sentence 4: He ordered his favorite chili.
target: He left really happy.

input: Title: The Date. Sentence 1: Larry wanted to ask Sally on a date. Sentence 2: He was really nervous when he saw her. Sentence 3: She smiled at him. Sentence 4: He got more confident.
target: He asked her to go on a date with him.

input: Title: Food. Sentence 1: Fred liked to cook. Sentence 2: So he was always preoccupied with food. Sentence 3: He ended up overeating. Sentence 4: And gradually, he had to eat much less.
target: Fred ended up losing his interest in food.

input: Title: Hard Work. Sentence 1: Ethan was 16 and wanted a car. Sentence 2: He got an after-school job and saved every penny. Sentence 3: Soon he could afford an old, battered used car. Sentence 4: Some of his schoolmates laughed at it, but Ethan didn't care.
target: He was proud of his achievement - and of his wheels!

input: Title: A Dirty Car. Sentence 1: George was driving his car. Sentence 2: He smelled something bad in the car. Sentence 3: He looked around the car to find the smell. Sentence 4: He found a food container from the previous week.
target: George decided he needed to clean his car.

input: Title: Dance Competition. Sentence 1: Lisa was on the school's dance team. Sentence 2: The team was going to a national competition. Sentence 3: The team needed to raise money to go to the competition. Sentence 4: Lisa and the team decided to have a car wash.
target: The girls raised enough money to go to the competition.

input: Title: Still got split ends. Sentence 1: Freddie hated how she always had damaged hair. Sentence 2: So she got some scissors to cut it off. Sentence 3: She thought she cut all the ends off. Sentence 4: But she kept getting more.
target: Freddie decided to just wear wigs instead.

input: Title: Not invited to the party. Sentence 1: Tina was having a party. Sentence 2: It was celebrating the new year. Sentence 3: Everyone was invited. Sentence 4: Except for Suzy.
target: When Suzy found out she started to cry.

input: Title: Violin Teacher. Sentence 1: Barbara had always wanted to be a violin teacher. Sentence 2: She was very good at playing the violin as well. Sentence 3: One day, she decided that she would be one for the rest of her life. Sentence 4: Barbara became very successful as a violin teacher as well.
target: Now, Barbara makes a lot of money from teaching the violin.

input: Title: End of a Truck. Sentence 1: David had an old truck. Sentence 2: It began to give him trouble. Sentence 3: David got an estimate of the repair cost. Sentence 4: It was more than David thought the truck was worth.
target: David decided to buy a new truck.

input: Title: John's Success. Sentence 1: John was a very bad student. Sentence 2: He never turned in his homework. Sentence 3: His teachers thought he'd be in prison by age 20. Sentence 4: John sought to prove them wrong.
target: By age 22, he was the CEO was a multi-million dollar company.

input: Title: The Hike. Sentence 1: Amanda loved nature and to hike in the woods. Sentence 2: One day she got lost as she went too far with her hike. Sentence 3: Then she remembered about landmarks for when you're lost. Sentence 4: She hiked up higher so she could find one she recognized.
target: Thankfully she did and made her way back home safely.

input: Title: Two Faced. Sentence 1: I found I shared a bus stop with a cute girl in high school. Sentence 2: We didn't share the same circles. Sentence 3: She was friendly. Sentence 4: I saw her later in school.
target: She ignored me.

input: Title: Finders Keepers. Sentence 1: The man ran along the beach every morning. Sentence 2: One day, he found forty dollars on the sand. Sentence 3: He looked around for the owner. Sentence 4: No one was around.
target: The man put the money in his wallet.

input: Title: Her first hurricane. Sentence 1: Roxanne moved to Hawaii to get away from the states with tornados. Sentence 2: She's now facing hurricanes headed for Hawaii. Sentence 3: She is terrified almost as much as she is of tornadoes. Sentence 4: With the help of friends she is preparing for the hurricane.
target: The first hurricane has begun to hit the island and she's prepared.

input: Title: Sneaking Out. Sentence 1: Yvette's parents forbade her from going to a concert. Sentence 2: She snuck out one night to attend a concert. Sentence 3: It was so loud that it hurt her ears. Sentence 4: The people at the concert were sleazy and packed too tightly.
target: Yvette had no problem complying with her parents thereafter.

input: Title: A Good Neighbor. Sentence 1: Jacob heard a scream from next door. Sentence 2: He ran to see what was wrong. Sentence 3: His elderly neighbor had slipped and fallen. Sentence 4: Jacob called the emergency services.
target: He waited with his neighbor until help arrived.

input: Title: Milk. Sentence 1: My wife gave our son a sippy-cup full of milk. Sentence 2: After that, she went to the bathroom. Sentence 3: When she came out of the bathroom, she saw our son. Sentence 4: He was squeezing droplets of milk onto the couch.
target: Our son no longer has a sippy-cup.

input: Title: Gun. Sentence 1: My son-in-law's aunt S moved in with his mother. Sentence 2: S was having trouble paying her rent and was evicted. Sentence 3: She is a NYC school cop. Sentence 4: My daughter just found out S has a gun.
target: She expressed concerns to her husband.

input: Title: Desperation. Sentence 1: A prisoner broke out of his cell at night. Sentence 2: He ran towards the ground keeping shed for a shovel. Sentence 3: He took a shovel to the far wall and dug. Sentence 4: The handle snapped during his dig.
target: In desperation, the man began to dig with his hands.

input: Title: Tornado Chaser. Sentence 1: Jill was almost killed by a tornado when she was a child. Sentence 2: This sparked her interest in studying weather. Sentence 3: She grew up to be a storm chaser. Sentence 4: Her and her team chased tornadoes every spring across the Midwest.
target: Her storm research lead to advancement in tornado warning systems.

input: Title: Binge Watching. Sentence 1: Tom found a new show on Netflix. Sentence 2: He got hooked from the first episode. Sentence 3: There were several seasons available. Sentence 4: Tom binge watched as much as possible the first night.
target: He finished up the next day.

input: Title: Movie Night. Sentence 1: Mark purchased two tickets for the nine o'clock show. Sentence 2: Mary saw him exit the line and headed to the concession. Sentence 3: Mark joined Mary on the concession stand line. Sentence 4: When it was their turn, they ordered refreshments.
target: Mark and Marty took their snacks into the theater.

input: Title: Lamb Stew. Sentence 1: My friend made lamb stew. Sentence 2: It smelled awful! Sentence 3: They asked me to try it. Sentence 4: I was so scared.
target: After putting it in my mouth I realized it was delicious!

input: Title: stealing woman. Sentence 1: I was going home when i decided to take a bus. Sentence 2: I was alone so a woman asked me if she could sit with me. Sentence 3: Then i let her sit beside me. Sentence 4: When i woke up the woman was gone.
target: My bag was opened so i checked my phone and it was gone too.

input: Title: One of Those. Sentence 1: It was going to be one of those days. Sentence 2: I could tell as soon as I woke up. Sentence 3: I couldn't seem to catch anything. Sentence 4: I sat in front of my computer feeling annoyed.
target: I wanted to just give up.

input: Title: Lucy's Burn. Sentence 1: Lucy worked after school at the local diner. Sentence 2: One day Lucy, burned her hand on the grill at work. Sentence 3: She was sent home for the rest of the day. Sentence 4: The burn wasn't bad and she was able to return on the next day.
target: Lucy was more careful at work.

input: Title: Crying Toddler. Sentence 1: Our 2 year old granddaughter just got into Boston. Sentence 2: She came from NJ. Sentence 3: She did not want to go to bed and started to cry. Sentence 4: The crying scared the cat.
target: She ran away until it quieted down.

input: Title: The Baths. Sentence 1: Barry recently visited The British Virgin Islands. Sentence 2: While there, Barry took a trip to a small island named Virgin Gorda. Sentence 3: Barry was amazed with the beautiful beaches, and a rock formation. Sentence 4: The rock formation was called The Baths.
target: Barry could not wait to visit Virgin Gorda again.

input: Title: The Heat. Sentence 1: It was so hot outside! Sentence 2: The weatherman warned people that the heat was dangerous. Sentence 3: People stayed in their homes and used the a/c. Sentence 4: Finally, the heat broke after several days.
target: People resumed their outdoor activities.

input: Title: Picking Strawberries. Sentence 1: One day Mia and her family went to the orchard to pick strawberries. Sentence 2: Mia found some nice plump ones first. Sentence 3: Then Kayden dropped all of his. Sentence 4: He scrambled to pick them up.
target: Everyone laughed.

input: Title: Dropping a Hammer. Sentence 1: Charles was doing some construction work. Sentence 2: He had a pretty good safety record. Sentence 3: At one point he dropped his hammer on his foot. Sentence 4: Luckily he was wearing his protective boots.
target: Charles laughed it off and picked up his hammer.

input: Title: Selling Lemonade. Sentence 1: My 2 year old granddaughter visited her cousin today. Sentence 2: Her cousin is 8. Sentence 3: His scout troop was selling lemonade. Sentence 4: He had a stand out, and she helped him.
target: She drank some lemonade as well.

input: Title: Saving the Environment. Sentence 1: Ken went to buy groceries. Sentence 2: He noticed they had cheap bags for sale. Sentence 3: He figured he would buy one instead of using disposable. Sentence 4: Ken was able to get all his groceries in it.
target: He has used it several times.

input: Title: Wedding Dress. Sentence 1: Sandy was getting married. Sentence 2: She had everything taken care of except the dress. Sentence 3: She had gone to so many places. Sentence 4: She finally decided to have someone make it.
target: Sandy had the perfect dress.

input: Title: Sample. Sentence 1: Kia was shopping at the grocery store. Sentence 2: She passed a stand where a woman was giving samples of cheese. Sentence 3: Kia ate one and enjoyed it. Sentence 4: But later, she got quite a stomach ache!
target: Kia wondered if the cheese had sat out too long.

input: Title: The Bridge. Sentence 1: The boys were walking in the woods. Sentence 2: They found a bridge going across the river. Sentence 3: They crept across the creaky bridge. Sentence 4: As soon as they crossed, the bridge broke!
target: They had no idea how they would get home.

input: Title: The Pool Tournament. Sentence 1: Andy loved to play pool. Sentence 2: He needed one hundred dollars to enter the big tournament. Sentence 3: He set up a car wash. Sentence 4: All his friends came out to help him.
target: He placed second in the pool tournament.

input: Title: Taxi Fight. Sentence 1: Tom was waving a taxi down. Sentence 2: When one stopped someone else tried to get in. Sentence 3: Tom confronted them about it. Sentence 4: They tried to take it anyway.
target: Tom had to pull them out.

input: Title: Katrina's Aviation Illness. Sentence 1: Katrina was taking another flight to a city across the country. Sentence 2: She always wanted the window seat on the airplane. Sentence 3: She often got sick from the elevation and the view calmed her down. Sentence 4: On this flight she wasn't able to sit by the window.
target: Katrina became ill and had to stay in the bathroom most of the flight.

input: Title: Dubby. Sentence 1: Dubby was an amazing friend, who took me to Harrison. Sentence 2: We watched a football game, and it was freezing cold. Sentence 3: I couldn't feel my hands, so I went to the bathroom to warm them. Sentence 4: I ran hot water on them, turning them bright red.
target: When I came out, he yelled at me for burning my hands.

input: Title: Pesto. Sentence 1: Tom was a food lover. Sentence 2: He tried all sorts of food. Sentence 3: His favorite sauce was pesto. Sentence 4: He went out to eat one night with friends.
target: He convinced everyone to try the pesto and they loved it.

input: Title: High Dive. Sentence 1: Jen climbed the ladder to the top of the platform. Sentence 2: Once at the top, she peered cautiously over the edge. Sentence 3: The height seemed much greater than it had from the ground. Sentence 4: She considered climbing back down.
target: Instead, she got up her courage and jumped into the water below.

input: Title: Building a Computer. Sentence 1: Tim wanted a new computer. Sentence 2: He heard it would be cheaper to build his own. Sentence 3: He was afraid to try it out. Sentence 4: Eventually Tim found plenty of up to date information online.
target: He built one and it was surprisingly easy.

input: Title: The perfect man. Sentence 1: Cara fell in love with Warren at first sight. Sentence 2: Warren felt it too when he met Cara. Sentence 3: In fact they were both very excited by the prospect of dating. Sentence 4: But when Warren drew a cigarette out his his pocket, she froze.
target: And Cara's dream man disappeared in a puff of smoke.

input: Title: Unemployment blues. Sentence 1: Andy recently was a bartender for a popular night club. Sentence 2: However, since the club was not doing so well, Andy was laid off. Sentence 3: Andy decided to immediately look for another job in the area. Sentence 4: However, after about a month, Andy was still unemployed.
target: Andy was feeling the unemployment blues pretty bad.

input: Title: Dehydration. Sentence 1: Our daughter told us last Sunday she did not feel well. Sentence 2: She felt stomach cramps. Sentence 3: She is pregnant, so she went to the er. Sentence 4: They said the baby was fine and she was just dehydrated.
target: She got an IV and felt much better.

input: Title: Jazz Story. Sentence 1: Martin invited Jessica to the jazz concert. Sentence 2: She tried to listen carefully. Sentence 3: After the concert she told Martin, she did not like it. Sentence 4: He asked her who is her favorite artist.
target: She said Kenny G.

input: Title: Swimming. Sentence 1: There was an old swimming hole by the Peterson's farm. Sentence 2: Toby went over to take a dip. Sentence 3: He jumped in and yelled cannonball. Sentence 4: He had a wonderful time.
target: Toby left and went back home, reveling in the swimming fun he had had.

input: Title: The toy. Sentence 1: The boy's favorite toy was missing. Sentence 2: He looked all over the house. Sentence 3: He looked under the furniture. Sentence 4: He finally went into the basement.
target: The ball was in the basement.

input: Title: Car. Sentence 1: Kia went to the car dealership with her parents. Sentence 2: They wanted to teach her about credit. Sentence 3: So they helped Kia sign up for a car lease. Sentence 4: Then they helped her pick a brand new car!
target: Kia was happy with her car - and her lesson in responsibility.

input: Title: Chicken. Sentence 1: John wanted to eat chicken. Sentence 2: He decided to go ahead and buy a large chicken. Sentence 3: He also bought sides. Sentence 4: He cooked the chicken in the oven.
target: It turned out perfect.

input: Title: Beating the Rain Home. Sentence 1: Doug wanted to go for a walk but it looked like it was going to rain. Sentence 2: He decided that he could beat the rain so he started walking. Sentence 3: Halfway through his walk it began pouring rain. Sentence 4: Doug was lucky to find some shelter to wait out the rain.
target: Once the rain stopped, Doug walked home.

input: Title: Giving Up. Sentence 1: Tom always dreamed of being a professional wrestler. Sentence 2: He practiced every chance he got. Sentence 3: Unfortunately he got his girlfriend pregnant in high-school. Sentence 4: Tom was forced to get a job to support them.
target: He kept watching professional wrestling on television.

input: Title: Basketball Foul. Sentence 1: Gary had the ball. Sentence 2: Billy wanted the basketball. Sentence 3: Billy reached for it. Sentence 4: He accidentally slapped Gary.
target: Billy got ejected.

input: Title: Glasses. Sentence 1: Cher has been having issues with her vision. Sentence 2: She is 43 and has never had eye issues before. Sentence 3: She made an appointment with an eye doctor. Sentence 4: At the doctor's office she underwent an exam.
target: She was told she needed glasses and was able to order them then.

input: Title: Silence.. Sentence 1: Sometimes when I'm alone I prefer sitting in silence. Sentence 2: My friends don't understand it so I tried to show them. Sentence 3: We got together one day and I proposed a few minutes of silence. Sentence 4: They were hesitant to accept but finally did.
target: After the silence was over they completely understood why I like it.

input: Title: Bad Posture. Sentence 1: Tom always had bad posture. Sentence 2: He felt it made others judge him. Sentence 3: He tried to fix it in several ones. Sentence 4: He tried following an online tutorial.
target: He wound up just hurting his back.

input: Title: New Puppy. Sentence 1: Emma really wanted a dog. Sentence 2: She looked at pictures of dogs every day. Sentence 3: Finally, her parents agreed to get a dog. Sentence 4: She went to the shelter and picked out a brown, fuzzy puppy.
target: Emma and her new puppy were very happy together.

input: Title: homework. Sentence 1: John did not do his homework in many of his classes. Sentence 2: He failed his classes in the following report card. Sentence 3: His parents punished him. Sentence 4: He went to therapy.
target: John became more motivated and passed his classes.

input: Title: Capture the Flag. Sentence 1: One day the Schier family played Capture the Flag. Sentence 2: They divided into two teams. Sentence 3: The game lasted two hours. Sentence 4: The winning team got taken out for dinner by the losing team.
target: Everyone had a fun day.

input: Title: Beach Trip. Sentence 1: Sam had never been to the beach. Sentence 2: He was dying of cancer. Sentence 3: He wanted to go before he died. Sentence 4: His friends wanted to take him.
target: Unfortunately they couldn't afford it.

input: Title: New apartment. Sentence 1: Tina needed a new apartment. Sentence 2: So the realtor showed her some. Sentence 3: Tina was not impressed by them. Sentence 4: Finally she saw a good one.
target: She was happy to finally see one.

input: Title: House Fire. Sentence 1: Tom was on vacation. Sentence 2: He got home to find it on fire. Sentence 3: Everything burned down. Sentence 4: Luckily Tom had good insurance.
target: He was able to get a lot of money back.

input: Title: Fishing. Sentence 1: Tony loved to fish. Sentence 2: Everyday after school he would go down to the river. Sentence 3: He would get some bait and put his line in the water. Sentence 4: It didn't really matter if he caught anything.
target: Tony just loved to fish.

input: Title: Handicapped. Sentence 1: While walking to the car that was parked away my nephew had a question. Sentence 2: He wanted to know why we couldn't park in handicapped. Sentence 3: He said, but we could pretend to be handicapped. Sentence 4: I said, I think I look too young for anyone to think that.
target: He said, well you can just tell everyone you got lots of work done.

input: Title: Wrong House. Sentence 1: Tom was a nerd in high school. Sentence 2: He was invited to his first party. Sentence 3: Tom was really excited about it. Sentence 4: When he showed up it was an empty house with grumpy old people.
target: Tom had been invited to the wrong place as a joke.

input: Title: Brave Ben. Sentence 1: Ben is a 10 year old boy. Sentence 2: He is told he needs his tonsils removed. Sentence 3: Ben is scared of surgery. Sentence 4: Ben becomes brave and is ready for surgery.
target: The surgery goes well and Ben's tonsils are removed.

input: Title: Sunburn. Sentence 1: My son went to Hull last weekend. Sentence 2: My wife told him to wear sunscreen. Sentence 3: He was there for hours and got a sunburn. Sentence 4: She wanted to know why he did apply sunscreen.
target: He said he did, but it did not work.

input: Title: Belly piercing. Sentence 1: Suzy wanted her belly pierced. Sentence 2: All her friends were getting it done. Sentence 3: So it was only natural she would be next. Sentence 4: But when she got it done it hurt.
target: It was the most hurtful she ever experienced.

input: Title: Inflating the Claim. Sentence 1: I worked in a warehouse in 1975. Sentence 2: The building had a flood one day. Sentence 3: Only one section of the warehouse was affected. Sentence 4: The owner put a lot of stock into that section to inflate his claim.
target: He got twice of what he should have gotten.

input: Title: Wearing contacts for the first time. Sentence 1: Tina found out she needed contacts. Sentence 2: She went to get her prescription. Sentence 3: Then she tried them on. Sentence 4: Instantly she felt sick.
target: Her eyes were in a lot of pain so she learnt her lesson.

input: Title: Joy. Sentence 1: Tim was a deep thinker. Sentence 2: He thought about what is most important in life. Sentence 3: He determined that joy was most important. Sentence 4: He decided to build his life around joy.
target: He lived a joyous life and was very happy.

input: Title: Caught. Sentence 1: Tim was a police officer. Sentence 2: He took his wife for a walk on his night off. Sentence 3: A man approached them and demanded Tim's wallet! Sentence 4: But Tim pulled his gun and apprehended the man.
target: He was thankful for his police training!

input: Title: Money. Sentence 1: Frank needed money to buy clothes. Sentence 2: So Frank opened up his laptop. Sentence 3: He went on the website Mturk. Sentence 4: He signed into Mturk and began to do hits.
target: Frank earned enough money to buy new clothes.

input: Title: Prom Dress. Sentence 1: Jill couldn't afford to buy a dress for the prom. Sentence 2: She was a good seamstress so she made one. Sentence 3: She was afraid the other girls would make fun of her. Sentence 4: But her dress was a huge hit!
target: She actually got orders to make some for the following year.

input: Title: Gulliver. Sentence 1: She sat in the creative writing class, only half paying attention. Sentence 2: The teacher called on her, and asked who the main character was. Sentence 3: She flustered, and said something silly. Sentence 4: "I don't remember his name, but it was in Gulliver's Travels."
target: From then on, she was called Gulliver by the teacher.

input: Title: Lunch. Sentence 1: Kia was a little drunk one evening when she got home. Sentence 2: She made her lunch for work and fell into bed. Sentence 3: When she awoke, she was pleased to see her lunchbox by the door. Sentence 4: But at lunch time, she found that she hadn't put any food in it.
target: Kia had just packed herself a plate and a fork!

input: Title: Waking up the Baby. Sentence 1: Eve had just put her son to sleep. Sentence 2: It had taken all night for him to fall asleep. Sentence 3: Eve's husband came home and slammed the door. Sentence 4: The slamming door woke up the baby.
target: Eve was furious at her husband.

input: Title: Fast Mr Peters.. Sentence 1: Mr Peters was speeding in his car to get home fast. Sentence 2: A cop saw Mr Peters and tried to pull him over. Sentence 3: Mr Peters sped up to outrun the cop. Sentence 4: He lost the cop in the chase.
target: Mr Peters got home five minutes early!

input: Title: Lottery Ticket. Sentence 1: Jane never bought a lottery ticket, but today she felt lucky. Sentence 2: She stopped at the corner store and got a scratch off ticket. Sentence 3: She got in her car and used a quarter in the console to scratch it. Sentence 4: She matched the numbers correctly and was amazed she had won.
target: She went back in the store to claim her $1000 prize.

input: Title: Craig's Interview. Sentence 1: Craig woke up ready for his interview. Sentence 2: He put on his best tie and drove to the office. Sentence 3: His interviewer seemed charmed by Craig's answers. Sentence 4: Before he left the office, Craig shook the interviewer's hand.
target: He fully expects to hear back from them by next week.

input: Title: The Decorations. Sentence 1: Grace stored all her Christmas decorations in the attic. Sentence 2: She went to get the decorations from the attic. Sentence 3: Grace was on a ladder carrying the box of decorations down. Sentence 4: Grace dropped the box and broke most to the decorations.
target: Grace had to buy new decorations.

input: Title: Log In. Sentence 1: Todd got an error message while trying to log into his account. Sentence 2: He tried over and over, and finally called Customer Service, furious. Sentence 3: He was about to start yelling when the agent asked what email he had. Sentence 4: He told her, and she immediately pointed out that was the wrong email.
target: He sheepishly entered the correct email, which worked perfectly.

input: Title: Angry Woman. Sentence 1: I walked into a Costco. Sentence 2: And a woman behind me tried to walk in without a Costco card. Sentence 3: An employee at the door tried to stop her. Sentence 4: But the woman yelled and cursed at her and continued to walk in.
target: I left the store quickly as the event was frightening.

input: Title: The FLowers. Sentence 1: Penny picked out a vase. Sentence 2: She had a big bouquet of flowers to put in it. Sentence 3: She set them on the kitchen counter. Sentence 4: It was wonderful to have fresh flowers in her home!
target: Penny stopped to sniff them as she walked by.

input: Title: Showering with a Frog. Sentence 1: Jessica turned on the water and got in the shower. Sentence 2: Out of the corner of her eye, she noticed a bright green frog. Sentence 3: At first she thought it was a puffy sticker until it moved. Sentence 4: Jessica thought it must have hitched a ride inside on one of the dogs.
target: She grabbed a towel and a cup and carefully relocated it back outside.

input: Title: The Stolen Shirt. Sentence 1: Michelle was at her friend's house. Sentence 2: While her friend went to the bathroom she peeked in the closet. Sentence 3: She noticed a pretty top that she badly wanted. Sentence 4: She decided to stuff the shirt into her bag.
target: Later, Michelle's friend asked about the shirt and Michelle lied.

input: Title: Small Gloves. Sentence 1: Sam got a gift from his girlfriend. Sentence 2: They were a pair of gloves. Sentence 3: Sam tried them on. Sentence 4: Unfortunately they were too small.
target: Sam's girlfriend replaced them with the right size.

input: Title: Fast Runner. Sentence 1: Andy loved watching the Olympic track events. Sentence 2: Andy was excited to see Usain Bolt defend his track title. Sentence 3: As the race was beginning, Andy was anxious to see Bolt race. Sentence 4: However, when the gun sounded, Andy knew Bolt would win.
target: Andy was so excited that Usain Bolt won his track race.

input: Title: Find your Niche. Sentence 1: Maryann was made fun of in school for her looks. Sentence 2: She was tall, thin, and multiracial. Sentence 3: After she graduated high school, she moved to California. Sentence 4: She was signed to a modeling agency.
target: Now those same kids from school try to be her friend online.

input: Title: hidden gem. Sentence 1: John was walking on the way to work. Sentence 2: John saw a food cart. Sentence 3: John tried out a rice dish. Sentence 4: John was surprised of the rich flavor.
target: John would go to the food cart daily for his lunch.

input: Title: Food For The Year. Sentence 1: Last Christmas, Charles had a financial setback. Sentence 2: He lost his job and had only enough money for his rent. Sentence 3: He couldn't by food. Sentence 4: He asked his father for money and then cursed him when he said no.
target: So his father bought him a small oven and gave him a bag of steaks.

input: Title: Slumber Party. Sentence 1: Charlotte wanted a big party for her birthday. Sentence 2: She wanted pizza for dinner and her friends to come over. Sentence 3: She was so excited for all of the fun. Sentence 4: When the kids arrived she couldn't contain her excitement.
target: At the end of the night, she told her mom it was the best party ever.

input: Title: Beth and her doll. Sentence 1: Beth had a large collection of dolls in her bedroom. Sentence 2: Beth had a favorite doll she called Kim. Sentence 3: One day while Beth was at school her pet dog Skippy found Kim. Sentence 4: Skippy chewed off one of Kim's arms.
target: Beth was devastated after finding her chewed up doll.

input: Title: The Watch. Sentence 1: Jenny was always running late. Sentence 2: Her husband bought her a watch to keep her on time. Sentence 3: It worked great! Sentence 4: Soon, Jenny was on time for every appointment.
target: The watch made a huge difference in her life.

input: Title: Noises. Sentence 1: Loud noises were driving me crazy. Sentence 2: He was smacking while he ate. Sentence 3: It disgusted and angered me. Sentence 4: I wanted to scream at him to shut up.
target: I stayed quiet so I wouldn't cause an argument.

input: Title: Sinking. Sentence 1: Jen didn't notice the sink's plug was down. Sentence 2: She was startled to see water collect when she washed her hands. Sentence 3: Jen tried to mop the water up with some toilet paper. Sentence 4: She only made things worse, creating a bigger mess.
target: Jen sheepishly asked her hosts for a hand towel.

input: Title: Sky's The Limit. Sentence 1: Brittany loves to look at the stars. Sentence 2: Her favorite time to do it is very late at night. Sentence 3: She drives into the country with her telescope. Sentence 4: When she finds the perfect spot she parks and crawls on the roof.
target: Then she adjusts the telescope and gazes at the sky for a few hours.

input: Title: Second Hand. Sentence 1: Lacy had said she would stop smoking. Sentence 2: She went to a bar and everyone was lighting up. Sentence 3: The smoke made her start coughing. Sentence 4: Lacy realized just how invasive second hand smoke was.
target: She started a petition online to ban smoking from bars.

input: Title: My Boyfriend. Sentence 1: My boyfriend's name is Mark. Sentence 2: He's a doctor and I don't know what he sees in me. Sentence 3: Sometimes I feel like the luckiest girl in the world. Sentence 4: He always treats me like a princess.
target: I feel like I am worthless because what do I bring to the table?

input: Title: Whistle. Sentence 1: Tom was shopping at the mall. Sentence 2: He wanted to buy a gift for his sister. Sentence 3: He shopped around many stores. Sentence 4: Eventually he found a whistle.
target: He bought it and his sister liked the gift.

input: Title: Dirty Cookie. Sentence 1: Tom got a cookie as a treat. Sentence 2: Before he could eat it the cookie slipped out of his hand. Sentence 3: It landed on the floor. Sentence 4: Tom picked it up and brushed it off.
target: He ate it anyway and it was delicious.

input: Title: Favorite Shirt. Sentence 1: Sam had a favorite shirt. Sentence 2: He wore it all the time. Sentence 3: One day he got a hole in it. Sentence 4: Sam went online and found the same one.
target: He bought three more pairs.

input: Title: Dirty Windshield. Sentence 1: Tom was driving around. Sentence 2: He could barely see anything. Sentence 3: His windshield was too dirty. Sentence 4: Using his wipers just made it worse.
target: Tom had to pull over to clean it.

input: Title: The Bathroom. Sentence 1: Chelsea was camping. Sentence 2: There was a bathroom at the campground. Sentence 3: Chelsea was happy to have a nice place to use the restroom. Sentence 4: She went in and was horrified.
target: There were bugs everywhere!

input: Title: Kittens. Sentence 1: I was driving down the road on a very rainy day. Sentence 2: Before my eyes, I saw two kittens near the road. Sentence 3: I jumped out of the car and grabbed them. Sentence 4: I took them home, and started taking great care of them.
target: Two years later, they are healthy, happy cats that I love dearly.

input: Title: New Gun. Sentence 1: The man went to the shooting range. Sentence 2: He fired a new gun. Sentence 3: He was off the target. Sentence 4: He adjusted the sights.
target: The gun fired right on target after that.

input: Title: Thirst. Sentence 1: John was very thirsty. Sentence 2: He asked his friend to buy him drinks. Sentence 3: He paid his friend five dollars to go to the store. Sentence 4: His friend got the drinks for John.
target: John quenched his thirst.

input: Title: Grubbs. Sentence 1: Grubbs Gravy was a strat caller for his FPS team. Sentence 2: He challenged the reigning champions at a match of 6vs6. Sentence 3: Grubbs employed never before seen strategies to confuse his enemies. Sentence 4: So good were his strats that he landed a contract with a pro team.
target: Now Grubbs battles for cash on the daily.

input: Title: Bus Stop. Sentence 1: Jack was waiting for the bus. Sentence 2: The bus stop didn't have a lot of covered area. Sentence 3: It began to rain. Sentence 4: Jack had an umbrella.
target: He stepped out of the covered area so the others would stay dry.

input: Title: Son of a Beach. Sentence 1: Nina was almost nine months pregnant. Sentence 2: She was enjoying a nice sunny day at beach. Sentence 3: She started feeling a terrible pain. Sentence 4: Luckily a doctor was there because she went into labor in the sand.
target: She named her newborn baby girl Cici after her birthplace.

input: Title: Girl Friend. Sentence 1: Timmy just started kindergarten. Sentence 2: He's nervous about meeting new people and making friends. Sentence 3: Wednesday he met a girl named Jessie who asked to be his friend. Sentence 4: Timmy had never made friends with a girl before but he agreed.
target: Twelve years later, Timmy and Jesse finish school as best of friends.

input: Title: Michael breaks down. Sentence 1: Michael was driving to a concert. Sentence 2: His car begin to make a loud noise. Sentence 3: He decides to pull over and see what's wrong. Sentence 4: He pops the hood and smoke flies in his face.
target: He knows the engine is shot and calls for help.

input: Title: Role. Sentence 1: I didn't know what role I should play. Sentence 2: The situation wasn't very clear. Sentence 3: He asked me what I wanted to do. Sentence 4: I told him I wanted to just end the relationship.
target: He agreed and we went our separate ways.

input: Title: Scary costume. Sentence 1: It was Halloween night and Susie was handing out candy. Sentence 2: Instantly the doorbell rang. Sentence 3: When Susie answered the door, she was shocked. Sentence 4: She had never seen something more scary.
target: The monster at the door was horrifying.

input: Title: Lost Voice. Sentence 1: Tina had an important meeting. Sentence 2: She went to a concert the night before. Sentence 3: Tina yelled at the stage a lot. Sentence 4: She wound up losing her voice after a while.
target: She had to get someone else to talk during her meeting.

input: Title: Hockey. Sentence 1: The hockey game was tied up. Sentence 2: The blue team had the puck. Sentence 3: They sprinted down the ice. Sentence 4: They cracked a shot on goal!
target: They scored it!

input: Title: My Brother's New Friends. Sentence 1: My autistic brother has a hard time communicating with people. Sentence 2: Our mom bought him a video game where he can voice chat his opponents. Sentence 3: He made friends by chatting while playing the game. Sentence 4: He now has gained more confidence because he has new friends.
target: Because of his new confidence, my brother smiles more often now.

input: Title: The Roadside. Sentence 1: Dan and his family were very poor. Sentence 2: He would often skip school to pick peaches with his dad. Sentence 3: Dan would stand by the road and sell them to motorists. Sentence 4: One day a man took pity on him and paid $1000 for a single peach.
target: Dan was so happy and his family was able to live a little better.

input: Title: Hairy spiders.. Sentence 1: Ellie was always afraid of spiders. Sentence 2: Ever since she was a little girl they scared her. Sentence 3: Her brother had a pet tarantula, and was leaving for summer camp. Sentence 4: Ellie's parents wanted her to take care of it.
target: So she did, and found it wasn't all that bad even cute.

input: Title: Black sheep. Sentence 1: Alicia was the black sheep of her family. Sentence 2: Her family was very religious and strict. Sentence 3: One day, Alicia decided to loosen her family up. Sentence 4: So, she threw them a very fun and silly 80's party.
target: After the party, she became much closer to her family and they relaxed.

input: Title: Hank's Habit.. Sentence 1: Hank liked to watch college football. Sentence 2: Hank started to bet money on college football games. Sentence 3: Hank's teams usually lost their games. Sentence 4: Hank ended up losing a lot of money from gambling.
target: Hank decided to stop gambling before he lost everything.

input: Title: Getting Lost. Sentence 1: My Dad was attending a school for the blind in Cleveland. Sentence 2: My sister went to visit him. Sentence 3: She took him out to eat to a place they'd never been. Sentence 4: Driving back, she became lost.
target: My Dad gave her directions and they made it back to the school!

input: Title: The Camp Trip. Sentence 1: Jill planned a camping trip with her friends. Sentence 2: They arrived at the campsite at noon. Sentence 3: Jill helped her friends set up their tents. Sentence 4: They went for a hike and looked around.
target: In the evening, they returned to build a campfire.

input: Title: Old Shoes. Sentence 1: Tom had an old pair of shoes. Sentence 2: He needed to get rid of them. Sentence 3: One day it was raining and he stepped in a puddle. Sentence 4: Tom's old shoes began to fell apart.
target: He finally decided to throw them away.

input: Title: Mary meets Skip. Sentence 1: Mary was going to the county fair. Sentence 2: Mary saw a very cute young man Named Skip. Sentence 3: They both made contact with one another. Sentence 4: Mary went over and introduced herself to skip.
target: Skip and Mary became a couple and long remember that night.

input: Title: New haircut. Sentence 1: Allie needed to change it up a bit. Sentence 2: So she decided to get a new haircut. Sentence 3: She was curious as to how it would look. Sentence 4: But when she got it done she loved it.
target: She couldn't have liked it better.

input: Title: Chastity. Sentence 1: Chastity fell off the monkey bars at school. Sentence 2: She broke her leg when she hit the ground. Sentence 3: She missed a week of school. Sentence 4: When she came back, we all signed her cast.
target: We hung out with her at lunch to make her feel better.

input: Title: Earl gets in trouble. Sentence 1: Earl has lost his job. Sentence 2: He starts to sell movies illegally. Sentence 3: One day he sold a movie to a man. Sentence 4: The man turned out to be a police officer.
target: Earl is arrested and taken to jail.

input: Title: The Bike. Sentence 1: Alex needed a new bike. Sentence 2: He went to the store and test drove each one. Sentence 3: He decided on a mountain bike. Sentence 4: It had big wheels.
target: He rode it home and showed it to all his friends.

input: Title: Rude grocery encounter. Sentence 1: Allie went to the grocery store to get some food. Sentence 2: When she was going to check out she was surprised. Sentence 3: The lady was very rude to her and made fun of her. Sentence 4: Allie was offended.
target: So she called the manager over and the woman was fired.

input: Title: Turkey Time. Sentence 1: Valerie invited her family over for Thanksgiving dinner. Sentence 2: She put a turkey in the oven. Sentence 3: After the timer went off Valerie took the turkey out. Sentence 4: The turkey was golden brown and beautiful.
target: Valerie's uncle carved the turkey for everyone to eat.

input: Title: Something Gross. Sentence 1: Sheila was trying to give her child a bath. Sentence 2: She noticed something weird floating in the water. Sentence 3: Then she realized it was a big piece of feces. Sentence 4: She needed to clean out the entire tub.
target: Once it had been scrubbed she could finally bathe the baby.

input: Title: The day I bought my car. Sentence 1: I had been saving up for a car for two years. Sentence 2: My parents said they would match whatever I saved up. Sentence 3: The day finally came when I had enough for the car I wanted. Sentence 4: After some negotiation, I bought the car at a reasonable price.
target: I now have experience purchasing cars and will take good care of mine.

input: Title: The Seaweed. Sentence 1: The kids were playing in the ocean. Sentence 2: They pulled some seaweed out and threw it at each other. Sentence 3: It made a big SPLAT when it hit them. Sentence 4: They laughed and threw some more.
target: They had a lot of fun playing in the water!

input: Title: Football. Sentence 1: I worked last night. Sentence 2: I wanted to watch the game at 7. Sentence 3: An employee did not come in to relieve me. Sentence 4: I listened to most of the game on the radio.
target: I watched the last few minutes of the game at home.

input: Title: Snow day. Sentence 1: There was an ninety percent chance of snow Tuesday night. Sentence 2: Eric didn't bother to study for his history test. Sentence 3: When he woke up the next morning he hoped the forecast had been right. Sentence 4: He looked outside where everything was covered in snow.
target: He decided to play for awhile but knew he had to study that night.
