input: Title: Mountain climbing.. Sentence 1: Nolan had always wanted to try rock climbing. Sentence 2: He had hired an instructor to teach him the correct way. Sentence 3: Soon Nolan felt comfortable to head to the mountains. Sentence 4: He checked all of his gear and started the climb.
target: Nolan reached the peak and felt very accomplished.

input: Title: Hepatitis Success. Sentence 1: Pharmasset was a biotechnology company in New Jersey. Sentence 2: The company was working on drugs to treat viral infections. Sentence 3: One of their drugs had great promise to cure patients of hepatitis B. Sentence 4: A larger company, Gilead, bought Pharmasset for that drug.
target: Now Gilead sells billions of dollars of the drug every quarter.

input: Title: Sasha wets the bed. Sentence 1: Sasha was sleeping one night. Sentence 2: She woke up and the bed was wet everywhere. Sentence 3: She turned the light on to see what it was. Sentence 4: Sasha learns she peed the bed.
target: Sasha is embarrassed at herself and washes her sheets.

input: Title: Gold digger. Sentence 1: Ginger doesn't like to work. Sentence 2: She has set a goal of becoming a gold digger. Sentence 3: So she signed up for a gold diggers dating site. Sentence 4: She met someone and they actually had a connection.
target: Now she gets to be a gold digger with a connection to him as well.

input: Title: First Day of School. Sentence 1: John was starting fifth grade at a new school. Sentence 2: He was nervous because he did not know anyone. Sentence 3: His mother told him to smile and be friendly. Sentence 4: When he walked into class he did as his mother said.
target: Many kids smiled back at him and John knew he would have a good day.

input: Title: Sprained Ankle. Sentence 1: Tom was walking in his apartment. Sentence 2: He tripped over the carpet and fell. Sentence 3: He realized that he had sprained his ankle. Sentence 4: Tom decided to wrap it up and lay off it for a while.
target: It eventually got better on its own.

input: Title: NYC. Sentence 1: This was my first time living in the city. Sentence 2: The first night I discovered a problem: the noise. Sentence 3: It never stops and someone is always out. Sentence 4: To deal with this problem, I bought headphones.
target: They actually work so I was able to sleep in NYC.

input: Title: Summer Ice Skate. Sentence 1: Fred wanted to ice skate but it was August. Sentence 2: He got two block of ice from his freezer. Sentence 3: He attached the ice to the bottoms of his shoes. Sentence 4: Fred tried to skate around his hardwood floors.
target: The ice was to slippery and Fred fell on his face.

input: Title: Gas. Sentence 1: Jo's mom called her one morning, very early. Sentence 2: Sheepishly she asked for Jo's help. Sentence 3: She had run out of gas on her way to work! Sentence 4: Jo laughed it off and hurried to get her gas can.
target: Then she went to bring her mom a few gallons of gas.

input: Title: Kicker. Sentence 1: The team had to score 3 points. Sentence 2: The kicker came out to practice. Sentence 3: He took his practice kicks. Sentence 4: He kicked the ball.
target: He scored the points!

input: Title: Wordless. Sentence 1: Brain worked at a bar and had good social skills. Sentence 2: But when Miranda came into the bar he couldn't speak. Sentence 3: His crush for her had crippled him all his life. Sentence 4: So when Miranda asked him for a beer, he gave it to her.
target: But no word came out of his mouth.

input: Title: Chewing Gum. Sentence 1: Joe bought a huge pack of gum. Sentence 2: He shoved it all in his mouth and chewed it. Sentence 3: Cierra told him a hilarious joke. Sentence 4: The gum fell out of his mouth and onto the shag carpet.
target: It made a huge mess and ruined the carpet.

input: Title: Icy Roads. Sentence 1: Faith decided to drive to her family home in Montana for Christmas. Sentence 2: She should've checked the weather reports for her route. Sentence 3: She ran into a winter storm 50 miles from home. Sentence 4: The storm made the roads icy and worried Faith.
target: She decided to pull into a hotel for the night and let the storm pass.

input: Title: The Old Laptop. Sentence 1: Stacy was using her laptop to do some work. Sentence 2: Suddenly she knocked over a bottle of water onto the computer. Sentence 3: It broke and nothing she did could fix it. Sentence 4: She remembered her old clunky laptop and tried it out.
target: It actually ended up working fairly well.

input: Title: The Dead Rat. Sentence 1: Sandy had a rat in her attic. Sentence 2: She put out poison to kill the rat. Sentence 3: The rat died. Sentence 4: Sandy had an awful smell in her house for days.
target: She finally got someone to go up in the attic and take down the rat.

input: Title: The Pie Contest. Sentence 1: The kids were having a pie eating contest. Sentence 2: The girl decided she was going to win no matter what. Sentence 3: When it was time to compete, she slammed her face into the pie. Sentence 4: She gobbled up as much as she could.
target: She won by a landslide!

input: Title: Sparky's Dad Plays a Joke. Sentence 1: One Saturday Sparky and his Dad were driving past Sparky's school. Sentence 2: Sparky's Dad drove into the school parking lot. Sentence 3: Sparky's Dad told him to get out and go to school. Sentence 4: Sparky thought it was a joke but got out of the car anyway.
target: Sparky and his Dad had a good laugh.

input: Title: What Would You do Without Her. Sentence 1: Bob couldn't find his shoes in the morning. Sentence 2: He called his wife for help. Sentence 3: His wife gave him so good advice. Sentence 4: Bob found his shoes where his wife said.
target: Bob let his wife know how important she was to him.

input: Title: Too Drunk. Sentence 1: Jim was at the bar. Sentence 2: He wanted to hit on a girl. Sentence 3: He decided to drink more to build up courage. Sentence 4: Jim wound up drinking too much.
target: He made a fool of himself around her.

input: Title: Prescription Pain Pills. Sentence 1: Sam had a kidney infection. Sentence 2: He got pain pills for it. Sentence 3: Once he stopped taking them the pain came back. Sentence 4: They gave him more pills for it.
target: Eventually Sam realized he was going through withdrawals.

input: Title: Aim. Sentence 1: The man aimed down the sites. Sentence 2: He located his target. Sentence 3: He adjusted his aim for wind. Sentence 4: He fired the shot.
target: He hit his target.

input: Title: Special deal. Sentence 1: Benny scanned his items at the self check-out. Sentence 2: A notification appeared on the screen. Sentence 3: It notified him of a special deal on juice. Sentence 4: He ran to the juice aisle and bought more juice.
target: He received a 70% discount on two of them.

input: Title: The Old Macaroni. Sentence 1: Jordie was shopping for groceries one day. Sentence 2: Suddenly she saw a box of pasta on the shelf. Sentence 3: It was an old brand of macaroni she had loved as a kid. Sentence 4: She hadn't seen it in ages and immediately bought a few boxes.
target: At home she cooked it up, enjoying the nostalgic flavor.

input: Title: Do As You Like. Sentence 1: The work day started out the same as always for Stan. Sentence 2: He made some coffee and dragged himself to his desk. Sentence 3: No sooner had he sat down than an attractive coworker came to him. Sentence 4: She had concert tickets and wanted to know if he wanted to come.
target: Stan declined because he was averse to having any kind of fun at all.

input: Title: New Haircut. Sentence 1: Tom was feeling down. Sentence 2: He decided to get a new haircut. Sentence 3: He tried a different style. Sentence 4: It turned out looking great.
target: Tom was slightly cheered up.

input: Title: Too small for playing piano. Sentence 1: Madeleine's parents bought her a piano for Christmas. Sentence 2: But she was very small and couldn't reach the pedals. Sentence 3: She attached an extension to her foot to make it longer. Sentence 4: And thanks to her ingenuity, she could reach the pedal.
target: Now, she's still small, but can play the piano like a grownup.

input: Title: Pen Pals. Sentence 1: As a child in grade school, Nia had a pen pal from England. Sentence 2: She remembered the experience very fondly. Sentence 3: As an adult, she wanted the same experience. Sentence 4: Seeing that no such services really existed, Nia had an idea.
target: She started her own web site for adult, just-friends pen pals!

input: Title: Bike. Sentence 1: Tom was a 13 year old boy who loved riding his old bike. Sentence 2: His mother bought him a new bike for Christmas. Sentence 3: Tom rode it everywhere. Sentence 4: Two weeks after Christmas someone stole his bike.
target: Tom was very sad to have his new bike stolen.

input: Title: Bye, Dad. Sentence 1: Vinnie and his dad used to collect bottle caps. Sentence 2: When Vinnie was in seventh grade, his dad died of a heart attack. Sentence 3: Vinnie carried on collecting bottle caps, keeping them in a shoe box. Sentence 4: When his mom remarried, she put away all his dad's pictures.
target: He came home from school to find she'd thrown out his bottle caps.

input: Title: The Ponytail. Sentence 1: Tom had long hair. Sentence 2: He put it up on a pony tail often. Sentence 3: His friends hated how it looked. Sentence 4: They decided to cut it while he slept one night.
target: The next day Tom was absolutely devastated.

input: Title: Dress Pattern Dilemma. Sentence 1: Robin needed a new dress for the Civil War themed dance. Sentence 2: She bought a pattern from the costume store and sewed the dress. Sentence 3: She went to the dance and the emcee told her that the dress was wrong! Sentence 4: Robin was angry and went to the store to return the pattern.
target: The store gave her a full refund.

input: Title: My Waist. Sentence 1: I wanted to lose a lot of weight. Sentence 2: I wanted to be proud of my waist. Sentence 3: I wanted to show off a six pack stomach. Sentence 4: After doing one sit up, I gave up.
target: I decided I was fine the way I was.

input: Title: Eating Pasta. Sentence 1: I was eating pasta with a spoon. Sentence 2: My friends thought it was hilarious. Sentence 3: I did not know why. Sentence 4: They finally showed me how to eat it with a fork.
target: I was so happy that I learned how to eat pasta.

input: Title: The Train Delay. Sentence 1: Marty was taking the train to work one day. Sentence 2: Suddenly the train stopped. Sentence 3: Someone announced that there was a technical problem. Sentence 4: The train would be delayed for thirty minutes.
target: Marty anxiously arrived at work super late.

input: Title: Shower. Sentence 1: Carlos shower was clogged up. Sentence 2: So Carlos went to the store to get Drano. Sentence 3: He poured the Drano in his showers drain. Sentence 4: After several minutes his shower was clogged.
target: Carlos shower was no longer clogged up.

input: Title: Darkness. Sentence 1: Elena is afraid of the dark. Sentence 2: She sleeps with her night light on. Sentence 3: Her parents insisted there is no need to be afraid. Sentence 4: Elena older brother taught her how to overcome her fear.
target: She learned to count backwards really fast to fight her fear.

input: Title: Holding Hands. Sentence 1: Ethan and Jill went to the movies. Sentence 2: They started to get a little close. Sentence 3: Ethan reached to grab Jill's hand. Sentence 4: They grazed hands.
target: Ethan decided to hold it.

input: Title: The hoard house. Sentence 1: Mark leased a duplex for several years to an old woman. Sentence 2: She was nice enough if a recluse. Sentence 3: When she died, Mark found out she was a hoarder. Sentence 4: She had many antiques though, and with no one else it went to Mark.
target: Mark sold the pieces, and no longer needed to lease the duplex.

input: Title: Bingo win. Sentence 1: Susie played bingo. Sentence 2: She played every day she could. Sentence 3: One day she won. Sentence 4: She couldn't believe it.
target: She won a car.

input: Title: Denial. Sentence 1: In 1996, my sister-in-law's son overdosed on drugs. Sentence 2: She got him into rehab. Sentence 3: After a few days he denied having a drug problem, and left. Sentence 4: In 2013, he overdosed and died suddenly.
target: His mother was devastated.

input: Title: The Tackle. Sentence 1: Caleb was playing football with his friends. Sentence 2: One of his friends tackle him. Sentence 3: Caleb sprained his wrist. Sentence 4: Caleb sat out for a week.
target: After his wrist healed, he was able to play again.

input: Title: Meat Eater. Sentence 1: Calvin was a proud vegetarian. Sentence 2: He would always tell his friends the virtues of a meatless diet. Sentence 3: One day, Sam slipped some meat into Calvin's meal. Sentence 4: Sam revealed this information later and laughed.
target: Calvin's face turned red as a cherry.

input: Title: Winning Run. Sentence 1: It was Jon's last game of the season. Sentence 2: His team was losing by one point. Sentence 3: It was Jon's turn up to bat. Sentence 4: Jon saw the pitch and swung.
target: The ball sailed over the fence and Jon won the game!

input: Title: Don't Eat And Laugh. Sentence 1: I was eating a Subway sandwich today while watching a comedian. Sentence 2: When he said something particularly funny, I laughed hard. Sentence 3: I accidentally snorted a jalapeno piece into my nose. Sentence 4: I spent the next 10 minutes trying to flush out the heat.
target: Now my face is all red from having the pepper in my nose.

input: Title: Ashley Goes to the Pet Store. Sentence 1: Ashley wanted to buy her first pet. Sentence 2: She drove to the pet store to look at all the different animals. Sentence 3: Ashley found an adorable puppy that she instantly fell in love with! Sentence 4: She decided to name her new puppy Spot.
target: Now Ashley and Spot are the best of friends!

input: Title: Out of Milk. Sentence 1: Jim wanted cereal for breakfast. Sentence 2: He poured it out in a bowl. Sentence 3: He added bananas and sugar. Sentence 4: Jim then realized that he was out of milk.
target: He wound up having to eat everything dry.

input: Title: Old Phone. Sentence 1: Tom loved his old phone. Sentence 2: It had always worked great. Sentence 3: His friends all made fun of him for it. Sentence 4: He eventually got a new one but hated it.
target: Tom went back to his older one.

input: Title: Racing Bicycles. Sentence 1: Timmy and his friend Jason loved riding bikes. Sentence 2: They would always zoom around them in the neighborhood. Sentence 3: They decided to have a race to see who was fastest. Sentence 4: Timmy and Jason both lined up their bikes and sped off.
target: Jason came across the line first.

input: Title: Return. Sentence 1: She chose to return to college. Sentence 2: She was sick of being a nobody. Sentence 3: She wanted to make at least one dream come true. Sentence 4: She did as well as previously, making the dean's list again.
target: She continued until she graduated.

input: Title: Judy buys a dress. Sentence 1: Judy is a middle aged woman. Sentence 2: Judy has been invited to a friends wedding. Sentence 3: Judy looks through her closet to find something to wear. Sentence 4: She can't find anything.
target: She decides to go to the store and buy a new dress for the wedding.

input: Title: The Laptop. Sentence 1: Kelly needed a new computer. Sentence 2: She bought a really fancy laptop. Sentence 3: She took it home to set it up. Sentence 4: It was so confusing!
target: Kelly put it back in the box and returned it.

input: Title: Losing a Bet. Sentence 1: Charles was always considered a know it all. Sentence 2: He would always want to bet his friends. Sentence 3: One day a friend knew Charles was wrong and bet him. Sentence 4: Charles reneged on his bet after being proven wrong.
target: His friends starting hanging out with him even less.

input: Title: The Aquarium. Sentence 1: Brandon decided to go to the aquarium. Sentence 2: He saw a wide variety of fish and sea creatures. Sentence 3: His favorite part was petting a stingray. Sentence 4: In addition, there was a display about keeping the oceans clean.
target: Brandon learned a great deal that day.

input: Title: New Car. Sentence 1: Diane wanted to buy a new car, so she started at her bank. Sentence 2: She spoke with the agent, and was pre-qualified for a loan. Sentence 3: Knowing what she could spend, she went to look for a new car. Sentence 4: She test drove two SUVs from the lot, and then discussed her options.
target: After deliberating, she chose a black SUV and paid with her loan.

input: Title: Snowball Fight. Sentence 1: It snowed a lot yesterday. Sentence 2: Sally and I had to shovel the sidewalk. Sentence 3: Sally made a snowball and threw at me. Sentence 4: I made a snowball and threw it back at Sally.
target: We ended of having a snowball fight instead of shoveling snow.

input: Title: Skipping School. Sentence 1: Tom was invited to hang out with friends. Sentence 2: They wanted to skip school and watch a movie. Sentence 3: Tom was afraid of getting in trouble. Sentence 4: He declined their invitation.
target: Tom's friends understood his views.

input: Title: Wrong Number. Sentence 1: I got a call from an unknown phone number. Sentence 2: The man on the other end said he had an exciting deal for me. Sentence 3: Clearly it was a phone scam so I decided to mess with him. Sentence 4: I recited a few poem to him and asked him how they made him feel.
target: The man got frustrated but I could tell he enjoyed the poems.

input: Title: The Swing Set. Sentence 1: Jim was setting up a swingset for his daughter. Sentence 2: He was having trouble assembling the parts. Sentence 3: Jim pulled out the instructions. Sentence 4: He tried putting the swingset back together.
target: Jim was able to assemble the swing set in no time.

input: Title: The Cheap Car. Sentence 1: Casey was looking around for a used car. Sentence 2: His neighbor was selling a car. Sentence 3: The car was cheap but needed work. Sentence 4: Casey bought the car.
target: After a month of work, the car was ready to drive.

input: Title: Big surprise party. Sentence 1: Cameron had only two friends. Sentence 2: When his birthday came up, they decided to throw him a big party. Sentence 3: To make it more animated, they hired people to act as friends. Sentence 4: Cameron arrived at his party anticipating a quiet evening.
target: But as soon as he arrived, everyone surprised him with cheers.

input: Title: Transport. Sentence 1: Mia needed a way to transport her dog. Sentence 2: She went online and discovered a new product. Sentence 3: It was a carrier designed to look like a washing machine! Sentence 4: Mia thought it was the cutest thing ever!
target: She bought one for her dog and waited impatiently for it to arrive.

input: Title: Sticky Spaghetti. Sentence 1: Joe had heard that if spaghetti stuck to the wall it was cooked. Sentence 2: He was making spaghetti himself for the first time. Sentence 3: The first piece he threw against the wall didn't stick. Sentence 4: It was eight pieces later before one stayed in place.
target: When he tasted his spaghetti he found it perfectly cooked.

input: Title: Old Pastry. Sentence 1: Tom noticed a doughnut on the counter. Sentence 2: He didn't know whose it was. Sentence 3: He decided to eat it. Sentence 4: Tom tried to eat it and chipped his tooth.
target: It was rock solid.

input: Title: Asleep at the Recital. Sentence 1: Jessie had a dance recital. Sentence 2: Her mother made her brother Alex attend. Sentence 3: Alex wasn't interested in the recital. Sentence 4: He fell asleep halfway through.
target: The next year, Alex stayed at home.

input: Title: Buses. Sentence 1: My friend came to visit me. Sentence 2: We were about to go out. Sentence 3: We saw a line of several school buses. Sentence 4: It was time for school to start.
target: I was amazed by the sheer number of them.

input: Title: Hadza. Sentence 1: Harry moved to Tanzania to get back to nature. Sentence 2: He gave away all his belongings and joined the Hadza tribe. Sentence 3: Harry couldn't obtain all the essentials to survive on his own. Sentence 4: He became part of an Actual partnership to increase his productivity.
target: Harry and his partner forage together better than on their own.

input: Title: Getting sick. Sentence 1: Tim started sneezing and coughing. Sentence 2: He was getting really sick. Sentence 3: He stayed home in bed all day. Sentence 4: His mother told him to take vitamin C.
target: After that, he felt well enough to go to work.

input: Title: Singing. Sentence 1: Manuel wanted to start his online singing career. Sentence 2: He made himself a website about his talents. Sentence 3: He started a YouTube channel to post his videos. Sentence 4: He bought a microphone and recorded some songs.
target: The videos got a middling response at best and discouraged him.

input: Title: Rice Problem. Sentence 1: Anna was making a rice-based dish for her family for dinner. Sentence 2: She tried to do everything perfectly. Sentence 3: But she over boiled the rice, and it turned to mush! Sentence 4: She had to improvise and fry it into paella.
target: Her family enjoyed the strange but tasty treat.

input: Title: Late for Work. Sentence 1: Adrian went to bed at 2:00am despite having to go to work at 7:00am. Sentence 2: He set his alarm clock to 5:30 am before getting into bed. Sentence 3: When the alarm went off, he hit the snooze button. Sentence 4: He eventually woke up and realized it was already 6:30 am.
target: He was going to be late for work that day.

input: Title: The Fort. Sentence 1: Andy and I played after school. Sentence 2: When it was too cold, we stayed indoors. Sentence 3: We built a fort from comforters and chairs. Sentence 4: We stretched the comforters over the back of bar stools.
target: We sat underneath and played with our toys.

input: Title: Thanksgiving Scare. Sentence 1: Kate's mom always had mental issues. Sentence 2: She invited herself to their Thanksgiving dinner. Sentence 3: Kate tried to be accommodating but it didn't help. Sentence 4: Kate's mom attempted suicide in the kitchen.
target: They had to rush her to a hospital.

input: Title: Reunion Lunch. Sentence 1: I had lunch with my two of my high school buddies in February. Sentence 2: We graduated in 1971. Sentence 3: One of my friends told me his wife had just left him. Sentence 4: They were married for 18 years, and he was devastated.
target: The tone of the lunch was sad.

input: Title: Mike the shoplifter.. Sentence 1: Mike wanted a set of headphones that he could not afford. Sentence 2: Mike decided that he would steal the headphones from a local store. Sentence 3: Mike entered the store and spotted the headphones he wanted. Sentence 4: Mike approached the headphones making sure he was not noticeable.
target: Mike placed the headphones into his pocket and walked out of the store.

input: Title: The Test. Sentence 1: Edmond was worried about his English grade. Sentence 2: He spent extra time practicing his writing. Sentence 3: Edmond studied from his English text. Sentence 4: When the next exam came, Edmond was ready.
target: Edmond passed the course with ease.

input: Title: Hospital. Sentence 1: She knew she needed to go to the hospital. Sentence 2: She grabbed her keys and a bag. Sentence 3: She put a towel down in the seat. Sentence 4: She leaked on it all the way there.
target: She was starting to go into labor.

input: Title: Citation. Sentence 1: Karla crossed the intersection without fully stopping for a stop sign. Sentence 2: She was pulled over by a policeman. Sentence 3: Karla tried to get out of the ticket by flirting with the cop. Sentence 4: The cop was not impressed and cited her for her expired tags as well.
target: Karla was so upset she got into a wreck on the way home.

input: Title: Walking the Dog. Sentence 1: I took my dog for a walk one day. Sentence 2: It was very sunny so he got hot. Sentence 3: We walked to a nearby fountain. Sentence 4: He drank a lot of water from the fountain.
target: We then walked home and he fell asleep on the couch.

input: Title: The Wrong Bacon. Sentence 1: Jane was a vegan. Sentence 2: She was asked to pick up bacon. Sentence 3: She thought it would be fine to get vegan bacon. Sentence 4: She was clearly wrong.
target: Jane was never asked to pick up meat products again.

input: Title: The Missing Gloves. Sentence 1: Jena was getting ready for school. Sentence 2: It was cold outside. Sentence 3: Jena couldn't find her gloves. Sentence 4: It was getting close to time to leave.
target: Jena borrowed her sister's gloves.

input: Title: Unexpected Gifting. Sentence 1: Miranda from New York did not like having fat thighs. Sentence 2: She learned that exercise would give her more shapely legs. Sentence 3: She ordered a stair stepper from an online store. Sentence 4: The machine was delivered to an Idaho address far from Miranda.
target: A person in Idaho now has nice legs.

input: Title: Help The Po Po. Sentence 1: Mary liked tagging buildings at night. Sentence 2: It made her forget her day job at an office and feel alive. Sentence 3: She signed her graffiti the same way she signed her checks. Sentence 4: A bank manager recognized her signature and tipped off the police.
target: They arrested a no-longer-bored Mary in front of her whole office.

input: Title: Weekend Off?. Sentence 1: Amy was looking forward to a relaxing weekend at home by the pool. Sentence 2: She had switched shifts with a coworker to get an extra day off. Sentence 3: On Saturday, her manager called her on her cell phone. Sentence 4: Her coworker didn't show up for her shift!
target: As she drove to work, Amy vowed to leave her phone off on the weekend.

input: Title: Lost earring. Sentence 1: Kate was going swimming in the ocean. Sentence 2: Stupidly she wore her expensive earrings in the water. Sentence 3: All of the sudden she freaked out. Sentence 4: She realized her earring was lost.
target: It took Kate one hour to find it.

input: Title: Take a Seat. Sentence 1: Kate broke her heel while in a club in Las Vegas. Sentence 2: She could barely walk on her broken heel. Sentence 3: She needed to sit down to assess the damage. Sentence 4: But the chair she sat on had gum on it.
target: In her hurry she didn't realize her error until it was too late.

input: Title: The Beach. Sentence 1: Judy had a big day planned at the beach. Sentence 2: She was going to swim and build a sand castle. Sentence 3: When she was building her castle a wave knocked it down. Sentence 4: She was very upset and wanted to cry.
target: Her parents came to her aid and helped her rebuild her castle.

input: Title: Gym. Sentence 1: Tom wanted to meet like-minded people. Sentence 2: Tom loved going to the gym. Sentence 3: Tom introduced himself to people at the gym. Sentence 4: Tom made many great friends.
target: Tom met the like-minded people he was seeking.

input: Title: Shirt. Sentence 1: The man ironed his shirt. Sentence 2: He left the iron on his shirt for too long. Sentence 3: He burnt the fabric of the shirt. Sentence 4: He threw the shirt away.
target: He ordered a replacement shirt online.

input: Title: Visitor in the house.. Sentence 1: My dog Leila loved to chase my friends Damien around. Sentence 2: Although she was playful, he seemed scared of her. Sentence 3: One day Leila chased him from the backyard to the front yard. Sentence 4: She ran after him down the street and inside his house.
target: She stopped and set next to his grandfather in their living room.

input: Title: Cold Calls. Sentence 1: Hugh just got a new job as an insurance salesman. Sentence 2: He got a contact list from his employer to call. Sentence 3: He didn't have a relationship with any of the clients. Sentence 4: When Hugh made his first sale he was very proud.
target: His boss gave him a bonus because cold calls are the hardest to close.

input: Title: Walk. Sentence 1: One night I was walking down the road. Sentence 2: A policeman stopped me. Sentence 3: He accused me of taking a wallet. Sentence 4: He said I could not walk on that street anymore.
target: My friend came to pick me up.

input: Title: Changing Oil. Sentence 1: John needed an oil change for his car. Sentence 2: He decided to do it himself. Sentence 3: He bought everything he needed on sale. Sentence 4: He followed online instructions.
target: Everything went well.

input: Title: Goal. Sentence 1: Tim had the soccer ball. Sentence 2: He ran fast with it. Sentence 3: The other team couldn't catch him. Sentence 4: He shot the ball.
target: He scored.

input: Title: Perfect life. Sentence 1: Nolan is the most successful man I know. Sentence 2: He has everything anyone can want. Sentence 3: And as nothing is missing from his life, he dreams for nothing. Sentence 4: All he has to do is live his live to the fullest without any pain.
target: Nolan's life is so perfect, I don't envy him at all.

input: Title: Locker. Sentence 1: James walked to the high school. Sentence 2: He opened his old locker. Sentence 3: It was the same combination. Sentence 4: He took out the student's backpack.
target: He took the money and ran.

input: Title: Festival. Sentence 1: There's a music festival in my town today. Sentence 2: I go every year and try all the food. Sentence 3: It's expensive but it's fun to treat myself. Sentence 4: All of the bands perform for free.
target: It's a shame every town can't host a festival once in awhile.

input: Title: The Watch. Sentence 1: Matthew couldn't find his favorite watch. Sentence 2: He looked on his desk. Sentence 3: He checked under his bed. Sentence 4: Matthew even went into the bathroom to find his watch.
target: His mother found the watch inside his backpack.

input: Title: Negative Attention. Sentence 1: Tom had a small restaurant. Sentence 2: He wanted to advertise it. Sentence 3: A local news agency offered to do a story on it. Sentence 4: Unfortunately the story was really negative.
target: Tom's business suffered greatly.

input: Title: Running at night. Sentence 1: Last night I went on a very long run. Sentence 2: It was the longest distance I had ever run before. Sentence 3: I ran for so long, I had no idea where I was. Sentence 4: After a few minutes I remembered how to get home.
target: I think tonight I'll try to run that long again.

input: Title: Girl's Night. Sentence 1: Every Friday, the girls from work get together to have a girl's night. Sentence 2: Normally it's just lounging at home watching movies. Sentence 3: Each of them brings a different snack for us to share. Sentence 4: I usually bring the drinks.
target: The hardest part though, is choosing which movie to watch.

input: Title: A Smoky Smell. Sentence 1: Joyce walked outside to walk her dog one night. Sentence 2: She smelled smoke in the air. Sentence 3: She saw flames from down the street. Sentence 4: Joyce ran back into her house.
target: She called the fire department.

input: Title: Stolen Gifts. Sentence 1: Tom was shopping on Black Friday. Sentence 2: He got gifts for all his loved ones. Sentence 3: He left them in his car while at one more store. Sentence 4: When Tom went back everything was missing.
target: Tom cried profusely in the parking lot.

input: Title: Stuck Saul. Sentence 1: Saul got into the elevator at his office building. Sentence 2: The doors closed and the elevator started to move. Sentence 3: Saul became anxious when the elevator stopped between floors. Sentence 4: He had to use the emergency phone to call for help.
target: The building manager got the elevator running again.

input: Title: Camping Trip. Sentence 1: The Hubbell family went on a camping trip together. Sentence 2: They all decided to sleep in the same tent. Sentence 3: Jeff had a hard time sleeping because of his dad's snoring. Sentence 4: He put his headphones in and cranked the music up loud.
target: It took a while but eventually Jeff fell asleep listening to music.

input: Title: Permitting. Sentence 1: The store started a pharmacy online. Sentence 2: They had trouble with one local permit. Sentence 3: They asked the City for a reprieve. Sentence 4: The City refused the reprieve.
target: The company moved to another city.

input: Title: The Flip Flops. Sentence 1: Taylor liked dressing casually. Sentence 2: She always had flip flops on her feet. Sentence 3: No matter how fancy of a restaurant she was at, she didn't care. Sentence 4: She'd even wear flip flops when she was working out.
target: Taylor threw away all her dressy shoes.

input: Title: He'd Rather Go To Prison. Sentence 1: Frank Thomas always found himself arguing with his wife. Sentence 2: He hated the fact that they couldn't get along. Sentence 3: Frank wanted a divorce but his lawyer said it would cost a lot. Sentence 4: Frank decided he did not want to live with her any longer.
target: Because he'd rather go to prison, he robbed a local bank.

input: Title: Ken gets fired. Sentence 1: Ken is a cook. Sentence 2: While at work Ken begins cooking meals. Sentence 3: While cooking a customer notices Ken spitting in their food. Sentence 4: They complain to the manger.
target: Ken gets fired from his job.

input: Title: Removal. Sentence 1: She arrived early to her appointment. Sentence 2: The dentist gave her a shot in the gums. Sentence 3: Everything went blessedly numb. Sentence 4: He removed the tooth that was hurting her.
target: He prescribed pain killers, and she left happily.

input: Title: Dropped Remote. Sentence 1: Kia dropped her TV remote by mistake one day. Sentence 2: It broke apart on the floor! Sentence 3: Kia could not fix it. Sentence 4: She had to call the cable company for a new one.
target: They brought her a remote and charged her $40!

input: Title: Meeting. Sentence 1: An old boyfriend contacted me on social media. Sentence 2: He had found out my husband and I were separated. Sentence 3: He had just gotten a divorce and wanted to meet me. Sentence 4: I decided to take revenge for the past.
target: I agreed to meet him and didn't show up.

input: Title: The Pictures. Sentence 1: I was out shopping with some friends. Sentence 2: We were taking pictures of each other. Sentence 3: Suddenly, my phone dropped. Sentence 4: All of my pictures were deleted.
target: Luckily, we saw this as an opportunity to take more good pictures.

input: Title: Fresh cupcakes. Sentence 1: Kara noticed some new neighbors that moved in. Sentence 2: She wanted to do something nice for them. Sentence 3: Kara decided she wanted to make some cupcakes. Sentence 4: She got out her materials and started cooking.
target: When she was done, her neighbor's were very appreciative.

input: Title: Going for a Run.. Sentence 1: Tabitha was going for a run. Sentence 2: She was a very fit and active person. Sentence 3: Running was one of Tabitha's favorite hobbies. Sentence 4: She sat out at a good pace.
target: She looked at her watch and saw she had run very fast.

input: Title: Wasted Time. Sentence 1: Henry went to the library to study. Sentence 2: He logged on his laptop to access several documents. Sentence 3: It shut down since the battery was running low. Sentence 4: Henry couldn't go home since he had no ride.
target: He ended up doing nothing for 1-2 hours.

input: Title: The Throw. Sentence 1: A boy pick up a rock at the beach. Sentence 2: He felt the texture and inspected it for smoothness. Sentence 3: He approved of the rock for a skipping stone. Sentence 4: The boy brought his arm back and waited for calm water.
target: During a lull he threw the stone and it skipped 11 times on the water.

input: Title: Trash into Treasure. Sentence 1: I wanted to do something meaningful about an overflowing city dump. Sentence 2: The random trash tossed together inspired me to create salvage art. Sentence 3: I made sculptures from car parts, machinery, and hardware. Sentence 4: I began selling them and teaching art classes to raise awareness.
target: Eventually, I helped turn trash into a creative reuse trend.

input: Title: Sally Tips Her Waiter. Sentence 1: Sally was having lunch by herself at an Italian restaurant. Sentence 2: She overheard her waiter having money problems. Sentence 3: Sally felt very bad for her waiter. Sentence 4: After her meal, Sally tipped her $100.
target: The waiter was very grateful for the tip.

input: Title: Professor Wilton. Sentence 1: Wilton was an economics professor at the local community college. Sentence 2: He decided to teach a class on supply and demand. Sentence 3: None of his students understood the lesson. Sentence 4: Wilton became very frustrated at his class.
target: He decided to go the dean and quit.

input: Title: A visit, or a trick of the mind?. Sentence 1: When Nellie was home with the kids, her mom would often drop by. Sentence 2: When Nellie was thirty, her mother died after a short illness. Sentence 3: One day, hanging laundry, Nellie looked up at her kitchen window. Sentence 4: She saw her mom smiling, as she'd done a hundred times.
target: She'd already turned around when she remembered her mother had died.

input: Title: Not Bad. Sentence 1: Kate was doing chat hits with other workers on Mturk. Sentence 2: She was apprehensive initially. Sentence 3: She worried the other person wouldn't be fair. Sentence 4: After 3 hits she realized she liked them.
target: She Was happy to discover they were good hits after all.

input: Title: Falling Down. Sentence 1: Sam was in a marathon. Sentence 2: He was close to first place. Sentence 3: All of a sudden he fell. Sentence 4: He didn't even make the top ten.
target: Sam was terribly disappointed.

input: Title: Fast fashion. Sentence 1: Miranda loved shopping, Sentence 2: She decided to buy some clothes. Sentence 3: She went to a fast fashion store. Sentence 4: Miranda bought a lot.
target: She was happy about it.

input: Title: Walking. Sentence 1: I had a stroke in October of 2011. Sentence 2: I was unable to walk. Sentence 3: I was in rehab for five weeks. Sentence 4: I was transferred to a sub acute rehab unit.
target: I finally started to walk after the transfer.

input: Title: Bad Tip. Sentence 1: Kate was making ends meet as a waitress. Sentence 2: She had a big party full of drunk people. Sentence 3: They ran her around for over an hour. Sentence 4: At the end they left a really bad tip.
target: Kate broke down and cried for half an hour.

input: Title: Don't know where the floss is. Sentence 1: I went to the drugstore yesterday. Sentence 2: I needed floss but I couldn't find it. Sentence 3: I asked for help. Sentence 4: But no one knew where the floss was.
target: I had to leave the store.

input: Title: Grounded. Sentence 1: Lisa wanted to see a concert with her friends. Sentence 2: The problem was that Lisa was grounded. Sentence 3: She decided to sneak out of the house to see the concert. Sentence 4: Her mom caught her and extended the grounding.
target: Now Lisa is grounded for a year!

input: Title: Amber gets fired. Sentence 1: Amber is working as a waitress. Sentence 2: She is taking orders and serving tables. Sentence 3: While bringing an order to a customer. Sentence 4: She spills the food and drinks all over them.
target: Amber gets fired after the accident.

input: Title: Water Shut off. Sentence 1: Today the water was shut off from our kitchen. Sentence 2: The bathroom was unaffected, luckily. Sentence 3: This afternoon I forgot and put some dishes into the sink. Sentence 4: I turned on the water and got brown stuff.
target: I now have two brown dishes.

input: Title: Math. Sentence 1: I hated math when I started college. Sentence 2: I had always made bad grades in it. Sentence 3: I worked really hard at teaching it to myself. Sentence 4: I ended up with an A in the class.
target: My classmates were very surprised.

input: Title: Shower. Sentence 1: I bought some new soap for showering. Sentence 2: It smelled like watermelon. Sentence 3: It was a 3 in 1, so I used it in all 3 ways. Sentence 4: I washed my hair, used it as conditioner, then washed my body.
target: I got out of the shower smelling like watermelon.

input: Title: Homemade Pumpkin Pie. Sentence 1: I decided to make pumpkin pie starting with a pumpkin. Sentence 2: I found a recipe and followed it. Sentence 3: I carried the pie on a plane to my sister's home. Sentence 4: We ate the pie after Thanksgiving dinner.
target: My family said the pie was good.

input: Title: Smith Family Trip. Sentence 1: The smith's wanted to get away. Sentence 2: They decided to travel to the Bahama's. Sentence 3: The family had the best time swimming and surfing. Sentence 4: They had the time of their lives.
target: The smith family decided the Bahama's would be their tradition.

input: Title: Alan's Eulogy. Sentence 1: Alan had prepared a eulogy for his friend that recently passed away. Sentence 2: He was very nervous before the funeral. Sentence 3: Alan walked to the podium at the appropriate time. Sentence 4: He delivered a passionate speech.
target: There wasn't a dry eye in the room.

input: Title: Filling the Post. Sentence 1: My wife retired from work two weeks ago. Sentence 2: Her boss is having trouble filling her job. Sentence 3: One person was supposed to come to work on a Monday, but never showed. Sentence 4: Others have scheduled interviews but have not shown up.
target: She is at her wits' end.

input: Title: Alex learns to write.. Sentence 1: Alex is getting ready to start Kindergarten. Sentence 2: Alex's has been practicing writing letters all summer long. Sentence 3: Today Alex's mom gave him a test to see how much he learned. Sentence 4: Alex got 14 out of 15 questions on his test correct.
target: Alex's mom rewarded him with an ice cream sundae.

input: Title: Oven. Sentence 1: Harry made some food. Sentence 2: He put it in the oven to cook. Sentence 3: He went outside to work. Sentence 4: He smelled some smoke.
target: He ran inside to stop the fire.

input: Title: The Purse Theft. Sentence 1: Monica was walking to the library one day. Sentence 2: Suddenly she felt her purse yanked from her arms. Sentence 3: Some random person was running off with her bag. Sentence 4: She called the police and described the suspect.
target: Luckily they caught the guy and returned her purse.

input: Title: Making Breakfast. Sentence 1: Today was their anniversary. Sentence 2: Toby wanted to surprise his wife. Sentence 3: He snuck into the kitchen and started making breakfast. Sentence 4: Toby made all his wife's favorite breakfast foods.
target: She was so happy when he brought her breakfast in bed.

input: Title: Joey's Child. Sentence 1: Joey's and his wife have a toddler. Sentence 2: They decided it was time to get the child to potty train. Sentence 3: Joey tried everything to get their child to learn. Sentence 4: He hired an expert to help.

input: Title: Safe Side. Sentence 1: Kate broke the zipper on her luggage by over stuffing it. Sentence 2: She was happy to find it had another zipper pull. Sentence 3: Now she could close it and go to the airport. Sentence 4: She decided to remove some of the items from the suitcase.
target: It was better safe than sorry.

input: Title: Suzy loses a tooth. Sentence 1: Suzy is outside playing. Sentence 2: She trips and falls down. Sentence 3: She notices something is missing. Sentence 4: Her tooth had fallen out.
target: She runs and puts it under her pillow for the tooth fairy.

input: Title: The Extra. Sentence 1: Tom applied for a movie. Sentence 2: He was chosen to be an extra. Sentence 3: Tom wanted to stand out. Sentence 4: He kept acting up in the background.
target: Tom was fired from the set.

input: Title: Pumpkin Patch. Sentence 1: Johnny's first grade class went to the pumpkin patch. Sentence 2: They each got to pick out a pumpkin. Sentence 3: The only rule was they had to be able to carry it. Sentence 4: Johnny found his perfect pumpkin but couldn't pick it up.
target: He was very frustrated when he had to select a smaller one.

input: Title: Dog Bite. Sentence 1: I was swinging my brother. Sentence 2: I got in the way right before he would have hit me. Sentence 3: I was pushing his feet. Sentence 4: Our dog bit my brother in the calf.
target: My parents got rid of the dog.

input: Title: Pizza. Sentence 1: Ella and her family had pizza for dinner on a Friday night. Sentence 2: She put the leftover slices of pizza on the counter. Sentence 3: Ella went down to the basement to put laundry in the washer. Sentence 4: When she came back the pizza was gone.
target: Their dog had jumped on the counter and ate all of the leftovers!

input: Title: Don't Look Edward. Sentence 1: Edward was told not to look at the solar eclipse. Sentence 2: He was told it would damage his eyes if he did look at it. Sentence 3: Edward tried hard to not look at the solar eclipse, but did anyway. Sentence 4: The blinding light hurt his eyes and made him look away in pain.
target: He hurt his vision and now needs glasses to see.

input: Title: Nails. Sentence 1: My nails were always short and very brittle. Sentence 2: They were covered in tiny lines. Sentence 3: Because of this, polish wouldn't stay put. Sentence 4: I bought a small fine sanding paper.
target: After sanding down my nails, they were shiny and pretty.

input: Title: Getting a Minivan. Sentence 1: Tom's wife was pregnant. Sentence 2: They needed to get a family vehicle. Sentence 3: Tom decided to get a minivan. Sentence 4: He actually liked most of them.
target: He picked a new model with several features.

input: Title: Injury. Sentence 1: The brothers wrestled in the front yard. Sentence 2: One brother screamed for the other to stop. Sentence 3: The other brother got up quickly. Sentence 4: The screaming brother had a dislocated shoulder.
target: His brother helped him put it back in.

input: Title: The Murder. Sentence 1: Irene had a horrible relationship. Sentence 2: One day, she was discovered dead. Sentence 3: The police investigated and knew that it was a murder. Sentence 4: They investigated for a month.
target: Soon, her boyfriend was arrested for it.

input: Title: Wrong Item. Sentence 1: Haley tried to tickle Jay. Sentence 2: He got tired of it and pushed Haley on the ground. Sentence 3: Haley got mad and picked up a small rock. Sentence 4: She threw it at him.
target: He fell down and passed out.

input: Title: Adding Machine. Sentence 1: My wife's coworker has an adding machine. Sentence 2: It stopped printing tapes. Sentence 3: My wife called to order a new machine. Sentence 4: Her coworker wanted to get it replaced under warranty.
target: The company reluctantly replaced the machine at no charge.

input: Title: Coffee Shakes. Sentence 1: Nina was enjoying coffee at a coffee shop. Sentence 2: All of a sudden everything started shaking. Sentence 3: People were panicking. Sentence 4: Nina hid under a table.
target: She was experiencing her first earthquake.

input: Title: Leaves. Sentence 1: Tom loved nature and the outdoors. Sentence 2: He decided to buy plants for his home. Sentence 3: He browsed many plants at the nursery. Sentence 4: He found a plant with very soft leaves.
target: He purchased that plant and was happy about it.

input: Title: Short Term Memory. Sentence 1: My mom reminded me to take out the trash tonight. Sentence 2: Since I was studying late at night, I forgot. Sentence 3: The next day, the garbage truck rode across the neighborhood. Sentence 4: It passed my house since the trash cans were not out.
target: My mom was mad when I told her that I forgot.

input: Title: Accounting. Sentence 1: Tom worked in the legal department at a large corporation. Sentence 2: Tom disliked his coworkers as they were negative people. Sentence 3: He asked his boss to allow him to change departments. Sentence 4: His boss allowed him to move to accounting or stay in legal.
target: Tom happily moved to accounting and found he new colleagues pleasant.

input: Title: Trip to Branson. Sentence 1: Last summer, the kiddo and I went to Branson, Missouri. Sentence 2: We were on an extended vacation. Sentence 3: We drove around town all day, looking for cool things to do. Sentence 4: We stopped at several shows, including the Dixie Stampede.
target: The boy's favorite was driving The Duck into the river.

input: Title: Bad News. Sentence 1: Doris' parents sat her down for a serious chat. Sentence 2: She was so worried about what it could be. Sentence 3: She was so sad to hear them announce that they were divorcing. Sentence 4: Doris cried all night about the new situation.
target: By morning she had realized she wanted her parents to be happy.

input: Title: Simpsons. Sentence 1: I bought a dvd with the Simpson's characters. Sentence 2: Inside the box was a set of figurines. Sentence 3: All the family members of the show were present. Sentence 4: I took them all out and put them in a display case.
target: I closed them inside and locked it for safety.

input: Title: Help. Sentence 1: Together, mom and son went to his class. Sentence 2: They talked with his teacher about how he could make friends. Sentence 3: The teacher said she hadn't been able to focus on it much. Sentence 4: She promised to help out, and began encouraging kids to talk to him.
target: By the end of the week, he had a new best friend.

input: Title: Eczema. Sentence 1: Cody had really nice skin until he was about 8 years old. Sentence 2: Shortly after his 8th birthday his skin began to itch. Sentence 3: As time went on his skin began to peel and it would cause him pain. Sentence 4: He went to the Doctor who ordered tests which showed he had eczema.
target: He was then prescribed special lotions and now his skin is better.

input: Title: Flat Tire. Sentence 1: Bill had a flat tire tonight. Sentence 2: He wasn't able to make it to the meeting. Sentence 3: I took notes to let him know what happened. Sentence 4: I'm going to send them home with his neighbor.
target: I know Bill will appreciate having the notes.

input: Title: The Basket. Sentence 1: Joy was decorating her porch. Sentence 2: She got a basket and put some mums in it. Sentence 3: She tried to move the basket, but the handle popped off. Sentence 4: The basket completely fell apart.
target: Joy was so frustrated!

input: Title: The Game Show. Sentence 1: The contestants were lined up. Sentence 2: They were all going to be on a gameshow. Sentence 3: Bob was selected first. Sentence 4: He won a million dollars!
target: It was a great day for Bob!

input: Title: Van. Sentence 1: Greg picked up the van. Sentence 2: He took it to it's scheduled maintenance. Sentence 3: The mechanic found some additional problems with the van. Sentence 4: Greg called his boss.
target: His bock picked him up from the mechanics.

input: Title: Money Stand. Sentence 1: Will decided his daughter should learn about money. Sentence 2: Will bought her a cute cardboard lemonade stand. Sentence 3: Will sat outside one hot day with his daughter and the stand. Sentence 4: Many people stopped to buy Will's daughter's lemonade.
target: That day Will's daughter made thirty dollars by selling lemonade!

input: Title: Jason Plays Video Games. Sentence 1: Jason finds that he has a lot of free time after work. Sentence 2: He decides he needs to take up a hobby. Sentence 3: Jason decides to start playing video games. Sentence 4: He finds them fun.
target: He is glad to have something to do after work.

input: Title: The Child Without A Home. Sentence 1: Mary was a 7 year old girl living in an orphanage. Sentence 2: All of her life she dreamed of finding a family. Sentence 3: One day a nice family named the Anthons came to meet Mary. Sentence 4: They all played together and talked over lunch.
target: They all decided Mary should become part of the family.

input: Title: The Door. Sentence 1: Pat heard a knocking sound. Sentence 2: Someone was at her door. Sentence 3: When she answered, there was no one there. Sentence 4: Her wreath kept hitting her door and making that sound.
target: Pat slammed the door shut in anger.

input: Title: The Skating Fall. Sentence 1: Chrissy was roller skating with friends for fun. Sentence 2: They were all laughing and playing games. Sentence 3: Chrissy wasn't paying attention and slipped. Sentence 4: She crashed to the ground, busting her lip open.
target: Luckily her friends were happy to stop skating to help her.

input: Title: The argument. Sentence 1: Helen and Mike were married for over a year. Sentence 2: They used to be a happy couple but they had been arguing a lot lately. Sentence 3: After one of their heated arguments, Helen stormed out of the house. Sentence 4: Upset and crying, she jumped into her car and was involved in a wreck.
target: Helen has been in a coma ever since and Mike has rarely left her side.

input: Title: Alph. Sentence 1: Albert Bertal was daydreaming again. Sentence 2: He often did so when he was on the construction sight. Sentence 3: This time it was about his engagement to his sweetheart. Sentence 4: He wondered what kind of dress she'd wear as he walked to the office.
target: That's when he tripped on a piece of rebar and knocked himself out.

input: Title: New Life From Old Father. Sentence 1: Melissa was unhappy until she found something worth living for. Sentence 2: Her mother kicked her out the house three months ago. Sentence 3: Melissa was living in someone's shed, someone who didn't like her. Sentence 4: She remembered her mother saying the name of her alleged father.
target: Melissa Googled Douglas Bower and found a nice, caring father.

input: Title: Impatient. Sentence 1: Greg got caught in traffic. Sentence 2: He was already late to work but he was outpatient. Sentence 3: A car in front of him eventually stopped moving. Sentence 4: Out of frustration, he ran into it.
target: Police officers came and arrested him.

input: Title: The boy who cried fowl.. Sentence 1: Timmy would always trick his friends and family. Sentence 2: Timmy would make his friends and family think he was in danger. Sentence 3: One day Timmy was helping his father unload a truckload of chickens. Sentence 4: A Timmy was unloading the chicken one of them decided to attack him.
target: Jimmy cried for help but no one came to help him.

input: Title: The Argument. Sentence 1: Kyle was furious at his friend. Sentence 2: The friend had stolen his favorite hat from him. Sentence 3: Kyle called him to confront him. Sentence 4: The friend agreed to return the hat.
target: Their friendship was never the same.

input: Title: Leaky Faucet. Sentence 1: Tom lived in an apartment. Sentence 2: He got a leaky faucet. Sentence 3: Tom could call to get it fixed. Sentence 4: It would just take a long time to do so.
target: Tom decided to just quickly fix it himself.

input: Title: Music and Money. Sentence 1: Harvey loved music and owned thousands of old records. Sentence 2: He was moving into a smaller place with little room for them though. Sentence 3: He had to sell all his records. Sentence 4: His brother bought him an iPod and put all of his music onto it.
target: Now Harvey has free space and still gets to listen to his music!

input: Title: Gary Rides the Bus. Sentence 1: Gary is going to ride the bus today. Sentence 2: Gary is nervous. Sentence 3: Gary gets on the bus. Sentence 4: He gives the driver his money.
target: The bus is a good way to get around.

input: Title: Grill Night. Sentence 1: My boyfriend and I were looking forward to grilling for dinner. Sentence 2: We went to the store to buy fish and veggies. Sentence 3: When we got home we noticed that fish had a weird smell. Sentence 4: Not trusting it, we threw it away.
target: We decided to call in pizza.

input: Title: Fred's Key. Sentence 1: Fred lost the key to his house. Sentence 2: He went to the store to buy a new key and hardware. Sentence 3: Fred installed the new hardware on the door. Sentence 4: He made a spare key.
target: Fred put the spare key in a safe place in case he lost his.

input: Title: Trust. Sentence 1: Trust Jackson had an ironic name. Sentence 2: Because she didn't trust anyone at all, she was mocked. Sentence 3: This only fed into her complex. Sentence 4: To the point where her mother told her her father had died.
target: She laughed, and denied reality right into an institution.

input: Title: Going Crazy. Sentence 1: Tom hadn't slept in a couple of days. Sentence 2: He was too busy to be able to do so. Sentence 3: After a while he started hearing and seeing things. Sentence 4: His speech patterns didn't make much sense.
target: Tom wound up passing out and sleeping for a long time.

input: Title: crying. Sentence 1: The man was crying. Sentence 2: His friend asked why. Sentence 3: The man would not answer. Sentence 4: The friend asked again.
target: The man lashed out in anger.

input: Title: Water. Sentence 1: Determined to drink more water, I carried a water bottle everywhere. Sentence 2: One thing that I have omitted is making the sure the bottle is closed. Sentence 3: One time, I put the bottle of water in my bag with the cap off. Sentence 4: I soon discovered the water had soaked my books completely.
target: Fortunately, my books were still readable after that event.

input: Title: Dust. Sentence 1: Edward hated dust a lot. Sentence 2: In fact, he cleaned his house every day. Sentence 3: One day, he decided that he would invite some guests. Sentence 4: Before that, he spotted dust on the ground!
target: Edward cleaned the dust up very quickly.

input: Title: Tow Truck. Sentence 1: Isaac's family was driving to a hotel for summer vacation. Sentence 2: Their car broke down on the road. Sentence 3: Isaac's parents called a tow truck. Sentence 4: Isaac and his family had to ride in the tow truck to the gas station.
target: Isaac thought it was the coolest day ever!

input: Title: The Play Tryouts. Sentence 1: Len was trying out for the school play. Sentence 2: It was his turn on the stage. Sentence 3: Len forgot half his words. Sentence 4: Len didn't get any lines in the play.
target: He was allowed to work on putting up the stage instead.

input: Title: Beach day. Sentence 1: Last week we had a beach day. Sentence 2: It was great. Sentence 3: I was really looking forward to it. Sentence 4: When we went it was very hot.
target: I jumped in right away.

input: Title: Try. Sentence 1: Carla was at an Ethiopian restaurant with her mom and dad. Sentence 2: She was a picky eater, but they urged her to sample something new. Sentence 3: Carla did her best, selecting a rice and chicken dish from the menu. Sentence 4: When it arrived, she gingerly tasted a tiny portion of it.
target: To her surprise, she liked it very much!

input: Title: Tucker marries. Sentence 1: Tucker is in love. Sentence 2: Tucker purposes to his girlfriend. Sentence 3: The girlfriend says yes. Sentence 4: Tucker sets a wedding date.
target: Tucker gets married.

input: Title: Missing movie date.. Sentence 1: Mika was really looking forward to seeing a movie together. Sentence 2: Mika got off work early just to purchased movie tickets. Sentence 3: I had to work later than usual and informed Mika. Sentence 4: Mika waited outside the theater for me.
target: When I arrived I could not find Mika anywhere.

input: Title: Neighborhood Fireworks. Sentence 1: Rebecca lived in the house behind Moe. Sentence 2: She became upset when Moe shot fireworks from his yard. Sentence 3: She went to Moe's house to confront him. Sentence 4: She told Moe that she didn't want her house to burn down.
target: Moe ignored Rebecca because he didn't like her.

input: Title: Nurse. Sentence 1: At the age of 40 Shannon decided to go to school again. Sentence 2: She wanted to train to become a nurse. Sentence 3: She was a little out of her element at first but loved it. Sentence 4: She did really well and got great grades.
target: After graduation she was hired and she was thrilled to start!

input: Title: Lizzie misses the dance. Sentence 1: Lizzie was getting ready for the dance. Sentence 2: She had just finished doing her hair. Sentence 3: She now needed to do her make up. Sentence 4: She went to start her car.
target: It wouldn't start!

input: Title: Windfall. Sentence 1: Lucy saw a billboard sign for the state lottery jackpot. Sentence 2: She went to the store to buy a lotto ticket. Sentence 3: Lucy watched the drawing that night at 10pm. Sentence 4: She grabbed the ticket from her purse to check the numbers.
target: Lucy realized she matched all 6 numbers and hit the jackpot!

input: Title: Bonsai boy. Sentence 1: When Jack was young he wanted to be a bonsai master. Sentence 2: When he was 18 he moved to Japan to pursue his dream. Sentence 3: He studied under bonsai masters from Asia and Europe. Sentence 4: When he came home he used his new knowledge to start a bonsai nursery.
target: He is extremely happy now, surrounded by bonsai everyday.

input: Title: Dishonesty. Sentence 1: Silvia had to give a big speech at work. Sentence 2: She asked her friend Albert to listen to it and give his opinion. Sentence 3: Albert listened to the speech but wasn't convinced it was good. Sentence 4: Despite his own dislike for the speech, he complimented Silvia.
target: Silvia made her speech and looked like a fool without knowing why.

input: Title: Lost Tools. Sentence 1: Tom had a lot of tools. Sentence 2: All his friends always asked him to borrow them. Sentence 3: After a while Tom started losing them. Sentence 4: A lot of his friends never gave them back.
target: Tom stopped lending them out.

input: Title: The Jellybean. Sentence 1: Little Lisa loved sweets! Sentence 2: She couldn't wait until Easter. Sentence 3: When the day came, she jumped out of bed. Sentence 4: She went on an Egg hunt and found 23 eggs.
target: All were filled with jellybeans, to Lisa's delight!

input: Title: The huge bug. Sentence 1: I saw a huge bug in my room. Sentence 2: I screamed as I ran down the hallway. Sentence 3: I got a spoon to throw at the bug. Sentence 4: I looked for it everywhere.
target: I then saw that the bug had climbed out of the window.

input: Title: On top. Sentence 1: Jason wanted nothing more than to be on top of everyone else. Sentence 2: To achieve his ambition, he devoted all his hours to devise a plan. Sentence 3: He worked on the plan for years, adjusting details every day. Sentence 4: But after years and years of work, he still wasn't at the top.
target: In the end, the plan was so complicated, he had to let it go.

input: Title: New Boss. Sentence 1: When Eric showed up to work today he was shocked. Sentence 2: He heard terrible news that his boss had passed away. Sentence 3: Eric felt like he was being groomed to take the job after his boss. Sentence 4: His boss passing away meant they were getting a new boss.

input: Title: Cruelty Free. Sentence 1: Em was nervous about being the only vegan at her family Thanksgiving. Sentence 2: She hoped she could educate her family about her lifestyle. Sentence 3: Em brought a vegan roast to share, showing the variety vegans ate. Sentence 4: She also added a blessing for the animals to the family table prayer.

input: Title: The Newscaster. Sentence 1: An anchor man worked at a local news program. Sentence 2: The anchor man lied on air about military service. Sentence 3: The news organization was really upset with him. Sentence 4: The viewing audience was also upset with the anchor man.
target: The news organization had no choice but to fire the anchor man.

input: Title: Randy and his Grandfather. Sentence 1: Randy was upset to hear that his grandfather was very sick. Sentence 2: He went with his parents to visit his grandpa in the hospital. Sentence 3: His grandpa was so happy to see Randy, despite feeling poorly. Sentence 4: A few days later, Randy's grandpa passed away.
target: Randy was very sad, but happy he had seen his grandpa one last time.

input: Title: Pen. Sentence 1: Andrew was in class and needed a pen. Sentence 2: He asked three kids for pens and they didn't have a extra pen. Sentence 3: He asked more kids and had no luck. Sentence 4: Finally he found a kid who had one.
target: Andrew was happy and wrote down notes with his borrowed pen.

input: Title: Martha's Vineyard. Sentence 1: Martha had always wanted to make wine. Sentence 2: Having retired from her day job, she planned to do so. Sentence 3: Martha purchased a small plot of land to grow grapes. Sentence 4: Soon, she had enough to begin experimenting.
target: Martha made some excellent homemade wine!

input: Title: Cheating is wrong. Sentence 1: There wasn't anyone smarter than Jason in my class. Sentence 2: Jason always knew the answer to everything. Sentence 3: I admired him for this. Sentence 4: When it came to tests, Jason never did as well.
target: It really hurt when I found out he had been googling all his answers.

input: Title: Martin gets a rare bird. Sentence 1: Martin is camping. Sentence 2: He wanders off from the campsite. Sentence 3: He is busy bird watching. Sentence 4: He spots a very rare bird.
target: He captures the bird and takes it home.

input: Title: Phillip. Sentence 1: Phillip took a trip to Boston. Sentence 2: He loved the time he spent there. Sentence 3: He went to see all the sights. Sentence 4: His favorite part was the car ride on the way.
target: All in all Phillip really loved going to Boston.

input: Title: David Ortiz Bat. Sentence 1: My ex coworker Ann recently ended an affair. Sentence 2: Her lover, Fred, was a married man who dumped her when discovered. Sentence 3: The man asked Ann to be discrete on FB. Sentence 4: Enraged, Ann posted a photo of a David Ortiz bat she gave him.
target: Fred's wife saw the post and was infuriated.

input: Title: Small but efficient. Sentence 1: Josiah liked playing baseball. Sentence 2: But he was so small, he was always chosen last. Sentence 3: He endeavored to prove to his team that he was a good player. Sentence 4: So the next time he was up to the bat, he hit a homerun.
target: Everyone clapped and they finally saw how good he was.

input: Title: arson. Sentence 1: John was a pyromaniac. Sentence 2: He burned many things from garbage to trees. Sentence 3: This time, he decided to try burning a house. Sentence 4: John was caught for burning a house.

input: Title: Sushi. Sentence 1: I had dinner alone on Monday. Sentence 2: My wife went to a baseball game. Sentence 3: I ordered sushi for delivery. Sentence 4: The sushi was very fresh, but the order was small.
target: I heated up a piece of leftover pizza.

input: Title: Lottery. Sentence 1: William went to the store to buy a lottery ticket. Sentence 2: He perused through all the options but couldn't chose. Sentence 3: A woman close to him told him he should buy a gold looking one. Sentence 4: William followed her lead and bought the ticket.
target: When he scratched it, he won ten dollars and bought more tickets.

input: Title: fabric. Sentence 1: The woman cut the fabric. Sentence 2: She made it too small for her pattern. Sentence 3: She found another pattern. Sentence 4: The fabric was big enough for that.
target: She cut the fabric for the new pattern.

target: Ken went home disheartened to have lost his dream.

input: Title: Brown Out. Sentence 1: There was a large thunderstorm outside. Sentence 2: The house experienced a brown out. Sentence 3: My family and I had to conserve electricity. Sentence 4: This consisted of using firewood to cook food and reusing water.

input: Title: Online Work. Sentence 1: Phil thought he should try to make money through online freelancing. Sentence 2: He made an account on a freelance platform. Sentence 3: He responded to a query looking for a web developer. Sentence 4: Phil completed the task as requested.
target: The company told the platform that Phil failed, so they didn't pay.

input: Title: The Amish Family. Sentence 1: A family moved to town. Sentence 2: They were Amish! Sentence 3: The other residents weren't sure what to talk to them about. Sentence 4: The Amish were polite but kept to themselves.
target: The two groups ever mingled.

input: Title: Clean. Sentence 1: Anna had a sweater that was supposed to be dry cleaned. Sentence 2: She was hesitant to dry clean it. Sentence 3: She thought it would be expensive. Sentence 4: But when she called for prices, she was surprised.
target: The dry cleaning fees were much lower than she'd thought!

input: Title: Lizard. Sentence 1: Tom wanted a pet. Sentence 2: Tom knew a dog or cat would be too much of a liability. Sentence 3: Tom went to the pet store. Sentence 4: Tom found a lizard he liked.
target: Tom bought the lizard.

input: Title: The Brush. Sentence 1: Kim had messy hair. Sentence 2: She tried to brush it but she didn't do a good job. Sentence 3: Her mother scolded her and brushed it herself. Sentence 4: Kim screamed and cried.
target: Kim's hair was always a source of tension for them.

input: Title: World Event. Sentence 1: The United States entered World War II. Sentence 2: Industry began to grow. Sentence 3: People went off to war. Sentence 4: The war went for a while.
target: The Allied forces won.

input: Title: Dentist Visit. Sentence 1: Anthony had a sore tooth. Sentence 2: He went to the dentist. Sentence 3: The dentist took an X-ray of the tooth. Sentence 4: The dentist filled the cavity in the tooth.
target: Anthony felt better after the dentist appointment.

input: Title: Unusual Friends.. Sentence 1: Jerry has a mouse. Sentence 2: His wife wants to get a cat. Sentence 3: Jerry said no. Sentence 4: His wife got a cat behind his back.
target: The cat and mouse are best friends.

input: Title: Bird. Sentence 1: Anna's cat caught a bird one day. Sentence 2: The cat injured the bird's wind pretty badly. Sentence 3: Then Anna's mom brought the bird inside. Sentence 4: Together, the two bandaged its wings and tail.

input: Title: Loose Change. Sentence 1: Tom was hungry. Sentence 2: He didn't want to cook. Sentence 3: He scrounged up some change around his apartment. Sentence 4: Tom was able to get some fast food.
target: It wasn't much but it filled him up.

input: Title: Jareds Journey. Sentence 1: Jared was an overweight man. Sentence 2: He decided to lose weight. Sentence 3: He dieted eating only subway sandwiches. Sentence 4: Jared lost a lot of weight.
target: Jared became the spokesperson for Subway.

input: Title: The Butter. Sentence 1: Jennifer was baking cookies. Sentence 2: She forgot to let the butter soften. Sentence 3: She tried to mix the dough, but it was too hard. Sentence 4: She tried to microwave it to soften it, but that melted it.
target: Jennifer's cookies were a mess!

input: Title: Sandals. Sentence 1: Joe was going to the beach. Sentence 2: As he was getting ready he saw that his dog chewed up his sandals. Sentence 3: Joe was angry. Sentence 4: Joe got ready and went to the store to get sandals.
target: Joe went to the beach and had a good time.

input: Title: Coral Mistake. Sentence 1: Abby recently went diving in Jamaica. Sentence 2: As Abby was diving, she grabbed a piece of coral. Sentence 3: The instructor immediately scolded Abby for her error. Sentence 4: Abby did not know she could not break off the coral.

input: Title: Late to Class. Sentence 1: It was Sam's first day at college. Sentence 2: He messed up his alarm and woke up late. Sentence 3: He tried to get to class as fast as possible. Sentence 4: Once there he didn't understand anything being said.
target: It turned out he went to the wrong class.

input: Title: Lisp. Sentence 1: Tom was a high school student. Sentence 2: Jesse was the new kid and Tom befriended him. Sentence 3: Most students made insulting jokes towards Jesse because of his lisp. Sentence 4: Tom respected Jesse and never insulted Jesse.

input: Title: The Sofa. Sentence 1: The family bought new furniture. Sentence 2: When their sofa arrived, it wouldn't fit! Sentence 3: They pushed and pushed but it wouldn't budge. Sentence 4: They had to send it back to the store.
target: The family sat on boxes that night.

input: Title: Jim breaks down. Sentence 1: Jim was driving down the road. Sentence 2: His car was getting hot. Sentence 3: He pulled over to see what was wrong. Sentence 4: He looked under the hood and the engine was blown.
target: He called for help and waited.

input: Title: Styrofoam. Sentence 1: Shelly's aunt had sent her a nice package. Sentence 2: Inside the box was a ton of packing styrofoam. Sentence 3: When Shelly wasn't looking her children dug into the box. Sentence 4: Soon there were bits of styrofoam all over the place.
target: It took Shelly weeks to clean and still little pieces were left.

input: Title: Bad Partner. Sentence 1: The cop was on a case. Sentence 2: He needed help from his partner. Sentence 3: His partner was not smart. Sentence 4: His partner accidentally got it wrong.
target: The partner ruined the cops case.

target: It was a great time with great friends.

input: Title: Dock. Sentence 1: Betty loved to go to the dock. Sentence 2: She loved the aroma of the wilderness. Sentence 3: One day, she decided she would go to another dock. Sentence 4: She traveled over 50 miles.
target: Finally, Betty arrived at the bigger dock and had a lot of fun.

input: Title: The woods. Sentence 1: Andrew didn't like being in the woods. Sentence 2: It was dark and they were scary. Sentence 3: He went through them anyway. Sentence 4: He jumped suddenly.

input: Title: Favorite Letter. Sentence 1: Our two year old granddaughter is learning how to read. Sentence 2: She loves the letter W. Sentence 3: She wants the Sesame Street letter of the day to be W. Sentence 4: One day the letter of the day was not W.

input: Title: Fright of Flight. Sentence 1: Lisa had never flown. Sentence 2: She was always afraid to fly because her uncle died on a plane. Sentence 3: One year her family was taking a trip to Germany. Sentence 4: She was reluctant to take the trip, but her family made her feel safe.
target: Since her trip to Germany, Lisa has flown to over a dozen new places!

input: Title: Bartender Robbie. Sentence 1: Robbie was the new bartender at the club. Sentence 2: One night he over served a customer. Sentence 3: The customer became intoxicated. Sentence 4: He started a fight and hurt another customer.
target: Robbie got fired because of his carelessness.

input: Title: Too sweet. Sentence 1: Allie wanted to get some candy. Sentence 2: But she was not sure if it would be too sweet. Sentence 3: So she took a bite. Sentence 4: It was far too sweet.

input: Title: Fireworks. Sentence 1: Tom was looking forward to the fourth of July holiday. Sentence 2: Tom bought fireworks to prepare. Sentence 3: Tom set them off during the holiday celebration. Sentence 4: Tom had fun setting off the fireworks.
target: Tom enjoyed the sights of the pretty lights.

input: Title: Evicted. Sentence 1: Tiana and Brandon lived together for two years. Sentence 2: They fought a lot and it disrupted their neighbors. Sentence 3: Their neighbors grew tired of the fights and filed complaints. Sentence 4: The landlord would get a complaint every day for 6 months.
target: The landlord got tired of it and evicted Tiana and Brandon.

input: Title: Lunch Tv Break. Sentence 1: The ladies in the break room only ever watched the Soaps. Sentence 2: But today all the TV's were on the news. target: The news was the only thing on television that mattered.

input: Title: A big pebble. Sentence 1: Joy and her brother were riding their bikes down the street. Sentence 2: All of a sudden Joy's bike toppled over. Sentence 3: She was scraped up but not hurt badly. Sentence 4: Her brother looked around the street to see what the bike had hit.
target: He found a big pebble that must have caused her fall.

input: Title: Bad Coffee. Sentence 1: Tim loved Starbucks coffee. Sentence 2: A friend told him to try a local joint instead. Sentence 3: Tim went along and tried it out. Sentence 4: He wound up hating it and couldn't even finish.

input: Title: Giving In. Sentence 1: She begged for the toy for hours. Sentence 2: She wanted it very badly. Sentence 3: I knew she didn't have very many toys. Sentence 4: She was living a very poor life.
target: I bought her the toy for Christmas that year.

input: Title: Lost House. Sentence 1: Tom was late on his payments. Sentence 2: The bank was threatening to take their house. Sentence 3: He tried to work out different payment options. Sentence 4: Unfortunately he couldn't come up with it.
target: Tom's house was taken away.

input: Title: Game Night. Sentence 1: Our family loves game night. Sentence 2: The kids pick out the game to play. Sentence 3: Usually we will play for an hour or two. Sentence 4: After that it is time for bed.
target: The kids usually want to keep playing.

input: Title: Broken Phone Screen. Sentence 1: Tom's phone fell out of his pocket. Sentence 2: His screen shattered on the floor. Sentence 3: Tom couldn't afford to get a new phone. Sentence 4: He found a cheap replacement screen online.
target: He replaced it himself with a youtube video.

input: Title: Cake. Sentence 1: Trudy wanted some cake. Sentence 2: She bought mix at the store. Sentence 3: She mixed the ingredients. Sentence 4: She put it in the oven.
target: It came out just perfect!

input: Title: Caught. Sentence 1: Jan shivered involuntarily as she watched the spiders try to escape. Sentence 2: Then she heard something that made her even more frightened. Sentence 3: Her brothers raucous antics in the living room. Sentence 4: They were headed straight for their room and her.
target: Jan quickly shut herself into the closet and hid.

input: Title: Long Distance. Sentence 1: Tom had never done a long distance race. Sentence 2: He thought it would be good for his cardio. Sentence 3: He practiced and trained for a bit. Sentence 4: The day of the race Tom did surprisingly well.

target: He managed to get out in no time.

input: Title: Moped Fly. Sentence 1: After moving to a new city, Mike wanted to buy a moped. Sentence 2: He figured it would be more efficient than buying a car. Sentence 3: He looked around at a couple of shops. Sentence 4: He came across one that had everything he wanted.
target: He rode out of the store looking fly.

input: Title: Hard Work Pays Off. Sentence 1: Kelsey was feeling inspired. Sentence 2: She saw a coworker get a huge commission and Kelsey wanted it, too. Sentence 3: She worked hard to make a lot of sales. Sentence 4: When the quarter ended, Kelsey was the top seller.
target: She felt so proud to reach her goal.

input: Title: Knife Work. Sentence 1: A chef wanted to become skilled. Sentence 2: He went to culinary school. Sentence 3: He learned a lot of skills. Sentence 4: He had to pass a knife test.
target: He passed!

input: Title: Moses Went to Church. Sentence 1: Moses went to church in the morning. Sentence 2: He thought that the pastors sermon was boring. Sentence 3: He fell asleep during the sermon. Sentence 4: The pastor saw Moses sleeping.
target: The pastor asked Moses for his input on the sermon.

input: Title: The Odd Timer. Sentence 1: Several firemen visited a local elementary school. Sentence 2: They were there to teach the kids about fire safety. Sentence 3: One of the firemen set off a fire alarm. Sentence 4: He asked the children what the noise it made meant.

input: Title: The Humble Broom. Sentence 1: Felicia had a developmental problem. Sentence 2: She wasn't able to hold a real job. Sentence 3: When Felicia was out with her family she noticed a man sweeping. Sentence 4: She constantly made a sweeping motion at home after that encounter.
