input: Title: Perfect. Sentence 1: I searched everywhere for the perfect new purse. Sentence 2: I wanted something large that was still cute. Sentence 3: I ended up on the disney website. Sentence 4: I picked a big purse that would hold all my things.
target: I fell in love with it upon arrival.

input: Title: The twins. Sentence 1: Adrian and Abriel were twins. Sentence 2: They loved to do everything together. Sentence 3: They spent all afternoon playing board games. Sentence 4: After playing Candyland they both had ice-cream.
target: They both shared their favorite flavor.

input: Title: Listen on repeat. Sentence 1: I love listening to specific songs. Sentence 2: I usually go on youtube to listen to songs. Sentence 3: However, youtube doesn't have the ability to repeat the video. Sentence 4: I have to use a third party website to listen to songs on repeat.

input: Title: Izzy Lost Her Cat. Sentence 1: One afternoon Izzy realized her cat was nowhere to be found. Sentence 2: She called for her outside with no response. Sentence 3: She went door to door asking if someone saw her cat. Sentence 4: The cat was at the neighbor's all along!

input: Title: Julia's Cookies. Sentence 1: Julia was baking cookies. Sentence 2: She was adding things to the mixer. Sentence 3: An egg slipped and the whole thing fell into the mixing bowl. Sentence 4: It made bits of egg shell mix in with the batter.

input: Title: permission. Sentence 1: The boy asked for permission. Sentence 2: Permission was denied. Sentence 3: The boy did it anyways. Sentence 4: He got caught.
target: The boy was punished.

input: Title: bikes. Sentence 1: My neighbor got a new bike. Sentence 2: I wanted to get a new bike too so we could ride together. Sentence 3: We went to the store to get a new bike. Sentence 4: I picked a blue mountain bike.

input: Title: Lost cat. Sentence 1: Toni had a cat. Sentence 2: She loved the cat. Sentence 3: One day it got caught in the tree. Sentence 4: Toni got mad.
target: She looked for it and tried to get it.

input: Title: Accident. Sentence 1: John was going to cross the street. Sentence 2: The traffic light was green. Sentence 3: He stepped on the road. Sentence 4: Suddenly a car appeared.

input: Title: Making my bed.. Sentence 1: I recently vowed to make my bed every day. Sentence 2: This morning I arose from my bed upon awakening. Sentence 3: I was about to leave the room when I remembered my recent decision. Sentence 4: I decided to make my bed before leaving the bedroom.

input: Title: Pokemon. Sentence 1: Denise loved playing Pokemon Go. Sentence 2: She decided to take a walk so she could play. Sentence 3: While she was crossing the street, Denise saw a pokemon on her screen. Sentence 4: Denise was almost hit by a car as she walked into traffic.

input: Title: One More Notch. Sentence 1: Luger put on his belt. Sentence 2: It was too tight. Sentence 3: He took off the belt. Sentence 4: He poked a new hole in the belt.
target: He tried the belt again.

input: Title: Doctor. Sentence 1: Boris wasn't feeling well. Sentence 2: He had a sore throat all week. Sentence 3: Finally, Boris caved and visited the doctor. Sentence 4: The doctor said he had strep throat and prescribed antibiotics.

input: Title: Filling out Paperwork. Sentence 1: Sam worked at an office. Sentence 2: He had been slacking off as of late. Sentence 3: A lot of paperwork started to pile up. Sentence 4: Sam wasn't able to catch up.

input: Title: Painful. Sentence 1: I fell and hurt my back. Sentence 2: Now it's difficult to walk. Sentence 3: Sitting in this chair is getting painful. Sentence 4: I want to go back to bed, but I won't.

input: Title: The Prom. Sentence 1: Tina was invited to the prom. Sentence 2: She did not know how to dance. Sentence 3: Her father told her he would teach her. Sentence 4: They practiced every night.

target: After his first new paycheck he bought a Mercedes.

input: Title: Laser Tag. Sentence 1: I went to play laser tag. Sentence 2: If you got hit you had to return to base. Sentence 3: You had to recharge your ammo. Sentence 4: It was hard to hit people.

input: Title: Terrible Game. Sentence 1: Tom was excited for a new videogame. Sentence 2: The previews made it seem awesome. Sentence 3: He pre-ordered it and got it at midnight. Sentence 4: The game turned out to be a huge disappointment.

target: Therefore I was too full for my meal.

input: Title: Ripped picture. Sentence 1: Kelley needed to find a picture. Sentence 2: She needed one from her old holidays. Sentence 3: She couldn't find it. Sentence 4: Finally she found it under her bed.

input: Title: Greg 2. Sentence 1: After the movie, we stopped at a restaurant. Sentence 2: It was a buffet place. Sentence 3: Greg filled his plate 3 times and kept going. Sentence 4: Afterward, he wanted to stop for ice cream.

input: Title: Rush. Sentence 1: Ivan had a simple math test. Sentence 2: So he thought he could do every problem as quickly as possible. Sentence 3: He finished in a few minutes and confidently turned in his test. Sentence 4: And he was in a good mood the whole day.
target: But when he got his test score back, he was devastated.

input: Title: Lobster Dinner. Sentence 1: Robert had never tasted lobster. Sentence 2: His girlfriend decided to take him out. Sentence 3: She took him to a fancy seafood restaurant. Sentence 4: Robert finally got to taste lobster.
target: He really liked it and wanted to get more soon.

input: Title: Tom and Gina go hiking. Sentence 1: Tom and Gina spent most Sundays in the fall hiking. Sentence 2: This weekend they packed food and headed out. Sentence 3: They were checking out new trails an hour up north. Sentence 4: They hiked a five mile lake trail before lunch.
target: After 6 hours of hiking, they headed home.

input: Title: The Cat's Toy. Sentence 1: The cat walked into the hall. Sentence 2: It's ball was in the hall. Sentence 3: The cat swatted the ball down the hall. Sentence 4: The cat kept chasing the ball.
target: The cat never got bored of the ball.

input: Title: The Store. Sentence 1: Linda needed to go shopping. Sentence 2: She went to the grocery store but forgot her list. Sentence 3: She grabbed random things and threw them in the cart. Sentence 4: When she got home, she wasn't sure what to cook.
target: She had bought an assortment of junk.

input: Title: Hospital visits. Sentence 1: Tommy got the phone call that no one ever wants to get. Sentence 2: He was told that his father was involved in a serious car accident. Sentence 3: Tommy rushed to the hospital to see how his father was doing. Sentence 4: The doctor told Tommy that the emergency surgery was successful.
target: Tommy visited his dad every day for a week before taking him home.

input: Title: Heel. Sentence 1: Kate and her friends were in line outside a club in Las Vegas. Sentence 2: They waited close to an hour. Sentence 3: They were finally able to go inside. Sentence 4: And Kate stepped on a step and broke her heel.
target: Her night was already ruined.

input: Title: Art. Sentence 1: Tom went with his girlfriend to an art gallery showing. Sentence 2: Tom had never really thought about art before. Sentence 3: During the showing, Tom noticed a piece he really liked. Sentence 4: Tom inquired about the price of the piece.
target: Tom bought the piece of art from the gallery!

input: Title: New Job. Sentence 1: Tom got a new job. Sentence 2: He was about to quit his old one. Sentence 3: Instead they let him go. Sentence 4: Tom was able to get a severance package.
target: It made his transition much easier.

input: Title: Shape. Sentence 1: The teacher drew a shape. Sentence 2: She asked for it's name. Sentence 3: The boy said square. Sentence 4: The teacher corrected the boy.
target: It was a triangle.

input: Title: Prom Date. Sentence 1: Nina was going to the prom with Marty. Sentence 2: They had been dating for a year. Sentence 3: Marty broke up with Nina two weeks before the prom. Sentence 4: Nina still wanted to go the prom.
target: She went to the prom alone.

input: Title: Donate. Sentence 1: Sara had so many old clothes. Sentence 2: But she hated to throw things away. Sentence 3: Then she had a good idea. Sentence 4: She decided to donate them to a women's shelter.
target: That way, she knew they'd go to good use.

input: Title: The Barking Thing. Sentence 1: A Tim got out of the car he heard a dog barking. Sentence 2: He looked under the car, and found nothing. Sentence 3: He looked behind a tree and around a big box. Sentence 4: There was nothing there, but he still heard barking.
target: Finally he looked at the window of a house, and saw a barking parrot.

input: Title: Summer Heat. Sentence 1: Jennifer didn't like the summertime heat. Sentence 2: It seemed to get hotter every day! Sentence 3: Each day, she tried to devise a new way to stay cool. Sentence 4: Today she and her friends went swimming.
target: They felt like they could stay there forever.

input: Title: Ruined garden. Sentence 1: Last summer I started a garden. Sentence 2: I started it in my backyard. Sentence 3: It was rather beautiful. Sentence 4: The only  problem is that it was ruined by the animals.
target: I realized not to have a garden again.

input: Title: Shipping. Sentence 1: Today I sold a book on Amazon. Sentence 2: The site usually lets me declare a small package. Sentence 3: This time I had to write down the package measurements. Sentence 4: I had to find a ruler.
target: I hope this is not a new procedure.

input: Title: Soccer. Sentence 1: I used to be goalie for the soccer team. Sentence 2: One day I broke my shoulder and couldn't play anymore. Sentence 3: I was very sad that happened to me. Sentence 4: After a couple of months my shoulder got a lot better.
target: The doctor told me I could play again.

input: Title: Powerful speech. Sentence 1: Luis went to see a speech. Sentence 2: He was very moved. Sentence 3: Luis loved it so much he teared up. Sentence 4: He made sure to talk about it later.
target: He wanted to meet her.

input: Title: Jesse's date. Sentence 1: Jesse was excited because she was going on a date with a handsome man. Sentence 2: The man had approached her at work and asked her out. Sentence 3: Jesse didn't know he was a serial killer because he was handsome. Sentence 4: After dinner, the man drove her home.
target: Jesse really wasn't his type.

input: Title: Spring Break. Sentence 1: John and his family went to London for Spring Break. Sentence 2: They visited many historical landmarks like the Tower of London. Sentence 3: His daughter got her ears pierced at Harrod's. Sentence 4: They dined at restaurants all over the city.
target: Amazingly, the kids' favorite part was passing J K Rowling's car.

input: Title: The Sleepy Dog. Sentence 1: The dog laid down beside her, yawning. Sentence 2: He was obviously tired from playing all day. Sentence 3: He curled up in a ball so he could sleep. Sentence 4: He flopped onto his back after a while.
target: He just laid there, waiting for a tummy rub.

input: Title: Huge Mess. Sentence 1: Tom got a new puppy. Sentence 2: It was still not housebroken. Sentence 3: Tom needed to leave it alone for a while. Sentence 4: The dog went crazy all over the house.
target: Tom spent all night cleaning up after it.

input: Title: Roller Skating Adventure. Sentence 1: Barry recently was invited to go roller skating with friends. Sentence 2: Barry accepted the invitation and grab his skates. Sentence 3: Barry was enjoying roller skating, when he fell hard. Sentence 4: Barry was so scared, because he broke his leg.
target: Barry was sad embarrassed that he broke his leg skating.

input: Title: The Vending Machine. Sentence 1: Jack was furious. Sentence 2: He had just put his buck in  the vending machine. Sentence 3: When he pressed the button, his crackers got stuck. Sentence 4: He charged the vending machine.
target: The machine rocked back and forth then kicked out his crackers.

input: Title: Bubble bath. Sentence 1: Samantha came from work exhausted. Sentence 2: The first thing she did was to draw herself a bubble bath. Sentence 3: While the water was filling the bath, she prepared her clothes. Sentence 4: She put her slippers on.
target: And when she went in the bathroom, her dog was in the bath.

input: Title: New friends. Sentence 1: Stacy moved to a new neighborhood. Sentence 2: She had to go to a new school. Sentence 3: She was afraid she wouldn't make friends. Sentence 4: Luckily she did.
target: She kept them for a long time.

input: Title: Doris finds a man. Sentence 1: Doris was depressed because her younger sister was getting married. Sentence 2: Doris had never even dated anyone. Sentence 3: The day after her sister's wedding, Doris got an email from a guy. Sentence 4: He had found her on EHarmony.
target: They were a perfect match and just a year later they were married.

input: Title: Stalker. Sentence 1: GinaMarie met Nick the first week of July in 2013. Sentence 2: After just 2 months of dating GinaMarie told Nick that she loved him. Sentence 3: Nick felt very uncomfortable by this and broke up with her. Sentence 4: But GinaMarie wouldn't accept it and she began to stalk him.
target: Nick was scared and tried to press stalking charges against her.

input: Title: New Shoes. Sentence 1: Paul wore his expensive, new basketball shoes to school. Sentence 2: And he was glad it gave him lots of attention. Sentence 3: During basketball, however, someone stepped on his shoe. Sentence 4: And there was a black mark left on Paul's shoe.
target: But Paul remembered the shoes were for basketball after all.

input: Title: tour bus. Sentence 1: David went on a tour to see the countryside. Sentence 2: The bus broke down. Sentence 3: David was saddened. Sentence 4: Due to time constraint, he either can go home or keep touring.
target: David chose to go home.

input: Title: Wrong Drink. Sentence 1: Mona was eating at a fast food restaurant. Sentence 2: She had gotten a soda. Sentence 3: Mona wasn't paying attention as she poured her drink. Sentence 4: She mistakenly poured a drink she didn't want.
target: Mona gagged as she took a sip of her drink.

input: Title: New sweatshirt. Sentence 1: Yolanda wanted a new sweatshirt. Sentence 2: She begged her mom for one. Sentence 3: Her mom said no. Sentence 4: Yolanda then went and bought it herself.
target: It felt good to buy it with her own money.

input: Title: Saving A Rat. Sentence 1: Bill and Shirley observed a rat running across their kitchen floor. Sentence 2: Bill wanted to kill the rat. Sentence 3: Shirley wanted to save the rat's life. Sentence 4: She borrowed a no kill trap from a neighbor.
target: Shirley caught the rat and released it in a local meadow.

input: Title: Swimming Lessons. Sentence 1: Tim was terrified of swimming. Sentence 2: His parents desperately wanted him to learn to swim. Sentence 3: Tim's parents signed him up for swimming lessons at the local pool. Sentence 4: At first, Tim was too scared to get into the pool.
target: After a month, Tim was swimming on his own and started to enjoy it!

input: Title: Lizzie wants to sing. Sentence 1: Lizzie always dreamed of being a singer. Sentence 2: She would dance and sing in the mirror to herself. Sentence 3: A local talent show was coming up in her town. Sentence 4: She decided to face her fears and give it a shot.
target: Lizzie took the stage and blew the crowd away!

input: Title: Dance. Sentence 1: Janet was concerned about her upcoming prom. Sentence 2: Her prom was on Friday. Sentence 3: She came to school Wednesday concerned about not having a date. Sentence 4: Fortunately Ben also did not have a date.
target: So Ben asked Janet to prom and both of their problems were solved.

input: Title: The Office Chair. Sentence 1: Marge's back hurt. Sentence 2: SHe needed a new office chair. Sentence 3: She went to the office supply store to find one. Sentence 4: They were all too rigid.
target: Marge decided to keep looking.

input: Title: Interior Design. Sentence 1: Wesley didn't want to hire someone to decorate his home. Sentence 2: He thought he could save money and do it himself. Sentence 3: He figured while his wife was out of town he do it l. Sentence 4: He would convince her he hired someone else to do it.
target: His wife returned home furious after she saw how bad the house looks.

input: Title: Taco Tuesday. Sentence 1: Fetty has been in Italy for over a year. Sentence 2: He loves italian food, but lately has tired of it. Sentence 3: He misses the delicious mexican food he has back home, in California. Sentence 4: One day he goes to the grocery store and buys supplies for tacos.
target: All of his friends join him for Taco Tuesday.

input: Title: Confusing puzzle. Sentence 1: Peter was putting together a confusing puzzle the other day. Sentence 2: He tried really hard, but he couldn't figure it out. Sentence 3: He called over Mary to help him with it. Sentence 4: Mary is really good at puzzles.
target: Mary helped Peter put together the puzzle.

Sentence 3: As I spoke, I realized how detached I was from my story. Sentence 4: I began to connect more with my circumstances in life and my past.
target: When I finally told my testimony, I was able to truly connect.

input: Title: Inexpensive Headphones. Sentence 1: I wanted to buy new headphones. Sentence 2: But I didn't have much money. Sentence 3: I looked for as many headphone reviews as I could. Sentence 4: And I decided to buy Koss ksc75s.
target: I was impressed by how the $13 headphones sounded.

input: Title: Cheap Flowers. Sentence 1: Tom was putting gas. Sentence 2: He noticed they had dying towers for cheap. Sentence 3: Tom bought them and tried reviving them a bit. Sentence 4: He gave them to his girlfriend as a random gift.
target: She loved the sentiment.

input: Title: baseball. Sentence 1: Tom was the worst hitter in his baseball team. Sentence 2: Two men were on base, one in scoring position. Sentence 3: He had a two strikes and two balls. Sentence 4: The pitcher prepared to throw the ball.
target: Tom hit a homerun to win the game.

input: Title: No Tip. Sentence 1: Nick was a pizza delivery man. Sentence 2: One day, a customer didn't give him a tip for delivering food. Sentence 3: Nick got angry and yelled at the customer. Sentence 4: Afterwards, the customer called Nick's restaurant to complain.
target: The owner fired Nick for mistreating a customer like that.

input: Title: Bird watching. Sentence 1: Fred loved bird watching. Sentence 2: He ran up the mountains and got to it. Sentence 3: He saw a red canary. Sentence 4: He was amazed at his findings.
target: He couldn't wait to show his friends.

input: Title: Dead Rabbit. Sentence 1: Tim was out hunting. Sentence 2: He saw a rabbit nearby. Sentence 3: Tim decided to shoot it. Sentence 4: He hit it clean but it didn't die right away.
target: Tim had to snap its neck.

input: Title: Trent's New Guardian. Sentence 1: Trent's stepmother was very abusive. Sentence 2: One day, he ran away from home. Sentence 3: He made it fifty miles away, to the town where his aunt lived. Sentence 4: He was nervous, as he'd not seen the woman since he was a toddler.
target: She took him in and filed a petition to get custody of the boy.

input: Title: Love It. Sentence 1: Kate had ordered vanilla bean cheesecake at a restaurant. Sentence 2: She didn't like vanilla usually. Sentence 3: But she took a risk. Sentence 4: It was delicious.
target: She loved it so much she ordered a second one to go.

input: Title: Wax Figures. Sentence 1: Ashley and Maria went to the Historical Museum. Sentence 2: They saw many wax figures while they were there. Sentence 3: They wanted to learn more about wax figures. Sentence 4: They heard about Madame Tussauds Wax Museum.
target: They planned a vacation to go see the famous museum of wax figures.

input: Title: A Woman's Dream. Sentence 1: Walter decided to cook for his wife. Sentence 2: He prepared beef stew. Sentence 3: The food was very tasty. Sentence 4: They ate together.
target: Then he made all dishes.

input: Title: The GYmnastics Meet. Sentence 1: Rachel was feeling lots of pressure. Sentence 2: She was at her gymnastics meet and was nervous about how she would do. Sentence 3: It was her turn to get on the mat. Sentence 4: She gave it her all, but it wasn't enough.
target: Rachel ended up in last place.

input: Title: Artsy. Sentence 1: Lars was watching this really artsy movie. Sentence 2: Outside of the theater, he met this girl wearing a beret. Sentence 3: He asked her what she thought about the movie. Sentence 4: She spouted a bunch of artsy smartsy gibberish.

input: Title: Cranberry Sauce. Sentence 1: Liz made cranberry sauce for her family's Thanksgiving dinner. Sentence 2: It was the first time she had contributed anything. Sentence 3: She was excited to see how much people would like it. Sentence 4: She watched her mother take a bite, but she made a face.
target: Liz realized she had forgotten the sugar so it was very sour.

input: Title: Too Much Sand. Sentence 1: Sandy went to the beach. Sentence 2: She was there for a few hours. Sentence 3: When she went home she got sand everywhere. Sentence 4: She decided to take a shower.
target: Sand got all over the bathtub when she did.

input: Title: The Urge of Money. Sentence 1: One day Michael really needed some cash. Sentence 2: He looked online for some nice jobs to do. Sentence 3: He decided to give MTurk a try. Sentence 4: He signed up and was accepted a few days later.
target: He began working on MTurk on the side.

input: Title: Hitting the curb. Sentence 1: My friend and I went to the big city to run some errands. Sentence 2: He always gives me trouble about my driving skills and I get nervous. Sentence 3: So I was running my mouth on the way home and hit a curb. Sentence 4: It cost over $1000 to fix!
target: My friend will never let me live it down.

input: Title: Lonely Child's Adventure. Sentence 1: Shy and friendless, Gail was tired of eating lunch alone at school. Sentence 2: One day she climbed over the schoolyard fence with her lunchbox. target: A sweet lunch with wild friends, it was worth getting yelled at later.

input: Title: Birthday Cake. Sentence 1: I accidentally burned my friend's birthday cake. Sentence 2: The party was today, and I didn't have time to cook another. Sentence 3: Panicking, I ran to the store and bought a cake. Sentence 4: When I got to the party, I told her I had made it.
target: Everyone was impressed, and they never found out I bought it.

input: Title: New Light Bulbs. Sentence 1: Jerry wanted to save on his energy bill. Sentence 2: He decided to replace his light bulbs. Sentence 3: There was a big sale on energy efficient ones. Sentence 4: Jerry got a lot for a great deal.
target: He replaced all the bulbs in his house.

input: Title: Christmas Sled. Sentence 1: Robbie had gotten a new sled for Christmas. Sentence 2: But in mid-March there still hadn't been any snow! Sentence 3: Finally as spring approached they got a snow storm. Sentence 4: It was the perfect type of snow for sledding.

input: Title: Night Out. Sentence 1: Nikki and her mom went out to eat at Nikki's favorite restaurant. Sentence 2: They got a table with a beautiful view by the window. Sentence 3: After they ordered they each enjoyed a drink. Sentence 4: An hour passed and the food still hadn't come.
target: They ended up getting their meals for free because the waiter forgot.

input: Title: Grocery Shopping. Sentence 1: Tim went shopping for some groceries. Sentence 2: His wife made him a list of things to get. Sentence 3: Tim covered everything on the list. Sentence 4: He got a few extra things for himself as well.
target: Tim's wife told him he did a good job.

input: Title: Extra Vacation Day. Sentence 1: Sal and his wife flew to Hawaii for vacation. Sentence 2: After their vacation they went back to the airport. Sentence 3: The airline had overbooked the flight. Sentence 4: They asked for volunteers to stay in Hawaii an extra day.
target: Sal and his wife were happy to volunteer!

input: Title: Dull Scissors. Sentence 1: Tim was trying to cut some paper. Sentence 2: The scissors kept getting stuck. Sentence 3: It kept messing up his paper. Sentence 4: Tim tried to sharpen them but it didn't work.

input: Title: Mystery Call. Sentence 1: Ana kept getting a call from a strange area code. Sentence 2: She Googled it and saw it was a telemarketer. Sentence 3: Since her name was on the Do Not Call list, this was illegal. Sentence 4: Ana called them back and informed them that she'd get a lawyer!

input: Title: Joe the Concierge. Sentence 1: We had a new concierge for the 3 to 11 pm shift. Sentence 2: Joe was quiet and looked tough. Sentence 3: He took a lot of breaks, and was not at his desk often. Sentence 4: He also did not like to record incoming deliveries.

input: Title: The Schutzhund Test. Sentence 1: Ben liked to compete with his dog in Schutzhund tests. Sentence 2: He had trained Nero, his Rottweiler, for over a year. Sentence 3: Today was Nero's first test. Sentence 4: Nero was startled at first but then enjoyed every minute of the test.

input: Title: Cleaned Out. Sentence 1: Michelle used a desk at the church. Sentence 2: She helped teach the students. Sentence 3: One day the pastor had her office cleaned out. Sentence 4: It was an accident.

input: Title: The Worst Team. Sentence 1: Tom loved his local basketball team. Sentence 2: Unfortunately they were not very good. Sentence 3: They lost most of their games. Sentence 4: Tom still supported them.
target: It made tickets a lot cheaper.

target: Tom got signed on with the New York Yankees!

input: Title: New Hairstyle. Sentence 1: Barry wanted to switch up his hairstyle. Sentence 2: Barry was tired of wearing his hair in cornrows. Sentence 3: Barry decided it was time to cut his cornrows off. Sentence 4: Barry was scared of the change, but decided to embrace it.
target: Barry was disappointed that he cut his hair off.

input: Title: Harry the Orphan. Sentence 1: Harry is a kid who grew up with no parents. Sentence 2: Harry always wanted to live in a real home. Sentence 3: He wandered day and night what it would be like to have a family. Sentence 4: One day he gets a call from social services.

input: Title: Christmas Lights. Sentence 1: The man strung up the Christmas Lights. Sentence 2: He turned them on. Sentence 3: They did not light up. Sentence 4: He checked each bulb.
target: He replaced the burnt out bulb.

input: Title: Filling up Water. Sentence 1: Georgia was watching TV when she noticed a storm roll in. Sentence 2: She became concerned when the rain poured for a very long time. Sentence 3: Before long the ravines around her yard were filling up. Sentence 4: Water began flooding her yard.
target: Luckily the damage was not too bad.

input: Title: Melanie. Sentence 1: Melanie picked me up to go to her house. Sentence 2: We planned to watch a movie. Sentence 3: We stopped at Burger King on the way. Sentence 4: She ordered a whopper and fries.
target: She ate them during the movie.

input: Title: Chivalry. Sentence 1: I was at a friend's house. Sentence 2: Her brother came over to yell at her for something. Sentence 3: I intervened. Sentence 4: He pushed me over before storming out.

input: Title: Coachella. Sentence 1: Sally and her friends went to Coachella one day. Sentence 2: First they had pizza for lunch. Sentence 3: Then they danced for a while. Sentence 4: At the end of the day, they went back to the hotel.
target: They went to sleep.

input: Title: The Campfire. Sentence 1: Tasha cut lots of wood. Sentence 2: She started a campfire with it. Sentence 3: She roasted marshmallows over the fire. Sentence 4: The fire was warm and cozy.
target: Tasha loved having a fire in her backyard!

input: Title: Smaller. Sentence 1: Since they we building a new house the Jones needed to pack. Sentence 2: They were downsizing and needed to go through their things. Sentence 3: They made piles for things they wanted to keep. Sentence 4: In other piles they kept things to sell and to donate.
target: They had a huge yard sale and what was left was donated to the needy.

target: He found the dog and returned him to his owner who was happy.

input: Title: Marie. Sentence 1: Nina told Colleen she found a tiny black kitten named Marie. Sentence 2: Marie was found shivering outside with a huge 150 pound dog. Sentence 3: Colleen remembered dreaming about a black cat the night before. Sentence 4: They both thought it was a sign.
target: So Colleen gave the orphan kitten Marie a loving home.

input: Title: Store. Sentence 1: One time While Jane was working a dog ran into the store. Sentence 2: The customers in the store were all very surprised. Sentence 3: They dog ran around the store while Jane and other employee chased it. Sentence 4: Finally Jane caught the dog and it was brought to the service desk.
target: The owner was found and took the dog out of the store.

input: Title: Chocolate. Sentence 1: My husband and i went for a walk in town. Sentence 2: We stopped by the chocolate shop. Sentence 3: He picked out a box of truffles for us. Sentence 4: We got home and he wanted to try them.
target: We tried three, but then we did not.

input: Title: Helping the old. Sentence 1: Yvonne took the car to go to her class. Sentence 2: She was pressed for time and hurried along the road. Sentence 3: When she saw an old lady crossing the street, she sighed. Sentence 4: The lady was going so slow, Yvonne got out of her car to help her.
target: When the lady was safely across the street, Yvonne drove away.

input: Title: Coil. Sentence 1: Smith once had a very big coil. Sentence 2: He owned the coil for over 20 years. Sentence 3: One day, he was unable to find it. Sentence 4: He searched everywhere and could not find it.
target: Finally, he found it in his room.

input: Title: The Radio Show. Sentence 1: Tina was listening to a radio show. Sentence 2: The dj made a comment on a recent news event. Sentence 3: Tina was offended by the comment. Sentence 4: Tina turned off the radio.
target: She quit listening to the radio show.

input: Title: News. Sentence 1: We sat down to watch the news with dinner. Sentence 2: We set up our individual table trays. Sentence 3: We turned on the local news. Sentence 4: We were disgusted with the content.

input: Title: The Video Game. Sentence 1: The kid got a new video game for his birthday. Sentence 2: It was a game where the players shot zombies. Sentence 3: His parents said it was too scary for him. Sentence 4: They took the game away before he could play.
target: The kid was so mad!

target: And he finally got on his feet, catching the wave!

input: Title: First gold medal. Sentence 1: Allie was a gymnast. Sentence 2: She was now in her first competition. Sentence 3: She was rather nervous. Sentence 4: But luckily she won gold.

target: Andrea was so grateful and loved the dress forever.

input: Title: Mango. Sentence 1: There were mangoes for sale at the store. Sentence 2: They were very expensive but I bought them anyway. Sentence 3: I cut into into one and it was black inside. Sentence 4: Since it was so expensive, I didn't want to waste it.
target: I ate it and ended up with a stomach ache.

input: Title: Hoop fiasco. Sentence 1: Trina had very large hoop earrings. Sentence 2: She wore them everyday. Sentence 3: Yesterday however her earring got caught in her shirt. Sentence 4: Her earlobe started to rip.
target: Trina then had to go to the hospital.

input: Title: Lunch with friends. Sentence 1: Amy and Nora went to the new Mexican place for lunch. Sentence 2: They both ordered giant Margaritas and chips and salsa. Sentence 3: Amy enjoyed a burrito and Nora had delicious fish tacos. Sentence 4: While they were eating, a mariachi band came to their table.

input: Title: The Dancer. Sentence 1: Jenna loved music and dancing. Sentence 2: She was a dancer with a local ballet company. Sentence 3: She trained for her performances very seriously. Sentence 4: Jenna did so well at her last performance that she was promoted.
target: She became a principal dancer.

input: Title: The car. Sentence 1: Peters car was being stubborn. Sentence 2: It did not want to start. Sentence 3: Peter could not think of a reason why. Sentence 4: Peter looked at the dash board and was annoyed.
target: The car was out of gas.

input: Title: Broken Bones. Sentence 1: Carl was riding his dirt bike. Sentence 2: He tried to make a jump. Sentence 3: He crashed and hit the ground hard. Sentence 4: Carl broke his leg in two places.
target: He had to get medical help.

input: Title: The Giant Fly. Sentence 1: A fly was buzzing around the house. Sentence 2: Chris kept trying to swat it. Sentence 3: He kept missing! Sentence 4: He gave up and tried to sleep.
target: The fly landed on him in his bed!

input: Title: New Homes. Sentence 1: Jenny owns an animal rescue. Sentence 2: After the flooding in Louisiana she went down to help. Sentence 3: She found that there were a ton of animals needing new homes. Sentence 4: She took as many as she could back to her shelter.
target: It took a little time but she eventually found them all new homes.

input: Title: I hate rain.. Sentence 1: I cannot stand rain at all. Sentence 2: It makes my hair wet and my hands wet. Sentence 3: I don't want to touch anything at all. Sentence 4: As soon as I get home I always go to the bathroom to dry off.
target: Rain ruins any plans to go outside and play.

input: Title: Delivery. Sentence 1: Matt was working from home and became hungry. Sentence 2: Matt decided to order delivery. Sentence 3: Matt browsed the various restaurants menus. Sentence 4: He ordered from a new restaurant.
target: The food was delivered and he enjoyed the meal.

input: Title: The rocky ride.. Sentence 1: Judith was scared to go on her first plane trip to Hawaii. Sentence 2: She always wanted to go to Hawaii but never on a plane trip. Sentence 3: She got on and thought the trip wasn't to bad when the plane took off. Sentence 4: However, the whole trip was plagued with turbulence and noise.
target: When the trip was over Judith thought she was lucky to be alive.

input: Title: The sick man. Sentence 1: Everyone inside the subway was scared to be near the coughing man. Sentence 2: He was coughing repeatedly and the people around him were scared. Sentence 3: He kept assuring everyone they were just allergies and to not fret. Sentence 4: He starting coughing up blood and the crowd really got scared.
target: The sick man collapsed and died on the spot, it was anthrax.

input: Title: The teacher. Sentence 1: Frank was a good teacher. Sentence 2: But a student was really getting on his nerves. Sentence 3: The student kept talking well Frank was teaching his lesson. Sentence 4: Frank finally had enough and kicked the student out.
target: Frank continued to teach.

input: Title: Heat Wave. Sentence 1: Boston had a heat wave recently. Sentence 2: It was hot and humid for a week. Sentence 3: To stay cool, I read two books with cold weather settings. Sentence 4: I read Smilla's Sense of Snow and a novel about wolves in Alaska.
target: The books were fun but it still was too hot.

input: Title: Big Sister. Sentence 1: Anna's little sister Lulu was going trick or treating with friends. Sentence 2: Anna had plans to go to a party with her own friends. Sentence 3: But then Lulu's friends canceled and Anna had to make a choice. Sentence 4: She sighed and decided to do the right thing.
target: She took Lulu trick or treating herself and didn't go to the party.

input: Title: Hot Coffee. Sentence 1: Eric made himself a big cup of coffee in the morning. Sentence 2: As he took a sip, the coffee spilled all over his arm. Sentence 3: The scalding hot coffee seriously burned his arm. Sentence 4: Eric rushed himself to the hospital.
target: He was released later that day after getting treatment for his burns.

input: Title: Matter of the Heart. Sentence 1: She sat down to think. Sentence 2: She ate a bowl of ice cream while she did. Sentence 3: She contemplated leaving or staying. Sentence 4: She wanted to work things out.
target: She knew in the end, she was going to leave.

input: Title: bat. Sentence 1: The man swung a bat. Sentence 2: She missed the ball. Sentence 3: The man helped her practice swinging. Sentence 4: She got another chance at bat.
target: She hit a double into midfield.

input: Title: The Washer. Sentence 1: Kenya's washing machine was broken. Sentence 2: She had to wash everything by hand! Sentence 3: She went shopping for a new one, but they were all so expensive! Sentence 4: She finally coughed up the money for the top of the line model.
target: Her clothes were soon cleaner than they'd ever been!

input: Title: Not a Cat. Sentence 1: Sue was walking home from school one day. Sentence 2: Along the sidewalk she found a kitten. Sentence 3: Soon the kittens angry mother came out from some bushes. Sentence 4: The angry cat turned and sprayed Sue in the face.
target: Later, Sue's mother told her that it was a skunk, not a cat.

input: Title: Dating. Sentence 1: Beth was a single lady. Sentence 2: She decided she wanted to meet new people. Sentence 3: She joined online dating. Sentence 4: She talked with many men.
target: She began a monogamous relationship with one.

input: Title: High Expectations. Sentence 1: Jamie challenged her friend Amy to a game of Horse. Sentence 2: Jamie thought that because she was taller, she would win! Sentence 3: Jamie and Amy began to play and Amy started winning. Sentence 4: Jamie was happy for her friend, but she learned a lesson.
target: Jamie and Amy played many games of Horse after that.

input: Title: Dreamscapes. Sentence 1: I had terrible nightmares last night. Sentence 2: I dreamed about being chased. Sentence 3: In my dream, I was burned by fire. Sentence 4: Somehow I survived the fire.
target: I woke up frightened and shaking.

input: Title: Firework Stand. Sentence 1: Adam loves fireworks. Sentence 2: His favorite times are those spent shooting off fireworks. Sentence 3: One day he noticed someone needed employees to sell them. Sentence 4: Excited at the prospect Adam got an interview and crossed his fingers.
target: Within a couple days Adam was offered the job of his life!

input: Title: movie. Sentence 1: The movie started. Sentence 2: People were still talking. Sentence 3: The man got angry. Sentence 4: He demanded silence.
target: The crowd got quiet.

input: Title: Wipers. Sentence 1: It was a rainy night and Kelly was driving home. Sentence 2: Suddenly one of her wipers stopped working. Sentence 3: She could hardly see! Sentence 4: She had to pull over and affix it back to the main arm.
target: Then she was able to see to drive home!

input: Title: Pregnancy Diabetes. Sentence 1: Sadie had just had her pregnancy glucose test done. Sentence 2: To her dismay she learned that she had diabetes. Sentence 3: At first she thought she could never adopt the lifestyle. Sentence 4: To her surprise though she managed it very well.
target: Luckily the diabetes went away when her baby was born.

input: Title: James needs glasses. Sentence 1: James wanted to be a pilot. Sentence 2: But when he was 10 he realized he was having trouble to read. Sentence 3: James went to see the doctor. Sentence 4: The doctor told him he needed glasses.
target: James was very sad because he wouldn't be able to be a pilot.

input: Title: The Swimming Lessons. Sentence 1: Angie went to the pool but she did not get into the water. Sentence 2: Angie did not know how to swim. Sentence 3: Her friend took her for swimming lessons. Sentence 4: Now Angie isn't afraid to get into the pool.
target: She is happy that her friend took her for swimming lessons.

input: Title: The Church. Sentence 1: Kyle was new in town. Sentence 2: He visited a local church. Sentence 3: THe pastor greeted him immediately. Sentence 4: He really like the music and the classes.
target: Kyle decided this would be his new church home.

input: Title: Lost Fishing. Sentence 1: Amber was fishing in the ocean one morning when a storm rolled in. Sentence 2: The crazy waters pulled her far out into the sea and capsized her. Sentence 3: She held onto a small raft for a few days. Sentence 4: Finally someone came to save her.
target: Luckily, they had spotted her colorful raft.

input: Title: The Wedges. Sentence 1: Sally loved cute shoes. Sentence 2: She bought a pair of great wedges. Sentence 3: She wore them that night to dinner. Sentence 4: As she walked, the strap broke.
target: The shoes were ruined!

input: Title: Opting Out. Sentence 1: My cousins originally planned to attend a movie. Sentence 2: Since I was free, I planned to go. Sentence 3: However, everyone cancelled their plans on the last day. Sentence 4: Although I was furious, I remained calm.
target: My friend invited me for dinner and we went there together.

input: Title: Deciding. Sentence 1: I accepted a batch of work. Sentence 2: I had to decide whether political statements were true or false. Sentence 3: I had a great deal of difficulty with my choices. Sentence 4: I eventually gave up out of fear of rejections.
target: I was worried I would lose my account if I was rejected.

input: Title: Late to Class. Sentence 1: I was running late to class again. Sentence 2: The teacher said if I was late he would lock me out. Sentence 3: I didn't believe he would actually do it. Sentence 4: When I got there, the door was locked.
target: He made me stand in the hall for 10 minutes before letting me in.

input: Title: Car. Sentence 1: Carlos old car was wrecked. Sentence 2: Carlos needed a car to go to work. Sentence 3: So he called his insurance. Sentence 4: They delivered a rental car to his place.
target: Carlos was glad to have insurance.

input: Title: Ill Fitting Suit. Sentence 1: Mark was going to his brother's wedding. Sentence 2: He needed a suit but he was broke. Sentence 3: He gathered what little money he did and shopped for a cheap suit. Sentence 4: Luckily he found one just in time, but it didn't fit well.
target: The bride hated it and had her mother, a seamstress, fix it.

input: Title: Hit Album. Sentence 1: Jane always wanted to be a musician. Sentence 2: She put out songs online and one got really popular. Sentence 3: Jane thought she had struck fame. Sentence 4: Unfortunately it got popular ironically.
target: Everyone made fun of it and she quit trying.

input: Title: The New TV Show. Sentence 1: Holly was bored of everything on TV. Sentence 2: She was considering giving up her cable subscription. Sentence 3: That was until she saw an ad for the newest show. Sentence 4: She watched the premier and she loved it as expected.
target: The new show was great enough to keep her buying.

input: Title: Swept away.. Sentence 1: Maude was a girl who did not obey her parents or safety rules. Sentence 2: While unsupervised on a seaside vacation she stole a small boat. Sentence 3: The boat was swept out to sea. Sentence 4: Her parents were unaware of her theft and couldn't find her.
target: The boat sank and nobody ever knew how she perished.

input: Title: Violin. Sentence 1: When I was a kid I wanted to be really good at playing violin. Sentence 2: I practiced all the time to be really good. Sentence 3: After a few months of practicing I did get really good. Sentence 4: I was so good that people wanted me to play for them.
target: I'm really glad that I practiced so hard.

input: Title: Candy Drive. Sentence 1: Cam was selling toffee candy for his school. Sentence 2: He had over twenty boxes that he had to sell. Sentence 3: While walking home from school, Cam decided to taste the toffee. Sentence 4: One candy led to another, and Cam ended up eating all the candy.
target: Cam's stomach ache made him regret doing such a foolish thing.

input: Title: Baby weight. Sentence 1: Nancy just had a baby. Sentence 2: She feels out of shape. Sentence 3: One day she started to exercise. Sentence 4: It was very difficult.
target: Nancy feels good about her decision to get in shape.

input: Title: Very sleepy. Sentence 1: I had to stay up really late last night. Sentence 2: I had a big test to study for the next day. Sentence 3: I did really well on the test but now I'm really tired. Sentence 4: I still have a whole lot to do today too.
target: I can't wait until I can go to sleep tonight.

input: Title: Baseball. Sentence 1: Joe called his friends too see if they want to play baseball. Sentence 2: His friends said they wanted too. Sentence 3: So Joe prepared his glove and other baseball equipment. Sentence 4: He met his friends at the park.
target: They played for several hours.

input: Title: The Carrots. Sentence 1: The kids planted carrots in their garden. Sentence 2: When it was time to harvest them, they dug them all up. Sentence 3: They were big and delicious! Sentence 4: They snacked on them every day.
target: They plan on planting even more next year!

input: Title: The hike. Sentence 1: Rita went on a hike in the woods. Sentence 2: She heard a rustling in a bush. Sentence 3: A squirrel ran out of the bush. Sentence 4: Rita watched the squirrel.
target: The squirrel climbed into a tree.

input: Title: Captain Jack. Sentence 1: Jack was a Captain of the ship and only just twenty five years old. Sentence 2: He was the envy of many men especially those older than him. Sentence 3: For they had to look up and take orders from a man they saw as less. Sentence 4: They were in for a rude awakening when he proved himself to them.
target: He managed to impress the people on the ship and gained their respect.

input: Title: The Stapler. Sentence 1: The stapler broke today. Sentence 2: I didn't know how to fix it. Sentence 3: I asked someone to fix it. Sentence 4: They put new staples in the stapler.
target: The stapler was fixed.

input: Title: Cancer. Sentence 1: My father was diagnosed with cancer. Sentence 2: We spent months taking care of him and driving him to treatment. Sentence 3: He seemed to be getting worse, so we admitted him to a hospital. Sentence 4: The hospital took more scans and tests of his cancerous area.
target: He was actually cured and released from the hospital cancer free!

input: Title: Getting a puppy. Sentence 1: When I was little, I really wanted a puppy. Sentence 2: I begged and begged my parents to get one. Sentence 3: One day, my dad made a regular trip to the store. Sentence 4: When he got back home, he brought in a small black puppy!
target: I thanked him over and over for the gift.

input: Title: Bath Time. Sentence 1: Julie never like bath time because she always has to wash her hair. Sentence 2: She would complain anytime it was her bath time. Sentence 3: Julie's mother would try and wash her hair quickly. Sentence 4: Julie decided to make a game of bath time by counting all the bubbles.
target: Once she got the hang of her new game bath time was no longer awful.

input: Title: Orange Hat. Sentence 1: Sherry really liked the boy who sat in front of her in class. Sentence 2: Sherry really wanted him to notice her. Sentence 3: One day Sherry wore a bright orange bucket hat to school. Sentence 4: The boy immediately turned around to talk to Sherry about her hat.
target: Sherry started wearing brighter colored clothing to school.

input: Title: Losing power. Sentence 1: Susy was home all alone. Sentence 2: She decided to watch tv to occupy herself. Sentence 3: But then the power went out. Sentence 4: Susy felt scared.
target: But then she realized she had her phone still to occupy her.

input: Title: The Drive In. Sentence 1: Clarence had never been to a drive in theater before. Sentence 2: There was only one left in his whole state. Sentence 3: He decided to go and check it out. Sentence 4: He pulled up in his car and began watching the movie.
target: Clarence had a great time at the drive in.

input: Title: Bad Seller. Sentence 1: Tom bought an item on ebay. Sentence 2: The seller never shipped it out. Sentence 3: Tom tried to contact him. Sentence 4: Unfortunately there was no response.
target: Tom had to dispute the claim through ebay.

input: Title: The Pool. Sentence 1: The kids loved to swim. Sentence 2: They went to the pool in town. Sentence 3: They threw their goggles on and went to jump in. Sentence 4: The life guard stopped them.
target: There was a problem with the chemicals and they pool was closed!

input: Title: A Total Waste of Time. Sentence 1: Sharon was trying to lose weight. Sentence 2: She started recording everything she ate. Sentence 3: She cut her calories and started exercising daily for 1-2 hours. Sentence 4: She avoided the scale for a month.
target: When she finally weighed herself, Sharon had gained 23 pounds.

input: Title: Gymnastics Tournament. Sentence 1: Sam was really into gymnastics. Sentence 2: His parents didn't support him. Sentence 3: He had a big tournament coming up. Sentence 4: His parents told him to do chores instead of practice.
target: Sam wound up not doing well at the tournament.

input: Title: Robert gets a ticket. Sentence 1: Robert is driving down the highway one day. Sentence 2: He is going well over the speed limit but doesn't notice. Sentence 3: The next thing you know there's a cop behind him. Sentence 4: Robert pulls over to the side of the road and waits.
target: The officer writes Robert a ticket and tells him to obey the law.

input: Title: Dale gets dumped. Sentence 1: Dale had  been going steady with his girlfriend for 2 weeks. Sentence 2: The two had a date planned for friday night. Sentence 3: At dinner the two were dining at a fancy restaurant. Sentence 4: Dale had to use the restroom and left his phone on the table.
target: His girlfriend went through his phone and decided to dump him  there.

input: Title: Cultural Spirit. Sentence 1: Ella felt strongly connected to her roots. Sentence 2: She went back home every summer. Sentence 3: She practiced native dances there. Sentence 4: She would perform them for others.
target: Everyone admired her.

input: Title: Landon's Lakehouse. Sentence 1: Landon's family has a lake house. Sentence 2: They spend many of their summers enjoy the lake. Sentence 3: After Landon and her siblings grew up, they spent less time there. Sentence 4: Her family decided it was not worth keeping without using it.
target: Landon's family sold the lakehouse.

input: Title: Stitches. Sentence 1: Frank fell while running. Sentence 2: He put a bandage on his leg. Sentence 3: But it bled through almost at once! Sentence 4: His mom took him to the hospital.
target: Frank ended up needing twenty-one stitches!

input: Title: Directing. Sentence 1: Martin was directing a movie. Sentence 2: It got delayed. Sentence 3: All of the actors to appear in the movie were anxious. Sentence 4: Martin finally scored funding and the movie continued on.
target: But the leading actor died before the movie could be completed.

input: Title: Scariest Pumpkin. Sentence 1: Joe and Bill had a contest as to who could carve the scariest pumpkin. Sentence 2: They were going to put both out on Halloween. Sentence 3: Trick or treaters would vote on them. Sentence 4: That night they both sat outside to take the votes.
target: They each got exactly twenty six so it was a tie.

input: Title: Gil's New Job. Sentence 1: Gil applied for a job at the bank. Sentence 2: Within a week he got a call for an interview. Sentence 3: Gil met with the president of the bank. Sentence 4: The president loved meeting with Gil.
target: Gil started working at the bank the next week.

input: Title: The Party. Sentence 1: Tom invited lots of people over. Sentence 2: He wanted to throw a party for his wife. Sentence 3: Everyone showed up and brought gifts. Sentence 4: His wife never showed up!
target: SHe had gotten a flat tire on her way home from work.

input: Title: Andy's Joke. Sentence 1: Andy heard a joke on the radio. Sentence 2: He thought it was funny. Sentence 3: Andy tried to tell the joke to Bob. Sentence 4: Bob misunderstood the joke.
target: He didn't laugh.

input: Title: Odometer Fraud. Sentence 1: Jill needed to buy a car. Sentence 2: She found a great deal on a car with only 21,000 miles. Sentence 3: She drove away very happy with her deal. Sentence 4: Later she learned the actual mileage was 121,000 miles.
target: She was unable to find the fraudster.

input: Title: Pete. Sentence 1: George had a dog named Pete. Sentence 2: Pete followed George everywhere. Sentence 3: Pete followed George to the beach. Sentence 4: George suffered a leg cramp in the water.
target: Pete saved George pulling him back to shore.

input: Title: Quitting. Sentence 1: Benjamin plays football. Sentence 2: He has been playing only for a few years. Sentence 3: His team has never won a game. Sentence 4: Benjamin wants to quit because they never win.
target: He has decided to finish the season and reevaluate next season.

input: Title: Reba gets robbed. Sentence 1: Reba is walking down the street. Sentence 2: She gets mugged. Sentence 3: Her purse is taken and her watch. Sentence 4: She tries running after them.
target: She cannot catch them and they get away.

input: Title: I Told You So. Sentence 1: Everyone told Carol that she shouldn't homeschool her children. Sentence 2: They said that she should send them to school like "normal" kids. Sentence 3: Carol didn't listen, though, and worked hard at teaching her brood. Sentence 4: They all won scholarships, have great jobs, and help many people.
target: Carol never said, "I told you so," she just gloated privately.

input: Title: Jumping Jacks. Sentence 1: Our PE coach made us do jumping jacks the other day. Sentence 2: While I was doing my jumping jacks, I fell down. Sentence 3: I fell really hard and hurt my ankle. Sentence 4: Now I can't do jumping jacks for a while.
target: I'll have to be more careful the next time I do jumping jacks.

input: Title: Dental Hygiene. Sentence 1: My teeth felt fuzzy. Sentence 2: I decided I needed to brush them. Sentence 3: Upon entering my bathroom I found my toothpaste and toothbrush. Sentence 4: I squirted a pea sized amount of toothpaste on the toothbrush.
target: I brushed my teeth.

input: Title: A honest customer. Sentence 1: Alice went shopping in the afternoon. Sentence 2: She wanted to buy a new curtains. Sentence 3: She bought some nice ones. Sentence 4: At home she found out the cashier gave her too much money back.
target: She went back to the store and gave him money back.

input: Title: The Pool. Sentence 1: Harold was hot and tired. Sentence 2: He decided a swim would perk him up. Sentence 3: He dove into the pool and felt relief. Sentence 4: He swam all evening.
target: He was cool and relaxed after that!

input: Title: Old Age Realisation. Sentence 1: Every day, the school children would play in the park. Sentence 2: Ruth lived opposite this park. Sentence 3: For years, she couldn't stand the noise they made after school. Sentence 4: After her husband passed away, she learned to love the noise.
target: She realised that she disliked the noise only because her husband did.

input: Title: Babysitting. Sentence 1: Two weeks ago my sister in law called up. Sentence 2: She was watching her ten and seven year old grandchildren. Sentence 3: They were misbehaving, and getting restless. Sentence 4: She brought them down to our apartment for distraction.
target: After watching tv for an hour, she took them home to their mother.

input: Title: Fun in the park. Sentence 1: Lisa was running through the park. Sentence 2: She loved playing with her dog. Sentence 3: They played catch. Sentence 4: At the end she went in the lake.
target: She loved to swim in it.

input: Title: Dennis the Quiz Kid. Sentence 1: Dennis was studying really hard for the upcoming quiz. Sentence 2: His teacher had made it clear that this test would dictate their grade. Sentence 3: He studied hard every day writing down tons of notes. Sentence 4: When he was taking the quiz he felt it was too easy for him.
target: He ended up passing with an A+.

input: Title: Secret recipe. Sentence 1: Last night I went to Laura's house. Sentence 2: We had some fried chicken. Sentence 3: It was amazing. Sentence 4: I asked her for the recipe.
target: She told me it was a secret.

input: Title: Garage Door. Sentence 1: The garage door on my new house wasn't automatic. Sentence 2: It was a hassle to open and close all the time. Sentence 3: You need to have a separate entry to install an electric garage door. Sentence 4: Our garage doesn't have one.
target: We still have to manually open and close the door all the time.

input: Title: Groceries. Sentence 1: Fred never used a shopping list. Sentence 2: Instead, he went to the store and bought whatever he felt like. Sentence 3: So he bought tons of groceries. Sentence 4: And he imagined lots of great food he could make.
target: But he only used half of the food he bought before it expired.

input: Title: Chinese Food. Sentence 1: We had our daughter and her family over last week. Sentence 2: They live in NYC while we live in Boston. Sentence 3: One night, we ordered Chinese food. Sentence 4: We ordered Mongolian beef, Chow Foon, and appetizers.
target: I was very stuffy that night.

input: Title: New kid on the block. Sentence 1: Elisa was moving to a new town. Sentence 2: As a result she was the new kid on the block. Sentence 3: Elisa was nervous about meeting new people. Sentence 4: Luckily some nice kids introduced themselves.
target: Elisa was then pretty happy she made some friends.

input: Title: College student. Sentence 1: Fatima graduated high school. Sentence 2: She decided to go to college. Sentence 3: Her grades were not good in high school. Sentence 4: She went to a community college and did well.
target: She transferred to a large university.

input: Title: The Mist. Sentence 1: I was driving in my city. Sentence 2: I couldn't see because of the mist. Sentence 3: It was hard to drive. Sentence 4: I had a plan.
target: I turned on the windshield wipers so I could finally see.

input: Title: License to Drive. Sentence 1: Joey's did not know his driver's license was due for renewal. Sentence 2: The license expired in March. Sentence 3: In July, Joey was pulled over for a burned out tail light. Sentence 4: The policeman wrote him a ticket for driving on an expired license.
target: In the following years, Joey always remembered to renew his license.

input: Title: The Dead Bug. Sentence 1: Paul saw something floating in his soup. Sentence 2: It was a disgusting dead bug! Sentence 3: Paul screamed and called for a waiter. Sentence 4: The waiter took the bowl away.
target: He apologized and paid for the meal.

input: Title: Babysitting. Sentence 1: Bonnie was babysitting for a new family. Sentence 2: They were paying $12 an hour which was double her normal rate. Sentence 3: She soon found out why. Sentence 4: The children were terribly behaved.
target: She vowed that she would not return for any amount of money.

input: Title: Break in the Storm. Sentence 1: Kate didn't want to go out in the rain. Sentence 2: She decided to stay home instead. Sentence 3: She hoped the rain would let up. Sentence 4: The rain suddenly stopped.
target: Just then the sun began to shine.

input: Title: The Fig Tree. Sentence 1: Jim wanted to grow figs. Sentence 2: He went to the nursery. Sentence 3: He bought a new fig plant. Sentence 4: He planted it.
target: It grew quickly!

input: Title: The Nanny. Sentence 1: Hannah loved kids. Sentence 2: She was hired as a nanny. Sentence 3: She cared for four children every day. Sentence 4: They loved spending time with Hannah.
target: The parents were thankful they'd found a great caretaker.

input: Title: Tour de France. Sentence 1: Mae wanted to win the Tour de France. Sentence 2: She practiced over many years to achieve her goal. Sentence 3: She did the whole tour by herself outside the competition. Sentence 4: As her time was better than any other cyclist, she had hope.
target: The next year she enrolled and won.

input: Title: Breakup. Sentence 1: Mary was tired of her relationship with her boyfriend Joe. Sentence 2: She decided to leave him for another man, Alex. Sentence 3: Unfortunately, Alex soon started being cruel to Mary. Sentence 4: Mary then asked John if they could get back together again.
target: John, however, told her that it was too late.

input: Title: Cold. Sentence 1: Emma caught a cold and sneezed throughout the day. Sentence 2: She didn't cover her mouth every time she coughed. Sentence 3: So she infected everyone she came in contact with. Sentence 4: At the end of the day, half of her office was feeling sick.
target: And most of them had to take a day off the next day.

input: Title: Dirty Car. Sentence 1: Julia's car was covered in dirt. Sentence 2: She waited until evening. Sentence 3: Then she took out a bucket and soap. Sentence 4: She cleaned the car from top to bottom.
target: Julia's car looks brand new.

input: Title: The Yoyo. Sentence 1: Dennis had a new toy. Sentence 2: It was a yoyo! Sentence 3: He wanted to learn how to do lots of trips. Sentence 4: He watched youtube videos on it for an hour.
target: He quickly learned how to do some really cool things!

input: Title: New Shoes. Sentence 1: Sam was walking down the road. Sentence 2: As she was walking down the sidewalk, her heel got stuck in the grate. Sentence 3: She was not able to pull it out. Sentence 4: She had to rip the heel off.
target: Sam then had to buy a new pair of shoes.

input: Title: Friends. Sentence 1: Jessica tripped and fell on her way into class on the first day. Sentence 2: Jason, Jessica's friend from last year, snickered at her clumsiness. Sentence 3: New kids Lina and Mark, helped Jessica to her feet. Sentence 4: They did not laugh at her, they asked if she was ok.
target: Jessica decided she would rather make nice, new friends.

input: Title: First Day of School. Sentence 1: Today was Tom's first day of high school. Sentence 2: He was nervous because he didn't know anyone at this new school. Sentence 3: His first class started with group introductions. Sentence 4: He met many new friends in this first class.
target: Tom was a little less nervous about the rest of the school day.

input: Title: Burning the Hand. Sentence 1: Angel was cooking breakfast. Sentence 2: The news was on in the kitchen. Sentence 3: Angel was paying attention to the news report. Sentence 4: Angel accidentally grabbed the hot part of the pan.
target: She burned her hand on the pan.

input: Title: The Bookstore. Sentence 1: Jan went to the bookstore. Sentence 2: She was looking for a cookbook. Sentence 3: One of the clerks helped her find a good cookbook. Sentence 4: Jan ended up buying an Asian cuisine cookbook.
target: For dinner, she made sweet and sour chicken.

input: Title: Bob fires his nanny. Sentence 1: Bob was a very busy businessman. Sentence 2: He didn't have much time to look after his 2 young ones. Sentence 3: Bob had hired a nanny to watch them. Sentence 4: Bob came home one day and one of his kids had bruises on her arm.
target: Bob decided to take legal action and fire his nanny.

input: Title: Essay. Sentence 1: John got in trouble in class. Sentence 2: Instead of being sent to the office, he had to write an essay. Sentence 3: John forgot to wrote his essay. Sentence 4: When he got to school his teacher asked for the essay.

input: Title: Player. Sentence 1: The other girl seemed to come from out of nowhere. Sentence 2: She collided with her forehead into my jaw. Sentence 3: The force of the hit knocked me onto the ground. Sentence 4: My jaw was pushed into my ear canal.
target: Her forehead was slightly dented from the impact.

input: Title: The Shed. Sentence 1: Jeremy wants do something with his empty yard. Sentence 2: He decides to build a shed. Sentence 3: He gathers the materials over the next month. Sentence 4: He then realizes it's too much work for just one person.

input: Title: Rabbit on the Road. Sentence 1: Dale was driving home from work one evening. Sentence 2: A dog ran out into the road. Sentence 3: Dale slammed on his brakes and barely missed it. Sentence 4: The car behind him slammed into his car.
target: Dale had to swap insurance information.

input: Title: World Traveler. Sentence 1: Paige always dreamed about going on a cruise. Sentence 2: She saved up her money. Sentence 3: Paige booked a European cruise. Sentence 4: The cruise was very fun.
target: Paige was glad that she went on the cruise fulfilling her dream.

input: Title: Carl's new Car. Sentence 1: Carl needs a new car. Sentence 2: He heads to his dealership to view all of the cars. Sentence 3: After test driving a few cars he picks his new car. Sentence 4: He gets the financing offer he wanted.
target: Carl drives home with his new car.

input: Title: Learning to Sew. Sentence 1: Sally got a sewing machine for her 8th birthday. Sentence 2: Miss Claire promised to teach Sally to sew. Sentence 3: They started by learning to thread the needle. Sentence 4: Next they practiced sewing in straight lines.
target: In no time at all Sally was making simple clothes for her dolls.

input: Title: Jill's Hot Water. Sentence 1: Jill's hot water heater broke. Sentence 2: She called the plumber to replace it. Sentence 3: It was a very old water heater, and not up to current code. Sentence 4: The plumber had to do additional work to bring the system up to code.
target: Jill ended up spending more than she expected for a new water heater.

input: Title: Teen Girl Insecurity. Sentence 1: It was never clear why Ellie wore so much makeup. Sentence 2: She had such a nice natural face. Sentence 3: Her mum thought it was because of the other girls at school. Sentence 4: They would ridicule any girl who didn't wear makeup.
target: She thinks this was to make themselves feel better about it.

input: Title: Soup. Sentence 1: Anna was trying to make her first pot of chicken soup. Sentence 2: She added her chicken and simmered, then added her veggies. Sentence 3: She flavored it and then served it to her family. Sentence 4: To her happiness, they all said it was very tasty!
target: Anna was very proud of her first soup effort!

input: Title: Melted. Sentence 1: Anna helped her little sister Kelly make a snowman. Sentence 2: Together they labored for hours. Sentence 3: Finally it was perfect, and they snapped photos. Sentence 4: But overnight, there was a thaw, and it melted!
target: Anna was glad that they at least had their photos!

input: Title: Ice. Sentence 1: Jim puffed a cloud of smoke into the man's face. Sentence 2: The man backed away slowly. Sentence 3: Jim had been to prison and was not to be messed with. Sentence 4: Jim laughed and stepped forward, but slipped on ice and fell.
target: The man got new courage and started kicking Jim in the stomach.

input: Title: The garden. Sentence 1: Jon got new plant seeds for his garden. Sentence 2: So Jon went to his garden. Sentence 3: He began to plant the seeds in his soil. Sentence 4: Jon watered them for months.
target: They grew into nice plants.

input: Title: Candy Coins. Sentence 1: Toby wanted a candy bar that cost one dollar. Sentence 2: He only had fifty cents in his pocket. Sentence 3: Toby's friend Dale also had fifty cents. Sentence 4: Dale gave Toby the money to buy the candy bar.
target: Toby and Dale split the candy bar and ate it together.

input: Title: Rain at the concert. Sentence 1: Miranda went to see Taylor swift. Sentence 2: She saw her in concert. Sentence 3: She was excited. Sentence 4: All the sudden it started raining.
target: Miranda had to duck for cover.

input: Title: Picking a Movie. Sentence 1: Tim was at home with his girlfriend. Sentence 2: They decided to watch something on Netflix. Sentence 3: Tim wanted to watch a horror movie. Sentence 4: His girlfriend wanted to watch a romantic comedy.
target: They got into a big fight over it.

input: Title: Taken Advantage of. Sentence 1: Henry offered Brett a ride home from school. Sentence 2: Brett felt guilty but he said yes. Sentence 3: After that day, Brett constantly asked for hides. Sentence 4: Henry warned him that he doesn't have a lot of money for gas.
target: Brett didn't understand what he was trying to say.

input: Title: Swing. Sentence 1: Nancy loved the swings. Sentence 2: Since she was a child she was always on them. Sentence 3: Nancy rode the swings next to her friends as well. Sentence 4: One day, Nancy fell off the swings.
target: She was hurt and never rode the swings again.

input: Title: Racing Pulse. Sentence 1: Tom had been taking a weight loss supplement. Sentence 2: The supplement had several side effects. Sentence 3: One of the side effects cause a racing pulse. Sentence 4: Tom thought he was having heart problems.
target: Tom stopped taking the supplement and the racing pulse stopped.

input: Title: Home. Sentence 1: On the way home we stopped at a small animal rescue. Sentence 2: We looked at several bears and tigers in captivity. Sentence 3: Their spaces were very small and cramped. Sentence 4: I felt sad for the animals.
target: I left wishing the conditions were better for them.

input: Title: Allergies. Sentence 1: Ellen had tried a new soap her friend recommended. Sentence 2: Her skin soon began to be itchy and red. Sentence 3: Rashes developed on her skin. Sentence 4: Ellen went to see her doctor.
target: The doctor determined she was allergic to her new soap.

input: Title: The Plane. Sentence 1: Jessica bought a plane ticket to travel to see her brother. Sentence 2: She got to the airport, checked her luggage, and went to the gate. Sentence 3: When she boarded the plane, she got an awesome window seat! Sentence 4: After two hours, the plane landed in Texas.
target: When she got off the plane, her brother was waiting for her!

input: Title: Scary Water Slide. Sentence 1: Tim was at the water park with his family. Sentence 2: His older brother convinced him to go on a slide. Sentence 3: He told Tim it was short and fun. Sentence 4: Tim found out it was long and scary.
target: He didn't get on any more slides after that.

input: Title: Spider Jump. Sentence 1: Jennifer was reading on the couch. Sentence 2: She suddenly saw a spider on the wall next to her. Sentence 3: She jumped off the couch and screamed. Sentence 4: She then realized it wasn't a spider, just the shadow of the lamp.
target: Jennifer felt silly and embarrassed.

input: Title: The CD. Sentence 1: Donna's favorite CD was in her car. Sentence 2: She was taking it out to listen to in her house. Sentence 3: Donna dropped the CD on the ground walking into her house. Sentence 4: She stepped on the CD and cracked it.
target: Donna had to get a new copy of the CD.

input: Title: Driving. Sentence 1: My niece and two of her kids went to Cape Cod for a vacation this week. Sentence 2: Her eldest, an 18 year old girl named Sheila, stayed home. Sentence 3: Sheila broke her foot this week. Sentence 4: My niece asked her sister to take Sheila to the hospital.
target: Her sister had also broken her foot and could not drive.

input: Title: Table. Sentence 1: Stephen had a very big table. Sentence 2: He would use it everyday. Sentence 3: One day, the table broke a leg. Sentence 4: Then, Stephen had to rush to the store and get it fixed.
target: Now, Stephen is able to eat on his table.

input: Title: Ohio Trip. Sentence 1: One day Laurie took a trip to Ohio. Sentence 2: First she went to the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Sentence 3: Then she went to Cedar Point. Sentence 4: Finally she went to Columbus Zoo.
target: She had a great time.

input: Title: Robot. Sentence 1: Donovan decided to build a robot. Sentence 2: He went to the hardware store to buy parts. Sentence 3: He made a square head with an antenna. Sentence 4: He added claw shaped hands.
target: The finished robot could walk and talk.

input: Title: Quiet Neighbors. Sentence 1: Tom hadn't heard his upstairs neighbor move in a long time. Sentence 2: He hadn't seen him outside either. Sentence 3: After a while he went to knock but nobody answered. Sentence 4: He called the authorities just to make sure.
target: Tom's neighbor had moved out without telling anyone.

input: Title: Less. Sentence 1: Eric decided to eat less food. Sentence 2: And he ended up saving lots of money. Sentence 3: So he ate less and less. Sentence 4: And he got used to a low calorie diet.
target: Eric spent $50 on food each month.

input: Title: Instant winner. Sentence 1: Ken never played the lottery but bought a ticket one time. Sentence 2: He won the jackpot and became an instant multimillionaire. Sentence 3: With so much money available to him, he could do a lot of good. Sentence 4: He helped many charities.
target: And as he was smart, he invested his money so it'd last a long time.

input: Title: Wooden Coaster. Sentence 1: Paul was at a far away theme park. Sentence 2: And he was excited to ride the roller coaster with a wooden track. Sentence 3: But as he got closer, he became very nervous. Sentence 4: And he decided to never ride it.
target: After the long ride home, he regret not riding the roller coaster.

input: Title: Massive protest. Sentence 1: I went to a concert last night. Sentence 2: There was a large protest right outside. Sentence 3: Apparently the musician was not allowed on stage. Sentence 4: It was frustrating.
target: I then proceeded to go and join.

input: Title: The Flower Shop. Sentence 1: Jenny stopped at the flower shop to buy her mom flowers. Sentence 2: She checked the money in her pocket as she went into the shop. Sentence 3: A clerk approached to find out what Jenny needed. Sentence 4: Jenny pointed to a bundle of flowers.
target: Jenny clutched the bundle of flowers close and hurried home.

input: Title: The Joker. Sentence 1: Andrew loves to make people laugh. Sentence 2: He often makes jokes and does silly stunts. Sentence 3: Once in a crowded room he started to dance like he was riding a horse. Sentence 4: Everyone in the room was giggling at Andrew's dancing.
target: Andrew is always the life of the party.
