target: She still barely made it in time to catch the bus.

input: Title: Chewed. Sentence 1: She went outside to get the dog. Sentence 2: The rope lay on the ground. Sentence 3: She quickly realized he had chewed through the rope. Sentence 4: She ran around frantically calling his name.
target: He came running out of the bushes.

input: Title: Brenda gets an award. Sentence 1: Brenda is a school teacher. Sentence 2: She teaches Speech class at her school. Sentence 3: Brenda has a long successful career as a speech teacher. Sentence 4: One year she gets a letter telling her she has won an award.
target: She is so happy to receive an award for all her years of teaching.

input: Title: Goldfish. Sentence 1: My son was looking for snacks. Sentence 2: He opened up the pantry. Sentence 3: He saw a box of goldfish. Sentence 4: He could not reach the goldfish.
target: I got the goldfish for him.

input: Title: The Online Date. Sentence 1: Wade had joined an online dating site. Sentence 2: He was interested in a woman he found. Sentence 3: Wade decided to meet the woman. Sentence 4: Wade met the woman at a cafe.
target: Wade and the woman began to date.

input: Title: Science Project. Sentence 1: Jolene was getting ready to demonstrate her science project. Sentence 2: She poured vinegar into a large pot in front of the class. Sentence 3: Then then put on goggles and told everyone to get ready. Sentence 4: She poured baking soda into the pot and bubbles came spewing out.
target: The whole class was surprised but Jolene wasn't.

input: Title: Sally buys a car. Sentence 1: Sally was looking for a new car. Sentence 2: She wasn't very rich. Sentence 3: She decided to try a local dealer. Sentence 4: The dealer worked with Sally.
target: Sally bought a new car.

input: Title: A Sunburn. Sentence 1: Jody had shaved his head. Sentence 2: He was working in the yard. Sentence 3: He hadn't thought to use sunscreen on his head. Sentence 4: Jody got sunburn on his head.
target: He wore a hat the next time he was outside.

input: Title: Ugly Sweater. Sentence 1: Kate's grandmother gave her a sweater for christmas. Sentence 2: It was really ugly. Sentence 3: Unfortunately Kate's grandmother made it herself. Sentence 4: Kate had to wear it a few times to show she liked it.
target: She took it off immediately after her grandmother left.

input: Title: The Speech. Sentence 1: Silas was getting ready for a speech at his school. Sentence 2: He stood in the mirror and practiced in his room. Sentence 3: Silas gave the speech to his parents. Sentence 4: Silas went to school on the day of the speech.
target: Silas gave his speech to the other students.

input: Title: Sculpture. Sentence 1: Marcel was a talented sculptor. Sentence 2: His hometown wanted a new statue for the town hall. Sentence 3: They commissioned Marcel to produce the new sculpture. Sentence 4: After months of work the sculpture was completed.
target: Marcel's hometown was proud of his work.

input: Title: Jim's Truck. Sentence 1: Jim likes to take his truck and go mudding. Sentence 2: He plans to go to the river bottom tomorrow. Sentence 3: He gets in his truck and arrives at the river bottom soon after. Sentence 4: He notices it's all dried up and he can't go mudding today.
target: It then starts raining very hard and soon enough there is mud.

input: Title: Epic Failure. Sentence 1: Bill was quite happy with the picture on his 80 inch TV. Sentence 2: He enjoyed sports on TV more than ever. Sentence 3: Then black lines appeared across the screen. Sentence 4: The set had cost $4000 and was only 23 months old.
target: It could not be repaired and had to be hauled away.

input: Title: Street Performer. Sentence 1: Kevin's band wasn't earning much money. Sentence 2: But he wanted to play music for a living. Sentence 3: He reluctantly tried playing his music on the sidewalk. Sentence 4: And he earned more money than he expected.
target: He drew large crowds and became more and more popular.

input: Title: Barista Birthday. Sentence 1: Tom got his coffee every morning before work. Sentence 2: Tom got this coffee from the same Starbucks each morning. Sentence 3: Doing this, Tom developed a friendship with the barista. Sentence 4: One morning Tom learned the following day was the barista's birthday.
target: Tom left her a one hundred dollar tip for her birthday!

input: Title: The Art Competition. Sentence 1: George was visiting his bank to make a transaction. Sentence 2: He saw a big ad for an art contest hosted by the bank. Sentence 3: Whoever won would get to paint a mural in the bank. Sentence 4: George loved art and decided to enter.
target: To his surprise he won and he got to make the mural.

input: Title: A walk to the park.. Sentence 1: Sammy walked his pet dog to the park. Sentence 2: On the way the dog broke of of the leash. Sentence 3: The dog ran fast down the street. Sentence 4: Sammy ran after the dog screaming.
target: The chase ended with Sammy and the dog at the park.

input: Title: Big break. Sentence 1: Joey had dreams of being a singer. Sentence 2: He practiced every day, despite his neighbours complaints. Sentence 3: He once went along to a meet and greet with a music producer. Sentence 4: Joey took along a demo CD like many other people there.
target: To his amazement, the producer loved Joey and wanted to take him on.

input: Title: Magic. Sentence 1: The magician entered the stage, waving to the crowd. Sentence 2: He took a deep bow and flashed his cape. Sentence 3: Suddenly, a dove materialized from his hands. Sentence 4: The dove flew away and then disappeared in a puff of smoke.
target: The audience cheered.

input: Title: Broken earrings. Sentence 1: I had gold earrings. Sentence 2: I wore them everyday. Sentence 3: Then they broke. Sentence 4: I was heartbroken.
target: Now I had nothing to wear.

input: Title: Hungry. Sentence 1: Wendy was hungry. Sentence 2: She decided to order a pizza. Sentence 3: She called the restaurant for a delivery. Sentence 4: The pizza delivery man came by with her pizza.
target: Wendy was excited and ate half the pizza.

input: Title: The Stew. Sentence 1: Josh liked cooking. Sentence 2: He decided to make a stew. Sentence 3: He chopped the vegetables and meat. Sentence 4: He mixed it in a pot and let it simmer.
target: The stew tasted great!

input: Title: New Shoes. Sentence 1: Tom got a new pair of cool shoes. Sentence 2: They were white and perfect. Sentence 3: He wore them out among friends. Sentence 4: Nobody really said anything about them.
target: Tom felt they liked them, though.

input: Title: Delayed Exam. Sentence 1: Erica was in her history class in college. Sentence 2: She had a big exam that day. Sentence 3: She felt nervous going into the exam. Sentence 4: Erica had prepared all week for it.
target: Her teacher told her last minute the exam would be pushed to tomorrow.

input: Title: Survey Town. Sentence 1: Every day lately, we had to do a lot of surveys. Sentence 2: We got tired of them very quickly. Sentence 3: We kept doing them because we needed the money. Sentence 4: Truth be told, I hated every minute of it.
target: Still, we needed to pay the bills.

input: Title: The Doll.. Sentence 1: Drew breaks his mother's ceramic doll. Sentence 2: He sweeps the doll under the couch. Sentence 3: His mother soon discovers what happened. Sentence 4: Drew has to do work to replace the doll.
target: Drew has learned not to hide things from his parents.

input: Title: Candle Power. Sentence 1: Jeff was being punished by his mother for bad grades. Sentence 2: She made him sit in the corner for as long a large candle burned. Sentence 3: Jeff tried everything to make the candle melt faster. Sentence 4: Alas, the candle burned slowly.
target: By the time it burned out, Jeff was fast asleep in the corner.

input: Title: Bad day. Sentence 1: Sara woke up late for school because her alarm didn't go off. Sentence 2: At breakfast she spilled her cereal on her lap and had to change. Sentence 3: When she stepped outside the wind pulled her homework out her hand. Sentence 4: She got out of her mom's car at school she stepped in gum.
target: Sara got to her desk and read the words pop quiz on the board.

input: Title: Birth. Sentence 1: The woman gave birth. Sentence 2: She had a baby boy. Sentence 3: She wanted a baby girl. Sentence 4: She was disappointed when they told her.
target: The husband was happier with the gender.

input: Title: Her First Dog Park Outing. Sentence 1: We recently got a new dog who had been picked up as a stray. Sentence 2: We took her on walks, but with a leash so that she couldn't run away. Sentence 3: As an ex-stray, we didn't think that she had ever been to a dog park. Sentence 4: We took her out to a local dog park and let her off the leash.
target: It was great to finally see her dashing freely about the park!

input: Title: Grumpy woman. Sentence 1: Gertrude was a very grumpy woman. Sentence 2: She hated people and looked at them with a scowl. Sentence 3: When a small child came for Halloween at her door, she didn't open. Sentence 4: When she woke up the next day, her house was covered in toilet paper.
target: Gertrude left it there all year and became the toilet paper lady.

input: Title: The Grocery Spill. Sentence 1: Kyle was walking home with a bag of heavy groceries. Sentence 2: He was stomping along when suddenly he heard a thud. Sentence 3: His bag had ripped and food was spilling out everywhere. Sentence 4: After collecting his fallen goods, Kyle stuck everything in his shirt.
target: He managed to get it all home using his shirt like a nest.

input: Title: Birdman. Sentence 1: There once lived a man who loved birds. Sentence 2: It did not matter what type of bird it what this. Sentence 3: He loved bluebirds, partridges, pigeons. Sentence 4: He loved him so much, they took over his life.
target: This man became a hermit, with 530 birds.

input: Title: Beyond Repair. Sentence 1: Jesse ran over her favorite flower bush. Sentence 2: It happened as she was backing out of her driveway. Sentence 3: She tried repairing the damage to the flower bush herself. Sentence 4: The flower bush was almost destroyed beyond repair.

input: Title: Wet Laundry. Sentence 1: One sunny day Kara hung her family's laundry out to dry. Sentence 2: She didn't bother to check the weather forecast. Sentence 3: While she was running an errand the sky grew dark and foreboding. Sentence 4: She called her son at home to bring the laundry in.
target: He managed to get everything off the line before the rain started.

input: Title: Hard Drive. Sentence 1: I bought a new external hard drive. Sentence 2: It was large and green. Sentence 3: I was careful hooking it up. Sentence 4: I started downloading a ton of new games.
target: It's going to take all week for them to load.

input: Title: Pain. Sentence 1: Tom was driving to work. Sentence 2: He had a car accident. Sentence 3: He suffered injuries. Sentence 4: He was in pain.
target: He went to the doctor to help resolve his pain.

input: Title: Fireworks. Sentence 1: Fourth of July was one of Ben's favorite holidays. Sentence 2: After a day of swimming, picnics and games there were fireworks. Sentence 3: It was the perfect way to end the day. Sentence 4: This year's display was the best yet.
target: Ben was feeling quite satisfied when he got home late that night.

input: Title: An Infection. Sentence 1: Kim had a burning sensation in her bladder. Sentence 2: She went to the doctor. Sentence 3: The doctor said she had a urinary tract infection. Sentence 4: He gave her antibiotics.
target: The infection cleared up.

input: Title: Broken Down. Sentence 1: Tim was on a road trip. Sentence 2: The van broke down halfway through. Sentence 3: The price to fix it was more than Tim could afford. Sentence 4: He decided to stay locally and get a job.
target: He never moved back out.

input: Title: New musical. Sentence 1: Allie got tickets to a new musical. Sentence 2: She couldn't wait to go. Sentence 3: When she got there though it was upsetting. Sentence 4: A man was sitting in front of her.
target: He was so tall she could not see.

input: Title: Gift. Sentence 1: She said I should not give that kind of gift. Sentence 2: I was headed out of town for a few months. Sentence 3: Things had been sour between us. Sentence 4: I left a chocolate pie on her doorstep.
target: I wanted to tell her I was going.

input: Title: Snail Photography. Sentence 1: Kal was a photographer. Sentence 2: He wasn't just any type of photographer though. Sentence 3: He photographed snails for a living. Sentence 4: It started out as his passion but he turned it into his career.
target: He loved what he did and never worked a day in his life.

input: Title: The Prescription. Sentence 1: Simon takes a prescription medication everyday. Sentence 2: One Saturday he noticed he had taken his last pill. Sentence 3: He called to pharmacy and asked for a refill. Sentence 4: The pharmacist informed him there were no refills left.
target: The pharmacist gave him enough pills to last through the weekend.

input: Title: The Bed. Sentence 1: Bridget loved her bedroom. Sentence 2: She just needed a new bed. Sentence 3: She found the perfect one at an antique store. Sentence 4: It was made of iron.
target: Bridget bought the old piece and brought it home.

input: Title: Apartment. Sentence 1: Tom needed to move into a new apartment. Sentence 2: He needed an apartment closer to his work. Sentence 3: He spent all weekend looking at apartments. Sentence 4: He managed to find a nice and affordable one nearby his job.

input: Title: Thanks, Bro. Sentence 1: Today I noticed my brother had my phone messing with it. Sentence 2: I figured he was playing a game or something. Sentence 3: Later, I kept getting texts expressing sympathy for me. Sentence 4: I couldn't figure out why I was getting them.
target: My brother texted everyone I had an STD and then deleted his texts.

input: Title: Janice. Sentence 1: Janice and Marion were friends until Janice stole Marion's boyfriend. Sentence 2: Both of them had known each other since grade school though. Sentence 3: Finally Janice decided the best thing to do was break up. Sentence 4: After Janice left the boyfriend, Marion got together with him.
target: The two friends were never friends again because of the boyfriend.

input: Title: Scott is scared. Sentence 1: Scott is told he needs surgery to take out his appendix. Sentence 2: Scott is very scared and doesn't wanna have surgery. Sentence 3: His friends try and comfort him. Sentence 4: They give him the courage to have the surgery.
target: Scott has his surgery and makes a full recovery.

input: Title: Drinking. Sentence 1: My husband is an alcoholic. Sentence 2: This morning he woke up with a hangover. Sentence 3: He said he would drink a few beers to come down from it. Sentence 4: When they were gone, he wanted more.

input: Title: Bad News. Sentence 1: Jimmy was practicing football when he was knocked down. Sentence 2: He did not think the blow was too hard until he tried to get up. Sentence 3: When Jimmy tried to get up, he got dizzy. Sentence 4: Jimmy was sent to the ER to have an examination.
target: He had a concussion and was out the rest of the season.

input: Title: Missed Call. Sentence 1: John applied for a new job a week ago from today. Sentence 2: John decided to go out to the bar for a few drinks with his friends. Sentence 3: The bar was so loud that John was not able to hear his phone ring. Sentence 4: He missed a call from his future employer.
target: The future employer decided John was not reliable, denying him a job.

input: Title: Rylo the pest. Sentence 1: Rylo was a mischievous sibling to her two older sisters. Sentence 2: She enjoyed making them cry at times when their was no reason to. Sentence 3: She tricked her older sister Nancy into eating rotten vegetables. Sentence 4: She tricked her other older sister Becca into falling down some steps.
target: For this she went too far and was sent away to boarding school .

input: Title: Tom learns to play the guitar.. Sentence 1: Tom wanted to learn to play the guitar to impress girls. Sentence 2: Tom decided to take guitar lessons from his local musical teacher. Sentence 3: Tom practiced day and night to improve his guitar playing skills. Sentence 4: Tom became proficient at playing the guitar.
target: Tom joined a banned and played guitar professionally.

input: Title: Candy Thief. Sentence 1: Billy stole a candy bar from a store. Sentence 2: He bragged to his friend's about stealing it. Sentence 3: His friend told his mother. Sentence 4: His mother made him return the candy bar to the store.
target: The boy never stole again.

target: She is happy that she is finally doing her laundry.

input: Title: Randy is a hero. Sentence 1: Randy is driving home. Sentence 2: He sees a house burning. Sentence 3: He stops his car. Sentence 4: He runs inside the house.
target: He rescues all the people inside.

target: I bought them and felt very accomplished!

input: Title: Something smells. Sentence 1: Tina took her friend to the outlet store. Sentence 2: Tina loved going to the outlet store. Sentence 3: But Tracy did not. Sentence 4: They walked right into a designer shop.
target: As soon as they got in, Tracy walked out due to the smell.

input: Title: Can't Beat That Logic. Sentence 1: My friend caught his son jerking off and decided to have the talk. Sentence 2: He's mildly religious, so his talk was not to do it God hates it. Sentence 3: His son said God made his hand too perfect for his knob not to do it. Sentence 4: My religious friend was dumbfounded and didn't know what to say.
target: Everybody at the office is talking about it and laughing.

input: Title: Boris at the Drive-In. Sentence 1: Boris went to the drive-in with his friends on Wednesday. Sentence 2: He saw an old sci-fi movie. Sentence 3: About half-way through, he bought some popcorn. Sentence 4: He thought the cashier was cute, so he asked for his number.
target: Boris is going to the drive-in again, tonight, with his new date.

input: Title: Joe C. Sentence 1: On July 10th, we went to Joe C's birthday party. Sentence 2: He was turning 99 on July 13th. Sentence 3: His daughter, a musician, had several friends sing and play music. Sentence 4: Other guests recited poetry to Joe, an amateur poet.
target: Despite his age, Joe stayed at the party well past midnight.

input: Title: Laundry Problems. Sentence 1: Bobby was doing his laundry himself for the first time. Sentence 2: He followed his mother's instructions, carefully sorting colors. Sentence 3: He put the whites in and turned on the machine. Sentence 4: When he came back, his underwear was all pink.
target: He had accidentally left in a red shirt!

input: Title: Tom and the car. Sentence 1: Tom left his car at his Mom's house in the backyard. Sentence 2: He left it there for years. Sentence 3: It became filled with bees. Sentence 4: Tom saw his car and got rid of it.
target: Tom just bought a new car.

input: Title: Girl on a Train. Sentence 1: I found a copy of Girl on a Train in a recycle bin. Sentence 2: I put it up on Amazon and sold it immediately for $5. Sentence 3: I listed it twice in error and got another sale. Sentence 4: I did not have a second copy of the book.
target: Although I lost money, I drop shipped the book.

input: Title: Button Up. Sentence 1: Tyler bought a polo. Sentence 2: He couldn't decide if he should button it all the way up. Sentence 3: He looked online for tips. Sentence 4: He asked his wife.
target: He buttoned it up.

input: Title: Kites. Sentence 1: Melvin was a kite collector. Sentence 2: He never flew his kites. Sentence 3: He only kept them in cases. Sentence 4: One day one of his children flew one of his kites.
target: He scolded the child and cleaned the kite himself.

input: Title: The Escape Plan. Sentence 1: Jerry was going on a blind date. Sentence 2: He told his friend to call him with an emergency to get out of it. Sentence 3: His friend called at the right time. Sentence 4: Jerry played along.
target: He left the date early.

input: Title: Running. Sentence 1: Donald decided he wanted to join the track team. Sentence 2: He ran every day after school for two hours. Sentence 3: He even got a gym membership for the treadmill! Sentence 4: He tried out for the team but wasn't very confident.
target: The coach called him later that day and told him he passed!

input: Title: Foggy problems. Sentence 1: Yesterday there was a very heavy fog in our city. Sentence 2: As a result, many people refused to drive to work. Sentence 3: I decided to take the subway, instead. Sentence 4: There were reports of many car accidents due to the fog.
target: The fog dissipated by noon.

input: Title: Sparky's Pokemon Cards. Sentence 1: Sparky loved Pokemon cards. Sentence 2: His dad would take him every weekend to buy some. Sentence 3: Sparky took them to school where they were stolen. Sentence 4: Sparky was very sad.
target: Sparky leaves his Pokemon cards at home now.

input: Title: Carl makes a difference. Sentence 1: Carl visits the poor neighborhood he grew up in. Sentence 2: He wanted to help out kids who needed it. Sentence 3: He helped do community work to clean up some parks. Sentence 4: Carl felt really good about helping his community.
target: Carl made a difference to a lot of people in the community.

input: Title: Greed. Sentence 1: Sara was told not to trust food found in the wild. Sentence 2: As she was playing outside, she came across a berry bush. Sentence 3: The berries looked swollen, ripe, and so sweet. Sentence 4: Sara plucked several berries quickly and ate them voraciously.
target: Poor Sara then spent most of the night ejecting the poisonous berries.

input: Title: Adoption. Sentence 1: My friend Andy was married in 1990. Sentence 2: He and his wife wanted a baby. Sentence 3: Sadly, she could not bear children. Sentence 4: They went to an adoption agency.
target: A year later they adopted a Russian girl.

input: Title: Dirty Yard. Sentence 1: Tim lived in a neighborhood with a housing association. Sentence 2: He would constantly get complaints about his yard. Sentence 3: He was even fined once. Sentence 4: Tim didn't think it looked that bad.
target: He preferred to pay the fine that change it.

input: Title: Auction. Sentence 1: Tristan wanted to win an auction on eBay. Sentence 2: He stayed in front of his computer for two hours. Sentence 3: He bid and bid again loving the competition. Sentence 4: When he thought he could get the last bid, his computer froze.
target: He saw in horror that he had lost his bid when the computer came back.

input: Title: Chess Title. Sentence 1: Amber's dad taught her to play chess at a young age. Sentence 2: When she was in fifth grade, she joined her school's chess club. Sentence 3: She was the only girl in the club, and she was a little intimidated. Sentence 4: She found that she was good at chess, and always beat the boys.
target: Her father was proud of Amber when she won the championship.

input: Title: Boring Honeymoon. Sentence 1: Dan and Darla got married in Texas. Sentence 2: They were going to spend their honeymoon in Florida. Sentence 3: Their hotel was closed because of an approaching hurricane. Sentence 4: They decided to spend their honeymoon in Texas.
target: They stayed in their hotel room and watched hurricane reports on tv.

input: Title: Flight Delay. Sentence 1: Joe went to the airport to catch a flight to visit some relatives. Sentence 2: Unfortunately, his flight was delayed due to bad weather conditions. Sentence 3: Joe had to wait a half day until another flight was available. Sentence 4: Afterwards, Joe flew on that airplane and arrived at his destination.
target: Joe was very happy that he was able to visit his relatives.

input: Title: Pile of Clothes. Sentence 1: Tom was a bit of a slob. Sentence 2: He would just throw his clothes on the floor. Sentence 3: Eventually he built up three piles. Sentence 4: All for different variations of dirty.
target: Tom would still wear clothes from the cleaner pile.

input: Title: Post Office. Sentence 1: Marion's apartment had a postal pick-up protocol. Sentence 2: Outgoing mail was to be left on a ledge by the door. Sentence 3: One day Marion put an important envelope on the ledge. Sentence 4: It was ignored and left on the ledge.
target: From then on Marion brought outgoing mail to the post office.

input: Title: Fast Driver. Sentence 1: Abby did not like to drive with her boyfriend. Sentence 2: Abby felt that her boyfriend always drove over the speed limit. Sentence 3: Abby decided that she would ask him to slow down. Sentence 4: However, Abby's boyfriend decided to ignore her request and go fast.
target: Abby was not pleased that her boyfriend would not slow down.

input: Title: Tim's Accident. Sentence 1: Tim likes to ride bicycles. Sentence 2: Tim rode his bicycle out in the woods. Sentence 3: The wheel of Tim's bicycle struck a rock while Tim was going fast. Sentence 4: Tim flew off his bicycle and slammed into a tree.
target: Tim was ultimately airlifted to a hospital with a broken neck.

input: Title: Cure. Sentence 1: Mike, a college student, had frequent bouts with feeling depressed. Sentence 2: Mike went to see a campus counselor about this. Sentence 3: The counselor encouraged Mike to start exercising. Sentence 4: Mike began to go for a mild run every evening after classes.
target: Mike has not felt any depression since he started jogging!

input: Title: Odd first date. Sentence 1: Fred was having his first date with Claire. Sentence 2: He was nervous about it. Sentence 3: So he decided to have it be a group date. Sentence 4: Claire was not thrilled.
target: She wanted to spend time just the two of them.

input: Title: Bad Babysitter. Sentence 1: I was at a party. Sentence 2: A friend asked me to watch her two year old child for a minute. Sentence 3: As soon as she left, her kid put her hand on a burning candle. Sentence 4: She screamed as hot wax stuck to her hand.
target: The mother rushed back, yelling at me.

input: Title: Crystal Lake. Sentence 1: In 2004 I took the kids to Crystal Lake in Newton. Sentence 2: We wanted to swim there. Sentence 3: We lived only a short distance away in Brighton. Sentence 4: When we got there they wanted $6 a person as we were not residents.
target: I refused to pay, and we swam in a pool in Brighton instead.

input: Title: A Night Out. Sentence 1: Tonya just wanted to spend a night out with her two best friends. Sentence 2: Instead, she spent the night alone in bed with the Flu. Sentence 3: The next day her two best friends arrived with gift cards and soup. Sentence 4: Tonya suggested they order some movies.
target: They stayed over and watched movies all day with Tonya.

input: Title: The Police Car. Sentence 1: Todd was racing home. Sentence 2: A police car pulled out behind him. Sentence 3: The lights and siren were on. Sentence 4: The officer gave him a ticket.
target: Todd's day had been terrible!

input: Title: Unhappy Marriage. Sentence 1: Greg had been married for several years. Sentence 2: He was not satisfied with his life. Sentence 3: He decided that he was going to look outside of his marriage. Sentence 4: Greg made a move on his secretary.
target: Greg is now cheating on his wife.

input: Title: Near death experience. Sentence 1: The bus ran into a gasoline truck. Sentence 2: Both vehicles slid on the highway. Sentence 3: Many cars had to come to a stop in order to avoid being hit. Sentence 4: Police officials came and evacuated all of the children from the car.
target: The fire extinguisher team quickly extinguished all of the flames.

input: Title: Getting Stitches. Sentence 1: Tom was riding his bicycle. Sentence 2: He hit a big rock and flipped. Sentence 3: Tom got a big cut on his chin. Sentence 4: His parents had to take him to the hospital.
target: Tom had to get eight stitches.

input: Title: Tyler loses a leg. Sentence 1: Tyler is in war. Sentence 2: He is serving his country the best he can. Sentence 3: While rescuing a group of women in a town he gets shot. Sentence 4: He is shot in the leg.
target: Tyler is carried to camp to have his leg amputated.

input: Title: Steel Cage. Sentence 1: The motorcycle act began simply enough with wheelies. Sentence 2: Burt and Julie clapped and whistled. Sentence 3: Then two motorcycles rode into a giant metal structure. Sentence 4: They riders drove on ramps in the cage and performing tricks.
target: When it ended, Julie and Burt had cheered until they were hoarse.

input: Title: Privileges. Sentence 1: We had a great view of the fireworks. Sentence 2: The fireworks went off with no one else around. Sentence 3: There was room to spread out. Sentence 4: All of the lifeguards got to sit in the water park.
target: Everyone else was in a field nearby.

input: Title: Thanksgiving Session Ruined. Sentence 1: The family got together today. Sentence 2: My mom prepared the Turkey and smoked ham in the oven. Sentence 3: It was mostly cooked once everyone got around the table. Sentence 4: The oven door wouldn't open all of a sudden.
target: When dad broke it open, the food was burned.

input: Title: Ants. Sentence 1: Zachary drowned the ants in a bucket of water. Sentence 2: His mother was shocked by his actions, and hit him. Sentence 3: Zachary started crying and asked how she could do that. Sentence 4: She said how he thought the ants felt about drowning.
target: Zachary realized he had been a bad boy.

input: Title: Bongo. Sentence 1: Bongo was in my front yard one day. Sentence 2: He was a sweet half pit bull, half lab. Sentence 3: He had mange all over his head and nose. Sentence 4: I took him in, and tried to treat his ailments.
target: I was unable to help, and had to rehome him.

input: Title: The Cute Puppy. Sentence 1: Lisa found an adorable puppy alone in the park. Sentence 2: She looked for his owner but to no avail. Sentence 3: She brought him home and made him a bed. Sentence 4: She quickly fell in love with the sweet dog.
target: He stayed at her house from then on!

input: Title: Rain. Sentence 1: One day Jennifer wanted to go jogging in the rain. Sentence 2: She quickly put on her raincoat and a pair of red rain boots. Sentence 3: She ran for almost two miles,before a flash of thunder struck a tree. Sentence 4: The tree fell five feet in front of her and almost landed on her head.
target: Jennifer became frighten and ended her rainy day jog.

input: Title: Big Feet. Sentence 1: Sierra was self-conscious about her big feet. Sentence 2: She could never find shoes that fit her correctly. Sentence 3: She was sure other girls were making fun of them. Sentence 4: One summer Sierra had a growth spurt and went up almost a foot.
target: After that, Sierra's feet seemed proportionally appropriate.

input: Title: Holding on for dear life. Sentence 1: I bit the bullet and went on my first roller coaster yesterday. Sentence 2: I decided to go on a relatively small coaster. Sentence 3: However they did not seem to strap us in very well. Sentence 4: So as the ride started I held on for dear life.
target: I was screaming as loud as I could and couldn't wait until it was over.

input: Title: Jacob's New Business Venture. Sentence 1: Jacob has always loved serving people food. Sentence 2: He loved when his parents hosted parties growing up. Sentence 3: Jacob's passion led him to open a bistro downtown. Sentence 4: He didn't do a good job in picking a chef to hire.
target: Now no one wants to eat there because the food isn't very good.

input: Title: Quick Donation. Sentence 1: Ben stopped at a red traffic light. Sentence 2: He noticed a homeless man sleeping on the bench. Sentence 3: He told the man to come. Sentence 4: His face glowed when Ben pulled out a hamburger for him.
target: He immediately thanked Ben.

input: Title: The Dishonest Maid. Sentence 1: Joy worked at a hotel in housekeeping. Sentence 2: Joy found someone's wallet in a room she was cleaning. Sentence 3: She put the wallet in her purse. Sentence 4: Her bosses found out that she tried taking the wallet.
target: Joy was fired from her job.

input: Title: Tom wouldn't listen.. Sentence 1: Tom's boss warned him repeatedly about drinking at the store. Sentence 2: One night, a new girl started and Tom worked the shift with her. Sentence 3: He got drunk and yelled at a customer about nothing. Sentence 4: The new girl phoned the boss, who came down to the shop.
target: Tom was fired on the spot, the new girl taking over his position.

input: Title: Bowling party. Sentence 1: Allie went bowling. Sentence 2: She had a bowling party. Sentence 3: All of the sudden it fell on her foot. Sentence 4: It hurt badly.
target: Allie then needed to take a break.

input: Title: Jazz Record. Sentence 1: Miles joined a jazz band. Sentence 2: They played at a club every week. Sentence 3: A producer listened to them at the club. Sentence 4: He offered Miles a record contract.
target: Miles made a jazz record.

input: Title: Camouflage. Sentence 1: The man tried to blend into his environment. Sentence 2: The enemy came to his location. Sentence 3: The enemy did not see him. Sentence 4: The man waited for the enemy to pass.
target: He radioed the enemy's position to his team.

input: Title: Barking Dog. Sentence 1: Kids were playing in the park. Sentence 2: Suddenly big dog appeared. Sentence 3: He started barking. Sentence 4: Kids got very scared.
target: Finally, dog's owner showed up and put his dog on a leash.

input: Title: Cindy. Sentence 1: Cindy was a science teacher. Sentence 2: She was also a track coach. Sentence 3: She led the girls to a state championship. Sentence 4: She got a pay raise at another school.
target: Eventually, she came back to her old school.

input: Title: Faux Hawk. Sentence 1: My son wanted a unique hair style. Sentence 2: I took him to see a barber. Sentence 3: While there, he decided he wanted a faux hawk. Sentence 4: Afterwards he got some red paint to put in his hair.
target: His mohawk looked like a parrot to me.

input: Title: Old Water. Sentence 1: Tim was really thirsty. Sentence 2: But there was no more water left in his house. Sentence 3: He found an old water bottle by his bed though. Sentence 4: He considered going to the store to buy more water.
target: But he impulsively drank the old water by his bed.

input: Title: The Frozen Watch. Sentence 1: Seth had just put a pizza in the oven. Sentence 2: While it cooked he went to do some yard work. Sentence 3: A bit into the work he checked his watch to see how long had passed. Sentence 4: Oddly his watch hadn't changed at all.
target: He realized that his watch had frozen and ran to get the pizza out.

input: Title: Vacation Time. Sentence 1: Ray bought airline tickets to Bora Bora. Sentence 2: He drove to the airport early the next morning. Sentence 3: Ray boarded the plane when his seat number was called. Sentence 4: Ray got his luggage from the carousel after the flight.
target: Ray went to the beach as soon as he arrived in Bora Bora.

input: Title: The Spare Key. Sentence 1: Mary continuously locked herself out of the house. Sentence 2: Her husband decided to make a spare key. Sentence 3: He gave the spare key to the woman who lived next door. Sentence 4: Mary locked herself outside again.
target: She was able to let herself in with the spare key from her neighbor.

input: Title: Minimum Wage. Sentence 1: Nicholas calculated how much he would need to make over summer. Sentence 2: He wanted to buy a car in the fall. Sentence 3: He realized at his current minimum wage job, he would never make it. Sentence 4: Nicholas looked at the rich people houses next door.
target: Nicholas decided to break in and steal their money.

input: Title: The Charger. Sentence 1: Geraldine left her phone charger at home. Sentence 2: While she was at work her phone died. Sentence 3: She asked Scott if she could borrow his. Sentence 4: Scott said only for a dollar.
target: She paid Scott one dollar even though that was mean.

input: Title: Sleep. Sentence 1: Doug lives in a noisy neighborhood. Sentence 2: He works late into the night. Sentence 3: One day Doug was very tired. Sentence 4: It was too noisy to sleep.
target: Doug was very tired when he returned to work.

input: Title: Sick Day. Sentence 1: Bobby woke up with a stomachache. Sentence 2: His mom took Bobby's temperature. Sentence 3: Bobby had a bad fever. Sentence 4: She called Bobby in sick from school.
target: Bobby was happy to not go to school today.

input: Title: Bankrupt. Sentence 1: Chris was diagnosed with a small flu. Sentence 2: The doctor recommended that he took some time to rest. Sentence 3: A week later, the deadline for him to register for classes passed. Sentence 4: Chris tried to explain his situation to a guidance counselor.
target: She told him that he can't register for the upcoming term.

input: Title: Halloween. Sentence 1: The Smith family moved into a new house early in October. Sentence 2: They were very excited for Halloween. Sentence 3: To celebrate, they gave out full size candy bars. Sentence 4: Lots of children visited their house that year.
target: They can't wait for next year when they can decorate also.

input: Title: Meat. Sentence 1: Vince was a lifelong vegetarian. Sentence 2: He was curious about what meat tasted like. Sentence 3: One day, he bought a chicken from the store. Sentence 4: He spent all evening cooking it as best as he could.
target: After tasting it, he decided to stick with his vegetarian ways.

input: Title: Metabolism or illness. Sentence 1: Dylan was always hungry. Sentence 2: Despite eating a lot, he was considered thin for his build. Sentence 3: He visited the doctors to see what the issue was. Sentence 4: It turned out that Dylan had worms.
target: He was prescribed medicine to fix it and he soon gained some weight.

input: Title: Chinese For Dinner. Sentence 1: John was at home. Sentence 2: He was too lazy to cook today. Sentence 3: He decided to order something for dinner. Sentence 4: He called his favorite Chinese restaurant.
target: He ate Chinese food thirty minutes later.

input: Title: Trampoline.. Sentence 1: Carter's dad just bought him a new trampoline. Sentence 2: Him and Jim played on it all day yesterday. Sentence 3: While they were playing on it Jim fell off. Sentence 4: When Jim fell he skinned his knee.
target: Carter's parents put a bandaid on it and now Jim is ok!

input: Title: Old Sofa. Sentence 1: David needed a sofa for his apartment. Sentence 2: And he saw one at a yard sale. Sentence 3: He bought it despite its worn appearance. Sentence 4: But after using it for a few weeks, David felt sick.
target: He ended up throwing it away and buying a clean new sofa.

input: Title: Kinetic. Sentence 1: I bought a container of kinetic sand. Sentence 2: I started to play with it. Sentence 3: The sand felt good between my fingers. Sentence 4: I added a little glitter to give it some sparkle.
target: I mixed it in and rolled it around.

input: Title: Bob's Trash. Sentence 1: Bob had put the trash out. Sentence 2: He forgot to put a lid on the trash can. Sentence 3: A bunch of cats got into the trash. Sentence 4: They left trash all over Bob's yard.
target: Bob had to pick up the trash in the morning.

input: Title: Loving books. Sentence 1: Sophie loved her work at the local library. Sentence 2: She was surrounded by books all day. Sentence 3: She created a book club for kids. Sentence 4: She also read to them on weekends.
target: And when she went back home, she always had a good book to read.

input: Title: New Dog. Sentence 1: The kids had been wanting a dog. Sentence 2: They begged and begged their parents. Sentence 3: One day their parents took them to look at puppies. Sentence 4: They all fell in love with a black and white puppy.
target: They decided to adopt it into the family.

input: Title: Sunglasses. Sentence 1: I want to wear sunglasses to protect my eyes. Sentence 2: But I already wear glasses and they get in the way. Sentence 3: My grandfather found a solution for me. Sentence 4: He sent me clip-on sunglasses for my glasses.
target: They work great, but make me feel very old.

input: Title: Baby Brother. Sentence 1: Elaine was two years old when her little brother was born. Sentence 2: She held him at the hospital and gave him lots of kisses. Sentence 3: When Elaine's brother came home from the hospital he cried all night. Sentence 4: The next day Elaine said her baby brother was too loud.
target: She asked when he was going to go back to the hospital!

input: Title: Ten More. Sentence 1: Kate wanted to buy a lot of bottled water. Sentence 2: But only 2 bottles were on the shelf. Sentence 3: An employee checked the stock room for more. Sentence 4: He brought her ten more gallons of water.
target: Kate was so happy she almost hugged him.

input: Title: Fred buys a car. Sentence 1: Fred knew he needed a new car. Sentence 2: The one he had was starting to fall apart. Sentence 3: One day fred's old car blew up with the engine smoking. Sentence 4: Fred decided to get a tow truck to a dealership.
target: Fred found the first car he could see and signed the lease.

input: Title: Bug problem. Sentence 1: John was having spiders and centipede invade his home. Sentence 2: John was terrified of them. Sentence 3: John chose to face his fear and realized he wanted to get rid of them. Sentence 4: John bought insect spray and sprayed it around his house.
target: He saw many dead creatures and saw less of them in his household.

input: Title: Nail Polish Fiasco. Sentence 1: Claire was painting her nails. Sentence 2: As she was polishing her last nail, her cat came running. Sentence 3: It hit the bottle and knocked it over. Sentence 4: The bottle spilled all over her white carpet.
target: Claire now has a huge blue stain on her carpet.

input: Title: Ice Cream. Sentence 1: Jackson wanted ice cream. Sentence 2: He decided to make it himself. Sentence 3: He bought all the ingredients and a maker. Sentence 4: He followed his grandmother's recipe.
target: It turned out great.

input: Title: Shopping for gloves. Sentence 1: Cathy needed a new pair of gloves to play golf. Sentence 2: She headed to her country club store to buy some. Sentence 3: But on her way there, she met Matt who said they were not good. Sentence 4: He gave her a different address encouraging her to go there.
target: Cathy tried that new place and was delighted with the prices.

input: Title: Fired for Stealing. Sentence 1: Amanda was at work when her boss called her in for a meeting. Sentence 2: She was informed that she was being fired for stealing. Sentence 3: Amanda insisted that she hadn't stolen anything. Sentence 4: Then, her boss showed her a tape with evidence on it.
target: Amanda confessed and gracefully resigned.

input: Title: The RC Plane. Sentence 1: Stu wanted a certain radio controlled plane. Sentence 2: It wasn't cheap and he needed to save his money. Sentence 3: Stu saved all his money for months. Sentence 4: Eventually he had enough for the plane.
target: Stu went to the store and bought the plane.

input: Title: Make Up Your Mind. Sentence 1: I work as a freelance graphic designer. Sentence 2: I spent about two weeks working on various designs for a woman. Sentence 3: She sent me an email at the end of today. Sentence 4: She wants to go with the first design I did.
target: Turns out she liked it best, meaning I wasted hours of work.

input: Title: Thieves Apparent. Sentence 1: Tory was shopping with her brothers, she couldn't find anything. Sentence 2: After walking around, she noticed a man putting shoes into a bag. Sentence 3: She walked to an associate to tell them what was happening. Sentence 4: The associated listened, but then walked away.
target: When leaving, Tory saw two security guards pulling the man outside.

input: Title: The Fireman. Sentence 1: Clint was a young fireman. Sentence 2: He would often be the first person to report a fire. Sentence 3: The fire department investigated some suspicious fires. Sentence 4: They discovered that Clint had been setting fires.
target: Clint was sent to jail after being convicted of arson.

input: Title: Cockroach. Sentence 1: My grandma once accompanied me on a field trip. Sentence 2: She kindly made lunch for me. Sentence 3: As we were on the school bus, I started on my sandwich. Sentence 4: Stuck to the inside of the bread was a cockroach!
target: I didn't want to hurt my grandma's feelings so I ate the other half.

input: Title: Horses. Sentence 1: Kelly loved volunteering at the stables. Sentence 2: She was completing her high school charity requirement, 20 hours. Sentence 3: But it felt more like fun than work, feeding and grooming the horses! Sentence 4: When her 20 hours were complete, she could graduate.
target: And after graduation, the stable offered Kelly a full-time job!

input: Title: Kittens. Sentence 1: My husband found some kittens under our woodpile. Sentence 2: He dismantled the pile and got them out. Sentence 3: He brought them in the house! Sentence 4: I told him we couldn't take care of wild kittens.
target: He took them back and the mother moved them.

input: Title: Food. Sentence 1: Tim was a picky eater, and an unhappy person. Sentence 2: Tim went to a restaurant. Sentence 3: Tim ordered food. Sentence 4: Tim did not like the food.
target: Tim sent the food back and demanded a refund, causing a scene.

input: Title: Broken Arm. Sentence 1: Cain was going across the monkey bars. Sentence 2: He lost his grip and fell to the ground. Sentence 3: He felt a sharp pain in his arm, and called for help. Sentence 4: His teacher arrived, and he was taken to the hospital.
target: Cain had a broken arm and the nurse wrapped it in a cast.

input: Title: Quit Smoking. Sentence 1: Jack smoked a pack of cigarettes everyday. Sentence 2: His doctor told him he needed to quit smoking. Sentence 3: He tried quitting with nicotine patches, gum, and medication. Sentence 4: When nothing worked, he decided to use an electronic cigarette.
target: He was finally able to quit.

input: Title: Unhappy but Prepared.. Sentence 1: Alex dreaded the new school year starting. Sentence 2: She checked on the school supply list. Sentence 3: Alex took the bus to the mall to buy her supplies. Sentence 4: She found everything she needed in one trip.
target: Though she was unhappy about it she went to school well prepared.

input: Title: Baby Chicks. Sentence 1: Simon and his mom went to a farm out in the countryside. Sentence 2: They heard a beeping noise inside the barn. Sentence 3: Simon and his mom walked into the barn. Sentence 4: They saw an enclosure on the ground with a heating lamp on top.
target: Simon and his mom saw lots of baby chicks in there!

input: Title: Ice Cream Day. Sentence 1: Last Sunday was National Ice Cream Day. Sentence 2: To celebrate, we drove to a local ice cream shop. Sentence 3: We bought soft serve ice cream cones. Sentence 4: We took the cones home and sat on the bench outside.
target: I posted photos of our cones on Snapchat.

input: Title: Coupons. Sentence 1: Gary loved cutting coupons. Sentence 2: He collected them over time. Sentence 3: When he finally went shopping he used them all. Sentence 4: Gary would get a lot of things for a very low price.
target: It motivated him to keep using coupons.

input: Title: Belly Bumping. Sentence 1: My wife took the car in for service today. Sentence 2: There were two technicians at the store. Sentence 3: They were both portly. Sentence 4: One tech rubbed the other's belly.
target: My wife was amused by their antics.

input: Title: Surf's Up!. Sentence 1: Last weekend I grabbed my surfboard and went down to the beach. Sentence 2: It was really cold out so I had to wear my wetsuit. Sentence 3: When I got into the water I realized that it was warmer than the air. Sentence 4: I waited a long time for the perfect wave.
target: The perfect wave came towards me and I rode it happily to shore.

input: Title: Football. Sentence 1: Ayana was playing football in the park with her dad. Sentence 2: Suddenly the ball landed high up in an oak tree. Sentence 3: Her dad bravely scaled the tree. Sentence 4: Ayana held her breath, impressed but scared.
target: Thankfully, soon her dad came down unharmed - with her football!

input: Title: Jazz Bands. Sentence 1: Hank practiced his guitar to play in a jazz band. Sentence 2: He got on stage with the group for his first performance. Sentence 3: Hank was very nervous but thought he'd done well. Sentence 4: He looked into the audience to see what they thought.
target: They clapped in approval at what he'd played.

input: Title: Cold Pizza. Sentence 1: Sam was hung over one morning. Sentence 2: He didn't want to cook any breakfast. Sentence 3: The only food available was leftover pizza. Sentence 4: He was too lazy to even cook it.
target: He ate it cold and it was delicious.

input: Title: Edward. Sentence 1: Edward was lonely and wanted a girlfriend so he started dating. Sentence 2: He went on a date with a girl named Joy. Sentence 3: Edward liked her but she didn't like him so he got angry at her. Sentence 4: Joy told Edward he had an anger problem and needed help.
target: Edward discovered his anger prevented him from finding love.

input: Title: The Cuckold. Sentence 1: Phillip suspected his wife of cheating. Sentence 2: He decided to come home early from work to catch her. Sentence 3: He pulled the car into the driveway and cut the engine. Sentence 4: When he peeked in the window, he saw his wife watching Jeopardy.
target: Philip felt bad about the mistrust and went back to work.

input: Title: Failing Her Test Again. Sentence 1: Christina was twenty-one and didn't have a driver's license. Sentence 2: She made an appointment to take her driving test. Sentence 3: Then she practiced driving for a week. Sentence 4: In the car, at the start of her test, she had confidence she'd pass.
target: But when she turned left onto the street she faced oncoming traffic.

input: Title: Love with kids. Sentence 1: Kristi found it hard to date with three kids. Sentence 2: She could never find anyone who'd accept them. Sentence 3: One day, she went with her kids to their hairdresser. Sentence 4: The hairdresser was a nice man who liked her instantly.

input: Title: late to school. Sentence 1: Rey woke up late this morning. Sentence 2: Because of that,he's already late. Sentence 3: He took a bath quickly and did not even eat breakfast. Sentence 4: He packed his things and rush to come to school.
target: Then he noticed he left his id in their house.

target: He was laughing at Jim and Jim got upset and left the museum.

input: Title: Veteran. Sentence 1: I am having trouble finding steady employment. Sentence 2: I had been sent to fight the war in Iraq for almost a year. Sentence 3: My job there was to load the ammunition into the artillery. Sentence 4: I watched several of my comrades die there.

input: Title: Opinionated. Sentence 1: Charlotte was very opinionated. Sentence 2: Every time she thought something, she had to say it out loud. Sentence 3: It put her in tricky situation many times. Sentence 4: So when she was supposed to have a promotion at work, she changed.
