input: Title: Fire alarm. Sentence 1: Allie was taking the SAT test. Sentence 2: But all of the sudden the fire alarm went off. Sentence 3: Allie and her classmates ran outside. Sentence 4: Thankfully there was no fire however.
target: So Allie got to still finish her test.

input: Title: Surprise in the Watering Can. Sentence 1: Cindy saw that the watering can in her garden had fallen over. Sentence 2: She walked over to pick it up so that she could water her plants. Sentence 3: The watering can seemed heavy when she tried to lift it. Sentence 4: Suddenly a little kitten darted out of the can, surprising her!
target: The kitten had crawled into the watering can and fallen asleep.

input: Title: The Grey Sweater. Sentence 1: Devin wore her grey sweater all the time. Sentence 2: One day she went home from school on the bus. Sentence 3: Devin realized she didn't have her sweater when she got off. Sentence 4: She was very disappointed with herself.
target: The next day she got on the bus but the sweater was gone.

input: Title: Gumbo. Sentence 1: Sara loved gumbo. Sentence 2: She decided to cook some herself. Sentence 3: She found the perfect recipe. Sentence 4: She bought all the ingredients.
target: It turned out wonderfully.

input: Title: Shifts. Sentence 1: Since Elana moved back home, she and her sister have shared a bed. Sentence 2: They're both very tall adults and the bed is just full-sized. Sentence 3: When the weather warms, they find it hard to both sleep at once. Sentence 4: Eventually they settle on two shifts, morning and night.
target: Elana sleeps during the day, but they always have breakfast together.

input: Title: Failure. Sentence 1: Ant was angry that he had just failed his motorcycle license test. Sentence 2: But then he saw a bad accident involving a motorcycle. Sentence 3: He realized that failing meant he wasn't ready to drive a bike yet. Sentence 4: He knew it was better to be capable and safe.
target: Ant was no longer angry that he'd failed his test.

input: Title: Bad Grade. Sentence 1: Jon had always made good grades. Sentence 2: One day he forgot to study for a quiz. Sentence 3: When he got to class, he knew nothing. Sentence 4: He did the best he could and had to guess.
target: Jon still failed his quiz.

input: Title: Taxi. Sentence 1: I was sitting on the bench last month. Sentence 2: Our building bench is in front of a driveway. Sentence 3: A taxi was parked in the driveway, and the driver looked angry. Sentence 4: An old man came out and the driver said he was 30 minutes late.
target: The old man only smiled at the glaring taxi driver.

input: Title: Sweater. Sentence 1: Tara was from a country on the equator. Sentence 2: She had never felt a temperature of less than 70 degrees. Sentence 3: She had her first trip outside of the country. Sentence 4: She went to Canada.
target: You can bet the first thing she did there was buy a sweater.

input: Title: Set a wedding date. Sentence 1: Fred proposed to susie. Sentence 2: She said yes. Sentence 3: The two of them were very excited to get married. Sentence 4: But they couldn't decide on a date.
target: Finally they compromised for summertime.

input: Title: The Book Report. Sentence 1: Ken needed to write a book report. Sentence 2: He didn't want to. Sentence 3: A friend wrote it for him instead. Sentence 4: The teacher was suspicious about it.
target: He asked Ken questions about the book and found out the truth.

input: Title: Soggy. Sentence 1: Ian woke up starving. Sentence 2: So he made a massive bowl of cereal for himself. Sentence 3: But halfway through finishing it, it became very soggy. Sentence 4: And he had to finish the rest.
target: Ian was so upset, he threw his entire box of cereal out.

input: Title: Trip to the theater. Sentence 1: I went to the theatre yesterday. Sentence 2: It was amazingly fun. Sentence 3: I didn't want to leave. Sentence 4: However at one point we lost power.
target: We then got scared.

input: Title: Buy One Get One. Sentence 1: Tom always invited his co-workers to eat. Sentence 2: They all thought he was really nice for it. Sentence 3: Tom actually used coupons all the time. Sentence 4: He earned bonus points and rewards.
target: Meanwhile he earned brownie points from his co workers.

input: Title: A Birthday. Sentence 1: Ben was going home from work. Sentence 2: He was very tired. Sentence 3: All he could think about was to get some rest. Sentence 4: When he opened the door, his friends screamed "Surprise"!
target: It was his Birthday.

input: Title: Grades. Sentence 1: Terry was in school. Sentence 2: He got his grades for the semester. Sentence 3: He failed. Sentence 4: He was very upset.
target: He was determined to try harder.

input: Title: At Home. Sentence 1: Kaya was overweight and homely. Sentence 2: For years she was tormented in school, and begged her mom for help. Sentence 3: Finally her mom agreed to homeschool her. Sentence 4: For the first time, Kaya could focus on learning and not on hurt!
target: Kaya learned a lot, and she loved being taught at home.

input: Title: Picking What to Watch. Sentence 1: Jenny didn't know what to watch. Sentence 2: She kept scrolling through every option. Sentence 3: Nothing caught her attention. Sentence 4: Eventually she realized how late it was.
target: Jenny went to sleep without picking anything.

input: Title: Quick Essay. Sentence 1: Paul was writing an essay. Sentence 2: But his friend asked him to play video games. Sentence 3: So Paul decided to copy an entire essay off the Internet. Sentence 4: And his teacher didn't notice.
target: After getting an A, Paul ended up copying for every assignment.

input: Title: Costume Dilemma. Sentence 1: Ana's kids had the cutest Halloween costumes! Sentence 2: She didn't want them to have to hide or cover most of them with coats! Sentence 3: But the weather called for snow, so she had to get creative. Sentence 4: She found black thermals and dressed them UNDER the costumes.
target: These kept the kids warm-and still wickedly stylish!

input: Title: Working in Fast Food. Sentence 1: Amy worked in a fast food restaurant. Sentence 2: Every day she took orders through the drive through. Sentence 3: Most people were nice, but some of them were a little too nice. Sentence 4: One man asked Amy to marry him.
target: Instead, she asked him if he'd like fries with his proposal.

input: Title: Trash Bags. Sentence 1: Sam was taking out the trash. Sentence 2: On the way his bag tore open. Sentence 3: He tripped over the fallen trash. Sentence 4: Sam was really upset over it.
target: He didn't even bother to pick up any trash.

input: Title: New best friend. Sentence 1: Andrew was in the middle of a morning run when he heard a noise. Sentence 2: He stopped to look around. Sentence 3: In a tied up bag, he found an injured dog. Sentence 4: He immediately ran it to the vet.
target: Andrew now has a new friend who will grow up and run with him.

input: Title: Storage. Sentence 1: The government built a new underground storage facility. Sentence 2: They installed huge safety doors. Sentence 3: The safety doors got stuck. Sentence 4: They rammed the doors with trucks.
target: The doors would not budge.

input: Title: Fire. Sentence 1: Kara woke up to the loud alarms of smoke detectors going off. Sentence 2: She got out of bed. Sentence 3: Kara saw smoke coming under her bedroom door. Sentence 4: Kara escaped out the window.
target: Kara heard sirens from the fire truck approaching her house.

input: Title: Mean janitor. Sentence 1: There was a mean janitor at my school. Sentence 2: They never smiled at all. Sentence 3: All of the kids were afraid of him. Sentence 4: One day I walked up and thanked him for everything he did.
target: That made him smile for the first time ever.

input: Title: Joe's Joe. Sentence 1: Joe is well loved at the office where he works. Sentence 2: Every time the printer breaks it's Joe's job to fix it. Sentence 3: He can always figure out what the problem is. Sentence 4: His skill is valued, and he's compensated for it.
target: As long as he can fix the printer he gets free coffee.

input: Title: Thrift Store. Sentence 1: I had quite a few old clothes with stains and holes in them. Sentence 2: I packed them up and donated them to the thrift store. Sentence 3: One day, I decided to go into the thrift store for a look. Sentence 4: The clothes they were selling were much nicer than what I had donated.
target: I ended up buying several outfits that were on sale there.

input: Title: The Costume. Sentence 1: Tommy's family was rather poor. Sentence 2: He had wanted a fancy Halloween costume for a party at school. Sentence 3: Tommy knew his family couldn't afford the costume. Sentence 4: He decided to take bits of cardboard and make his own.
target: Tommy wore his handmade costume to school with pride.

input: Title: Surprise Rain. Sentence 1: Walter was watching the forecast. Sentence 2: It was supposed to be sunny. Sentence 3: Walter went out without his umbrella. Sentence 4: It began to rain.
target: Walter got soaked.

input: Title: Facebook Ban. Sentence 1: Kate rarely used Facebook. Sentence 2: One day at work she visited Facebook to see something on there. Sentence 3: But the site wouldn't load. Sentence 4: Tech support had blocked all social networking sites at her job.
target: That was the end of using Facebook at work.

input: Title: The casino. Sentence 1: I am so very mad at myself. Sentence 2: I went to the casino last night to play some free bonus they gave me. Sentence 3: I ended up spending a lot of money. Sentence 4: I am now short on some bills.
target: I will never do that again.

input: Title: Chess. Sentence 1: The man saw a friend at a coffee shop. Sentence 2: He challenged his friend to a game of chess. Sentence 3: His friend agreed. Sentence 4: His friend offered a bet.
target: They played a game for money.

input: Title: All for love. Sentence 1: Maryann doesn't like scary movies. Sentence 2: Her boyfriend is a huge fan of them. Sentence 3: She tries to watch them with him every now and then. Sentence 4: It doesn't end well for her.
target: She lays in bed awake for nights.

input: Title: The Washing Machine. Sentence 1: Tina loved the look of sundresses. Sentence 2: She wore dresses every day. Sentence 3: Her boss said she would need to wear long pants. Sentence 4: She had to go home and change into safer clothes.
target: She wishes she could still wear her fun dresses to work.

input: Title: Hey that isn't me. Sentence 1: Two twins were shopping. Sentence 2: One of the twins left the store stealing a coat. Sentence 3: The security man sees this and rushes to catch him. Sentence 4: The security man catches the innocent twin.
target: The innocent twin is taken to jail for a crime he didn't commit.

input: Title: Treatment. Sentence 1: Carly was diagnosed with a disease. Sentence 2: They said it was cancer. Sentence 3: She began to worry. Sentence 4: They told her she would be fine.
target: She began treatment.

input: Title: The Wading Pool. Sentence 1: Dori took her young kids to the park. Sentence 2: They were going to play in the wading pool. Sentence 3: The toddlers waded in. Sentence 4: The water was cool and refreshing.
target: They had fun for hours!

input: Title: Steve Drinks Juice. Sentence 1: Steve had a habit of drinking coffee every day before work. Sentence 2: However he wanted to decrease his intake of caffeine. Sentence 3: One morning he decided to have orange juice instead. Sentence 4: He found it delicious.
target: Steve was happy that he was drinking less coffee.

input: Title: Orange Robe Scam. Sentence 1: I read in the news that monks in orange robes were in Boston. Sentence 2: They were in Quincy Market asking for money. Sentence 3: The police issued a warning saying these were imposters. Sentence 4: I sent an email to my kids telling them I am buying an orange robe.
target: My daughter said she was not surprised.

input: Title: The Frog Pond. Sentence 1: Morgan loved walking down to the frog pond. Sentence 2: She would take a net and a bucket. Sentence 3: She'd scoop them up and take them home. Sentence 4: She gave each frog a name.
target: Once she had collected five, she let them go.

input: Title: S'Mores. Sentence 1: Kayla was camping with her friends, and they were making s'mores. Sentence 2: But they got to chatting about scary stories and were distracted. Sentence 3: Then Kayla smelled something burning. Sentence 4: It was their s'mores!
target: Everyone was disappointed that that'd burned their tasty snack!

input: Title: Apples and eggs. Sentence 1: I was cooking for a party. Sentence 2: My friend had an idea for a great treat. Sentence 3: He said to mix apples and scrambled eggs. Sentence 4: I tried it just to see what it was like.
target: The smell was so bad that people ran out of the party.

input: Title: Basketball match. Sentence 1: Allie had her friend over. Sentence 2: They decided to play some basketball. Sentence 3: Allie was winning at first. Sentence 4: Then her friend Stacy won.
target: Allie then demanded a rematch.

input: Title: Nick's babysitter. Sentence 1: Nick's mom worked in a Head Start classroom. Sentence 2: One day Nick's babysitter quit. Sentence 3: Nick's mom needed to find a new babysitter. Sentence 4: The bus driver offered to babysit Nick.
target: Now Nick rides the school bus all afternoon.

input: Title: Pregnancy Scare. Sentence 1: Jane was married. Sentence 2: Her husband had a vasectomy. Sentence 3: She missed her period a couple of times. Sentence 4: Jane became scared she was pregnant.
target: Luckily that wasn't the case.

input: Title: Lost Money. Sentence 1: Brenda was in the bakery buying bread. Sentence 2: She handed over a $50 bill to the cashier to pay. Sentence 3: She got the chance and went out of the store. Sentence 4: The wind was so strong that it took the money away.
target: She tried to catch it but it was gone.

input: Title: Free Trial. Sentence 1: Tom signed up for a free online trial. Sentence 2: He had to give over his credit card information. Sentence 3: Tom forgot about the trial after a while. Sentence 4: He was soon charged on his card for it.
target: Tom cancelled it immediately after.

input: Title: The Missing Sewing Material. Sentence 1: Tammy enjoys sewing clothing. Sentence 2: She notices her husband's pants have a hole in them. Sentence 3: Tammy starts sewing them up. Sentence 4: She runs out of sewing material before finishing.
target: She finds more sewing material under her chair.

input: Title: Summer Vacation. Sentence 1: The Sheltons wanted to go to the beach for the summer. Sentence 2: They found a house to rent right on the beach. Sentence 3: The kids played on the beach all day and found sea shells. Sentence 4: The parents had a great time relaxing on the beach.
target: When it was time to go home, they were sad but had many good memories!

input: Title: Sickness. Sentence 1: Mara began to puke as she had been feeling ill. Sentence 2: Her mom held her until the heaves subsided. Sentence 3: Mara was sweating so her mom wiped her brow. Sentence 4: Mara sat up and smiled at her mom.
target: She thanked her mom and lay back down.

input: Title: Tea. Sentence 1: Tom was expecting company. Sentence 2: Tom wanted to be a good host. Sentence 3: Tom prepared tea. Sentence 4: Tom served the tea.
target: Tom's guests liked the tea very much.

input: Title: Julie's College. Sentence 1: Julie moved away from home to go to college. Sentence 2: She came back home every weekend to see her boyfriend. Sentence 3: They missed each other very much when she was away. Sentence 4: She dropped out of the college away from home.
target: She enrolled in the local university instead.

input: Title: Forgive and Forget. Sentence 1: Jim decided he was going to try to forgive and forget. Sentence 2: His neighbor had really slighted him throughout the years. Sentence 3: Jim felt he could be a bigger man about it. Sentence 4: He set the neighbor's house on fire and urinated in his gas tank.
target: Jim forgave himself for it and forgot all about the neighbor.

input: Title: Ice cream. Sentence 1: Eating cold things too quickly gave Bob headaches. Sentence 2: Today, Bob made a plan to eat his ice cream sundae slowly. Sentence 3: Bob wore oven mitts taped closed at his wrists. Sentence 4: Getting the spoonful of ice cream to his mouth was a slow process.
target: His plan to eat his sundae slowly had worked.

input: Title: Wrong Change. Sentence 1: A man at a baseball game flagged down a hot dog vendor on the stairs. Sentence 2: The vendor handed the man his hot dog and asked for money. Sentence 3: The man pulled out the money from his pocket without looking. Sentence 4: The vendor thanked the man and left.
target: The man realized once he left that he gave the vendor too much money.

input: Title: Duke and the Peanut Butter Sandwich. Sentence 1: My first dog was a poodle terrier mix, crazy looking mutt, but smart. Sentence 2: Once, we were in my club house and my mom brought us PBJ sandwiches. Sentence 3: Now, Duke had an allergy to grass and needed a benadryl pill daily. Sentence 4: So my mom put the pill on a sandwich she brought us, to trick him.
target: He was so smart he found the pill, licked it off, and spit it out!

input: Title: Working late.. Sentence 1: Sammy was excited about the football game on television. Sentence 2: Everyone in the office we're looking forward to the game. Sentence 3: Sammy told his wife he was going to work late. Sentence 4: Sammy went to the bar to watch the game.
target: Sammy was very surprised to see his wife was in the bar with friend.

input: Title: Freckling in the sun. Sentence 1: Thomas didn't like that he freckled so easily. Sentence 2: Five minutes in the sun and he looked like a strawberry. Sentence 3: He worked all day in the sun so after a month it was worse. Sentence 4: No one recognized him anywhere he went.
target: And he had to wait winter until his skin faded to white again.

input: Title: Pool. Sentence 1: All the kids went to the pool. Sentence 2: They were having fun splashing around. Sentence 3: But then the one kid went to get out. Sentence 4: But his swimsuit started to fall down.
target: He got so embarrassed and teased by his friends.

input: Title: The Heavy Pizza. Sentence 1: Susan was having a pizza night with her family. Sentence 2: She walked to a local take and bake shop to order the food. Sentence 3: She tried to carry all the pizzas, breads and drink in her arms. Sentence 4: It was heavy but she managed and slowly began walking home.
target: She barely made it home before her arms were to worn out to help.

input: Title: The Plumber. Sentence 1: Brad had a leak under his bathtub. Sentence 2: His kitchen filled with water! Sentence 3: A plumber came over right away to fix it. Sentence 4: Soon the pipes were fixed.
target: Brad took a bath to forget about the huge hole in the ceiling.

input: Title: Larry wins the game. Sentence 1: Larry is playing in a basketball game. Sentence 2: His team is losing by 3 points. Sentence 3: Larry makes a two pointer. Sentence 4: Larry makes a three pointer.
target: Larry won the game with his clutch playing.

input: Title: Spot's day out. Sentence 1: Jake was given a new puppy for his birthday. Sentence 2: He named the puppy Spot. Sentence 3: One day Jake took Spot for a walk through the park. Sentence 4: Spot hurt his paw while they were playing.
target: Jake took Spot home early.

input: Title: Gross Muffins. Sentence 1: Kat baked a batch of muffins. Sentence 2: They turned out horrible. Sentence 3: She thought it would be funny to offer some to her friend. Sentence 4: Kat's friend ate the muffin as not to be rude.
target: Kat thought it was hilarious her friend ate the yucky muffin.

input: Title: Essay. Sentence 1: Liz was assigned an essay to write. Sentence 2: She knew it was due in two weeks. Sentence 3: Two weeks later, Liz got to class. Sentence 4: Her teacher asked for the essay.
target: Liz had forgotten to write hers and got a zero.

input: Title: A Hard Job. Sentence 1: We have a new mail man today, he came and delivered a package. Sentence 2: He was really excited to have this new job, he said. Sentence 3: As he walked to the neighbor's house, I saw their dog was out. Sentence 4: I noticed the mailman didn't see him and walked right up to the house.
target: The dog jumped out and bit him, I think he isn't going to come back.

input: Title: Tom. Sentence 1: Tom wanted a new pair of tennis shoes for school but he had no money. Sentence 2: He worked odd jobs around the neighborhood to earn extra cash. Sentence 3: Sometimes he took out trash or mowed someone's yard. Sentence 4: His hardest job was to get a cat down from a tree.
target: He was able to earn enough money for two pairs of new shoes.

input: Title: Yard Work. Sentence 1: Rick decided to create a new garden in the yard. Sentence 2: He got to work pulling up ivy to clear space. Sentence 3: In the ivy he kept finding tennis balls the dog had lost. Sentence 4: He started keeping a pile of all the balls he found.
target: Rick ended up with more tennis balls than flowers.

input: Title: Spray Paint. Sentence 1: Stan's wooden deck needed to be repainted. Sentence 2: He spent four days painting the large deck. Sentence 3: Stan had to paint on his hands and knees. Sentence 4: He was so proud of his deck that he showed it to his friend, Andy.
target: Andy said he had a paint sprayer that would've done the job in hours.

input: Title: Puberty. Sentence 1: Luke was twelve years old when he started feeling changes. Sentence 2: He didn't understand why he was growing hair in strange places. Sentence 3: He was almost embarrassed with the way he felt towards girls. Sentence 4: He thought he was sick.
target: His dad told him it was just part of life and he went through it too.

input: Title: The Mud. Sentence 1: Earl owned a small farm. Sentence 2: One day, it rained for nine hours straight. Sentence 3: Earl's farm was a total mud pit! Sentence 4: He tried to drive his truck, but it just got stuck in the mud.
target: Earl decided to stay home until it dried out.

input: Title: The limo. Sentence 1: I was going on a special date. Sentence 2: I wanted to rent a limo so it would be a night to remember. Sentence 3: The limo was extremely expensive. Sentence 4: I decided I wouldn't have enough money.
target: I actually ended up having fun going in a regular car.

input: Title: Not Enough Money. Sentence 1: Tom was buying some fast food. Sentence 2: When it was time to pay he was short a few cents. Sentence 3: Unfortunately Tom was unable to find the money in his pocket. Sentence 4: The worker was cool, though.
target: They let Tom have the food anyway.

input: Title: Martin's Beer. Sentence 1: Martin decided to brew his own beer. Sentence 2: He bought everything he needed. Sentence 3: His first beer was not very good. Sentence 4: His friends got sick from it.
target: He was very unhappy.

input: Title: Excuses. Sentence 1: Walter was in detention. Sentence 2: He wanted to get out bad. Sentence 3: So he made up an excuse. Sentence 4: He said that his mom was in the hospital.
target: And so he got out of detention.

input: Title: Dirty Room. Sentence 1: Ralph was playing videogames in the living room. Sentence 2: His mother then asked if he had cleaned his room yet. Sentence 3: He pretended not to hear. Sentence 4: Ralph's mother repeated the question, louder this time.
target: Ralph groaned and began to roll on the floor.

input: Title: The birthday gift.. Sentence 1: Marcus wanted to give his Mom a great birthday gift. Sentence 2: He just couldn't figure out what to give her. Sentence 3: He called his sister for suggestions. Sentence 4: His sister overheard their mom gawking over a vacation spot.
target: Marcus decided to get that for his mom and she was thrilled.

input: Title: Newbie. Sentence 1: Susie was new at school. Sentence 2: She was nervous. Sentence 3: She was afraid she would make no friends. Sentence 4: Thankfully she did.
target: Susie was happy she did.

input: Title: Morning time. Sentence 1: Every morning Greg enjoyed a cup of coffee while sitting on his deck. Sentence 2: One morning he was sitting there when a yellow finch flew by. Sentence 3: He had never seen the little yellow bird before. Sentence 4: He went to the store and got finch food.
target: Now, the finch stops everyday and eats out of the feeder.

input: Title: A Natural. Sentence 1: Will had never played tennis before. Sentence 2: A tennis coach friend invited Will to a friendly match. Sentence 3: Will was nervous as they started to play. Sentence 4: Will found himself doing very well on the court.
target: Will actually won the tennis match!

input: Title: Going to Confession. Sentence 1: Denise wasn't very religious. Sentence 2: After some hardships she turned to god. Sentence 3: ONe of the first things she did was go to confession. Sentence 4: She felt weird and nervous at first.
target: After she felt relieved and confident.

input: Title: Pickpocketed. Sentence 1: Preston went to the big city to visit some friends. Sentence 2: He decided to walk around and do some sight seeing. Sentence 3: Somehow he got himself lost. Sentence 4: Frustrated, he stopped a female jogger and asked for directions.
target: Ater he told his friends what happened, he noticed his wallet was gone.

input: Title: Perks. Sentence 1: George traveled a lot for his job. Sentence 2: He would board airplanes every week to cities across the country. Sentence 3: As a result, George was well-known and respected at many airports. Sentence 4: He would always get to skip lines and sit first class.
target: George decided he had the perfect job.

input: Title: Dim Sum. Sentence 1: We used to buy dim sum from a restaurant in Allston. Sentence 2: Recently the restaurant moved. Sentence 3: We have searching for dim sum restaurants in our area. Sentence 4: We found one in Belmont.
target: Sadly, they do not make the dim sum dishes we like.

input: Title: Louise. Sentence 1: Louise has a nice house in the city. Sentence 2: Louise likes to collect things. Sentence 3: The house got very full of odd items. Sentence 4: Her boyfriend threatened to move out because of all the junk.
target: Louise sold all her stuff on the internet and made some money.

input: Title: Wormy Apple. Sentence 1: Erin went to the local farm. Sentence 2: They had a pick-your-own special for apples that day. Sentence 3: She went and picked several ripe, red apples from the trees. Sentence 4: When she bit into one, though, she also bit into a worm inside it!
target: Erin didn't want to eat any apples for a long time after that.

input: Title: New taco place. Sentence 1: Allie loved tacos. Sentence 2: But unfortunately she had no taco places near her. Sentence 3: But to her surprise a place was opening up. Sentence 4: The opening day she was first in line.
target: When she tried the taco it was amazing.

input: Title: Good First Date. Sentence 1: Ken's friends set him up on a date. Sentence 2: The girl was pretty and they hit it off. Sentence 3: They both had similar interests and had good conversations. Sentence 4: Ken asked her for a second date and she agreed.
target: They kept dating until they got married and had kids.

input: Title: The Soup. Sentence 1: Terrell was a great chef. Sentence 2: He made some soup for his girlfriend. Sentence 3: She had been sick but the soup made her feel better. Sentence 4: She told Terrell to write down the recipe for her.
target: She planned on making it again, it was so delicious!

input: Title: The Big Test. Sentence 1: John was nervous about his science test at school the next day. Sentence 2: He stayed up all night and studied very hard. Sentence 3: He woke up late the next day and didn't have time to eat. Sentence 4: He raced to school and sat down nervously.
target: All the studying paid off and John aced his test.

input: Title: Chips. Sentence 1: I wanted to save a little money at the store. Sentence 2: I knew the kids wanted doritos. Sentence 3: I saw a bag of doritos styled generic chips. Sentence 4: They were only a dollar, so I bought them.
target: The kids took one bite and I could tell they were disgusting.

input: Title: Novel. Sentence 1: Nora wrote a novel. Sentence 2: She shopped it around to a few publishers. Sentence 3: At her third stop, her book was accepted. Sentence 4: Nora was thrilled!
target: She couldn't wait to see her book in print.

input: Title: The March. Sentence 1: Dozens of people had gathered downtown. Sentence 2: They were marching against police brutality. Sentence 3: They held signs and chanted. Sentence 4: They were passionate about their cause.
target: The police commissioner agreed to meet with them.

input: Title: Call Back. Sentence 1: Sam needed to settle some affairs. Sentence 2: He called the business line but nobody answered. Sentence 3: He left a message hoping to get a call back. Sentence 4: Surprisingly they called back in a timely fashion.
target: Sam was able to work through his issues.

input: Title: How. Sentence 1: She didn't understand how it happened. Sentence 2: She sat down in a state of shock. Sentence 3: She had tried so hard to save him. Sentence 4: She burst into tears.
target: She knew she would have to let him go.
